items.content:
The Role

A tenacious, passionate and talented Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is required to join a well established, expanding and innovative Software House in the idyllic setting of Pembrokeshire. As the Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) you will join a multi skilled Web Applications Team and be involved in maintaining, extending and improving website framework, designed for re-use across multiple stores and sales channels. As well as this, you will be building brand new web applications from the ground up. This role has the potential to be within a leadership capacity, dependent on your experience and you will be provided with lots of opportunity to grow.

As the Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) you'll collaborate with colleagues, clients and other vendors to work out the best solutions to the ever-changing needs of a growing client base whilst working to keep them at the cutting edge of technology. Within your role as Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript).

Are you an Object Orientated Developer that posses transferable, good developer skills?

Are you the person that will be continually 'playing with' things, to ensure that you are using the best one for the task at hand? You will have the opportunity to expand your knowledge and experience in new and exciting technologies that you are interested in through lots of R&D time - specifically in the following technologies: NodeJS, React or Vue.


Role Essentials


  • Experience using OOP.
  • Experience working with PHP Frameworks, eg. Laravel, Symfony, Zend
  • You have a deep understanding of object oriented programming and design patterns
  • You know HTML inside out and have worked with some HTML APIs
  • Experience working with Cloud Tchnologies including AWS
  • You're comfortable with CSS and have experience with pre-processors eg. SASS
  • Commercial experience working on large scale projects where you have shown good decision making

Role Desirables

  • eCommerce and Payment Gateways
  • NodeJS experience
  • Javascript Frameworks, eg. AngularJS, React
  • Automated testing
  • Caching systems, eg. Memcached, Redis
  • Degree in Computer Science - recent graduates welcome

The Company

An award-winning, successful and friendly place to work, where you are given a good degree of autonomy to design and develop solutions. Teams collaborate and share ideas freely, and hierarchy and bureaucracy is kept to a minimum. In addition to the technical stuff, you'll collaborate with your peers, clients, and other vendors to work out solutions, find the quick wins, and diagnose problems.

As well as a generous salary offering you will receive benefits such as flexible working hours, remote working options, unlimited tea and coffee, onsite canteen, free lunch every Friday, state of the art hardware and the opportunity to take part in regular hackathons, plus much more!


Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) - PEMBROKE - + Additional benefits package including flexible working hours, Remote working, progression scheme, Healthcare, Annual Hackathons

Oscar Technology is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Pembrokeshire
Permanent
£25,000 - £45,000 a year

items.content:
Junior Front End Developer Required for Fast Growing Digital Healthcare/Sport Start up

Organisational Profile:

Sportsinjuryfix.com was set up in response to the problems of the fragmented and siloed private practice rehab market. Therapists (physios, sports therapists etc) are trained to treat not run so need support to reach their business and clinical goals. Equally, as it’s such a confusing market the average member of the public sees three of more therapists before they find the right one costing them a lot of time money and frustration.

With increasing NHS delays and a population that is having to be more active the demand for private practice treatment is increasing every day. Therapists benefit from technical solutions we provide to make their job easier, more efficient and more effective.

We are fully funded, revenue generating and fast growing.

The role will involve:

You would be working with a highly experienced Technical Director on an exciting fast-growing platform business using advanced cloud technologies.

Your role would live and breathe the front end, implementing new features whilst maintaining and improving existing ones. We work very much as a team with the business and the technical side working closely together and a flat management structure so all views and opinions are valued.Whilst initially the role would be office based to get up to speed then we are big believers in the work getting done in the most effective way so there are opportunities for remote and flexible working.

Required:

  • You are competent in VueJS and Axios. Other reactive frameworks are accepted, but VueJS is our choice.
  • You see the limitations of jQuery and are keen to step away from it (or avoid it).
  • You have good experience with either Foundation, Bootstrap, Tailwind, or any other such framework.
  • You are annoyed by inconsistencies. Why is the primary button on the left, whereas it’s on the right everywhere else? Why is the margin 6rem here where it’s 4rem there?
  • You test in all browsers and think mobile-first. Microsoft Edge is a big improvement but still has its little fusses.
  • You have your own side projects which you’d love to show us.
  • You know your way around the element inspector or have a wealth of tools you prefer to use to really see what’s going on.
  • You are familiar, but careful with NPM, Yarn etc. We won’t expect you to define the toolchain as we have one, but feel free to improve it. Likewise, you give each library careful consideration rather than wildly installing dependencies.
  • You use js-lint, css-lint, though we can get you up to speed with these if not.

What you can expect from us:

  • We love being up to date with current frameworks and approaches. We learn from and teach each other such.
  • You will gain very strong industry experience with expected front-end tools under your belt. If this sounds like you already, your tools will be sharpened.
  • A fun, ambitious team with a lot of interesting features on the way which you will be a core part of.
  • Whilst we work hard, we also respect working smart rather than long. A nasty case of burnout won’t get us very far.

Benefits:

  • Flexible working: time and location
  • Pension
  • An amazing office right next to Cardiff Central Station with all the benefits that brings including free tea/coffee etc.
  • Healthcare: free physiotherapy treatment and personal training.

Salary

  • £22,000-£25,000 dependent on experience

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £22,000.00 to £25,000.00 /year

Experience:

  • Web Development: 1 year (Preferred)
  • VueJs: 1 year (Preferred)
  • JavaScript: 1 year (Preferred)
Cardiff CF10
£22,000 - £25,000 a year

items.content:
A little bit about us:


Here at LoyaltyLion we’re shaking up the way ecommerce retailers do business. We’ve grown from a company of 8 to 35 in the last two years, and  from 300 retailers using our platform to over 6000 today to power their loyalty programs!


The role:


We are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join the team here at LoyaltyLion. This is a role for someone who wants to ship code and have a tangible impact on our team, and product.


You will be working across our entire platform, from our merchant-facing web apps to our speedy third-party widgets. There’s ample opportunity to own certain product areas and really carve out your own niche.


Everything we build has a purpose and adds value.  Our services are backed by strong test suites and we strive to make our deployment process as deterministic as possible (we use Docker, ECS and Terraform) and deploy at a rate of 5+ times per day.


We use Typescript and Ruby + Sorbet to ship robust and reliable code, and we have a technical Team Lead who is great at removing blockers and will enable you to produce your best work.


In the last year our team of Software Engineers have rebuilt our customer UI from the ground up and have put us in a great place to make future improvements.


Some of the things you'll be doing:



  • Writing clean, robust, well-tested code

  • Working on technical integrations with our partners such as Bronto and Dotdigital

  • Scaling our platform to work with the largest ecommerce stores

  • Turning lots of data into useful insights for our merchants

  • Helping us dream up and implement awesome new features



What we’re looking for:



  • You’ve owned and lead the delivery of substantial projects in Typescript

  • Experience as a senior or lead engineer in a team

  • Autonomous and pragmatic: you know when to refactor and when to accrue debt

  • Desire to have an immediate impact on our platform, and the team around you

  • Other nice to haves: Postgres, AWS, Docker




Why LoyaltyLion?



  • Structured career progression – we will lay the tracks for your own personal development.

  • Macbook, keyboard of your choice, and any other tech or equipment you need to do a great job

  • 25 days holiday + bank holidays + carry 13 days holiday over into the next holiday year

  • Flexible hours and remote working

  • Free breakfast and lunch on Mondays

  • Company days out (Crystal Maze experience and London treasure hunt to name a couple)

  • Fun working environment in a brand new office in Hatton Garden with a lovely roof terrace

  • Refreshments on tap; drinks, food, fruit, snacks and a host of entertainment facilities from consoles, to board games and table tennis


Up to £85,000 per annum + options

    About X-Team

    We believe in living a life of freedom that allows you to spend more time staying energized by doing more of what makes you come alive.

    If you want to be motivated to learn, grow and explore in an environment rooted in respect and positive energy, X-Team is where you belong. Join us and our community of developers from 40+ countries around the world as we continue to build the most energizing community for developers.

    Watch this video from our CEO to learn more about the X-Team experience and the inspiration behind it.

Use it on conferences, courses, video games, photography gear, music gear, cooking gear, a gym membership, adventure sports, baby/pet sitting, productivity apps, restaurants, coworking, movie tickets, headphones, etc.

If you've worked with freelancing platforms before, that's not what we are. X-Team is a community of all likeminded people, carefully chosen to ensure we are able to create an environment of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we've created is truly special and not a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together, while becoming more motivated and energized than they've ever been.

Senior Full Stack Developer, Javascript [REMOTE]

About this job

javascript

node.js
sql
redux

Job description

** This is a senior-level position, we are not currently considering candidates who do not meet the minimum requirements listed below.
---

What is Required:

- B.S. in Computer Science preferred
- Minimum 3 years of professional experience  (A technical assessment will be required)
- Clearly communicate complex concepts verbally in English
- Full Stack implies a broader vision. You have demonstrated using your full stack abilities to serve the business need
- Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in North American time zones


What you’ll do:

- Code in Javascript (Node, React) while choosing modern libraries to develop in
- Collaborate with your friendly, enthusiastic and senior teammates
- Create clean, modern, testable, well-documented code each sprint
- Use github, zenhub and burndown charts to manage the development
- Confidently communicate daily with clients to understand and deliver technical requirements

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Clevertech Culture Video

Wondering how Clevertech has a successful remote workforce numbering more than 150 staff, without tracking and monitoring? Check out our most recent blog post: https://www.clevertech.biz/thoughts/rr-delivering-for-clients-employees 



Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work

Getting Hired

We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers and our video highlighting Clevertech's Culture

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend

Company: Clevertech | No office location

react
redux
javascript

react-redux

Job description

This is a senior-level position, we are not currently considering candidates who do not meet the minimum requirements listed below.

Languages/Frameworks/Tools You’re Likely to Use:

  • React, Redux (Saga), Websockets, Async/Await

Basic Requirements:

  • B.S. in Computer Science, or comparable field experience
  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience (A technical assessment will be required)
  • Native-level English; ability to clearly communicate complex concepts verbally
  • Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in North American time zones

Expected timeline:

We move quickly. If you are the right person, we want you here. We’ve moved from application to hire in 1-2 weeks time.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Set yourself up for success and take a look at our Interview Process prior to filling out your application.

Clevertech's Career Growth Video

Wondering how Clevertech has a successful remote workforce numbering more than 150 staff, without tracking and monitoring? Check out our most recent blog post: https://www.clevertech.biz/thoughts/rr-delivering-for-clients-employees 

Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

items.content:
Working Student or Intern – Sports Journalist – French native (m/f/x) // MonsterTipp

Company: MonsterTipp

Tags:
  • SEO
  • Online Marketing
  • French
  • Editor
  • Sports

    • About our company:

    MonsterTipp helps the biggest publishers in Germany (Bild.de, Focus.de) to provide their readers with the best coverage on sports statistics, match predictions and betting tips, ranging from Football to MMA. Based in Berlin, we are a young team of curious marketing specialists, sports fans and tech-enthusiasts eager to change the affiliate marketing landscape and help not only our users with higher transparency but also increase reach and monetization for our partners. Help us grow our community across borders by providing the best pre-match coverage, predictions and unique insights into statistics of the players, teams, and competitions to millions of people around the globe.

    What you can expect:

    • Write engaging content for sports fans in France
    • Work side-by-side with the editorial team
    • Plan and execute SEO optimizations for evergreen landing pages
    • Research data and news to create interesting predictions and insights for our community

    What we are looking for:

    • Native French speaker, fluency in English (German is a plus, but not required)
    • Relevant experience in copywriting through previous work experience or your studies
    • Interest in online sports coverage of football (and/or tennis, cycling, rugby)
    • Commitment to high-quality content and the ability to work independently

    Requirements: 

    • You must currently be enrolled in a first-degree program (1st Bachelor or 1st Master) at a university located in the EU to fulfill the working student criteria
    • Native french speaker, fluency in English (German is a plus but not mandatory)
    • Research and basic analytical skills
    • Self-disciplined with the ability to prioritize, manage time effectively
    • Competent in using Excel/Google Sheets and Word/Google Docs

    What we offer: 

    • A great deal of self-responsibility in a laid back yet challenging work environment
    • Flat hierarchy and open communication
    • Flexible work hours, remote or in our office
    • Fresh Fruits, coffee, water, beer in our office in the heart of Berlin (Kreuzberg) with the best lunch options of the city in close proximity
    Apply for this position

items.content:
Badass Software Agency Seeks Awesome React Native Engineer

 
About Us:
We are searching to partner with someone knowledgeable to work alongside our team. We are a small shop based in New York. We work entirely remotely and strive to maintain a personal, flexible, but also fast paced work environment. We have a strong belief in remote culture and agile development. Our goal is to provide top quality work for clients. We work on an extremely wide variety of projects. 

About Our Technologies:
We believe in using the right tool for the job. We work in modern technology stacks like  
React Native, Node, Rails, Python,  and many more. For this particular project, we’re searching for someone who can work effectively in React Native















We are looking for a contractor who:
  • Takes responsibility for and drives projects where appropriate
  • Will work with our experienced development team to produce high quality solutions
  • Will work directly with our client, who will be interacting with your work daily
  • Communicates openly and often, using tools such as Slack















About You:
  • Strong experience with React Native
  • Rails or Node backend experience is a plus; but not required
  • Able to integrate yourself into the client’s development lifecycle
  • Thrive in a dynamic environment where we embrace change
  • Think deeply and enthusiastically about software as a finished product; take pride in your work!

items.title: Strong Generalist Who is Very Good at Python at Conducto
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=6, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=18}
items.content:
Strong Generalist Who is Very Good at Python

New York, New York, United States
Company: Conducto
Job Type: Full-time

We are a startup developing a serverless pipeline orchestration and execution framework. It scales seamlessly from a handful of tasks to millions. Conducto empowers data scientists and developers go from pipeline idea to massively parallel and easily debugged execution with minimal friction.

Prior to forming Conducto, we spent 10 years building the software that powered one of the most successful algorithmic trading teams in the world. We were really really good. We succeeded because we built a team of technically strong, driven generalists who were excited to solve challenging problems. We are re-creating that dynamic with our core team at Conducto.

We have front-end, back-end, and cloud infrastructure tasks to be done. We need motivated developers who can think critically and are not afraid to learn. You don't need to be a domain expert in any area, but you do need to be rock solid in Python. We currently use Python, Docker, Linux, and AWS on the back-end, and Javascript, React, and Redux on the front-end.

Our team is currently spread between the East Coast and Hawai`i, and we have a remote-first culture. We also have an office in NYC if you are located there.

If you are excited to:

  • work with a team of solid and driven generalists
  • build a highly available web app with non-trivial cloud infrastructure
  • find the balance between building beautiful abstractions and actually deliver a product
  • be one of the first employees at an exciting startup

then we encourage you to apply to join us.

We don't care where you went to school or what companies you have worked at. We aren't impressed by big names and buzzwords. We care about finding people who are great developers, are passionate to build this company, and will lean-in to a warm and collaborative company culture. We hope you will be a good match for the team.

Desired Skills

  • Backend Development
  • Fullstack Development
  • JavaScript
  • ReactJS
  • Redux

Contact Info

  • Company Website: https://www.conducto.com/
Apply

items.content:
Front-End Web Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Biotechnology, Data Science, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Exputec GmbH | Budapest, Ungarn

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Budapest
Office Location: Budapest, Ungarn. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

angular
typescript
css
html
javascript

Job description

As part of an interdisciplinary team (software developers, biotechnologists, statisticians) you will develop and implement beautiful and easy-to-use front ends for professional users working in the biotech industry.

Based on an existing, state-of-the-art software framework, you will use your skills to develop new features and improve existing functionalities for the purpose of data science. You will actively progress and shape the development of cutting edge software products by combining your technical and design skills.

The following qualifications are expected:

  • At least 3 years hands-on experience with front-end development and web design
  • Practical experience with JavaScript, HTML, CSS and web frameworks like Angular or React
  • A good understanding of client/server communication methodologies (REST, WebSocket)
  • Practical experience with software development basics like source code management systems and issue tracking
  • You’re enthusiastic about good design, aesthetics and users in focus
  • Proficient in professional English to engage in deep technical discussions with international colleagues
  • And most important: You are eager to learn new things.
Apply now

About Exputec GmbH

An interdisciplinary team of software engineers, biotechnologists, data scientists, and mathematicians is working together to work on data science frameworks and tools for the biotechnological industry.

Benefits

  • State of the art tech stack
  • Highly motivated colleagues
  • Learn new things
  • Self-reliant work
  • (Optional) remote work

items.content:
Full Stack Developer

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Junior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Travel & Tourism
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Keesy srl | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Rome

Technologies

php
laravel
mysql
angularjs

Job description

We are looking for a freelance full stack developer for the development and maintenance of a platform with MySQL stack PHP (Laravel) AngularJs / VueJS.

Preferable experience 1-3 years of development with:

  • PHP experience: 2+ years,
  • AngularJs experience: 1+ years,
  • Knowledge of Laravel 5.4 or higher platform,
  • Knowledge of the Git versioning system
  • Knowledge of MySQL databases
  • Knowledge API Rest
  • Understanding of responsive design and progressive web apps
  • Familiar with VueJS

They will be evaluated:

  • ability to work in teams,
  • experience / attitude in environment / agile pattern
  • availability in the event of requests for assistance / maintenance on the platform

Commensurate remuneration on the experience and on the projects assigned

Remote work with possible on-site meetings

Apply now

About Keesy srl

Keesy is the first fully automated self-check-in service for apartments, B & Bs, residences and landlords. It manages every aspect of the check-in: collection and sending of guests' data to the police station, verification of the identity document in real time, payment of the stay, cleaning and tourist tax, signing of the contract. And the host is always informed about all activities thanks to real-time notifications

Keesy Points for the collection and deposit of keys are located in strategic points of arrival in cities such as stations and airports, are open 24 hours a day, 365 days a year to guarantee maximum flexibility. With Keesy Digital the host has all the services available for use anywhere in any currency. The Keesy Smart combines self check-in with domotic access to the apartment.

Benefits

  • Young and dynamic product development team
  • Agile team working
  • Integration development with great tourism and booking partners
  • Development innovative digital and technologic products
  • Skills learning for young/junior developers for growing opportunities

items.content:
The Role

A tenacious, passionate and talented Software Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is required to join a well established, expanding and innovative Software House in the idyllic setting of Pembrokeshire. As the Software Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) you will join a multi skilled Web Applications Team and be involved in maintaining, extending and improving website framework, designed for re-use across multiple stores and sales channels. As well as this, you will be building brand new web applications from the ground up. This role has the potential to be within a leadership capacity, dependent on your experience and you will be provided with lots of opportunity to grow.

As the Software Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) you'll collaborate with colleagues, clients and other vendors to work out the best solutions to the ever-changing needs of a growing client base whilst working to keep them at the cutting edge of technology. Within your role as Software Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript).

Are you an Object Orientated Developer that posses transferable, good developer skills?

Are you the person that will be continually 'playing with' things, to ensure that you are using the best one for the task at hand? You will have the opportunity to expand your knowledge and experience in new and exciting technologies that you are interested in through lots of R&D time - specifically in the following technologies: NodeJS, React or Vue.


Role Essentials


  • Experience using OOP.
  • Experience working with PHP Frameworks, eg. Laravel, Symfony, Zend
  • You have a deep understanding of object oriented programming and design patterns
  • You know HTML inside out and have worked with some HTML APIs
  • Experience working with Cloud Tchnologies including AWS
  • You're comfortable with CSS and have experience with pre-processors eg. SASS
  • Commercial experience working on large scale projects where you have shown good decision making

Role Desirables

  • eCommerce and Payment Gateways
  • NodeJS experience
  • Javascript Frameworks, eg. AngularJS, React
  • Automated testing
  • Caching systems, eg. Memcached, Redis
  • Degree in Computer Science - recent graduates welcome

The Company

An award-winning, successful and friendly place to work, where you are given a good degree of autonomy to design and develop solutions. Teams collaborate and share ideas freely, and hierarchy and bureaucracy is kept to a minimum. In addition to the technical stuff, you'll collaborate with your peers, clients, and other vendors to work out solutions, find the quick wins, and diagnose problems.

As well as a generous salary offering you will receive benefits such as flexible working hours, remote working options, unlimited tea and coffee, onsite canteen, free lunch every Friday, state of the art hardware and the opportunity to take part in regular hackathons, plus much more!


Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) - PEMBROKE - + Additional benefits package including flexible working hours, Remote working, progression scheme, Healthcare, Annual Hackathons

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=47, c=2, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=13, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=45}
items.content:
Keytree is currently recruiting for an experienced Full Stack .NET Developer with strong experience using JavaScript and frameworks such as Angular.js and React.js to join their Managed Services team. As part of the role you will work on the build and maintenance of custom web applications for a number of high-profile end clients.

You will work as part of a project team collaborating with other team members and the client where required, to deliver against an agreed design specification, timescale and to budget.

At Keytree we are passionate about our products and the evolving technologies we use to build them. The Full Stack .NET Developer will need to share our passion for craftsmanship in software design and development and continuous improvement in the techniques, tools and languages we use; as well as have an appreciation for business objectives and delivering superior, innovative software solutions.

Required Skills:
  • Minimum of 3 years commercial experience with .NET 4.0/4.5
  • .NET web application experience (MVC, ASP.NET, C#, LINQ)
  • Experience developing office applications using VSTO
  • Strong Front End development experience (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript/jQuery)
  • JavaScript Framework experience- Angular.js or React.js
  • MS SQL Server
  • Git or SVN
  • RESTful APIs
  • Strong understanding of cross-browser compatibility
  • Agile/Scrum methodology experience
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Clear communication skills
Desirable Skills:
  • Experience of developing for cloud computing platforms including AWS and Azure
  • Java development experience
The ideal candidate should have a proven track record within a commercial project environment and a keen interest in the latest technologies and development techniques, which will be beneficial in influencing the technologies, and best practices across our client base. It's essential that you are able to work collaboratively as well as autonomously when necessary.

This is a permanent opportunity based in our Port Talbot, Wales office with the opportunity for some remote work.

Keytree is offering a highly competitive salary plus benefits as well as excellent opportunities for professional development.

We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.
Port Talbot

This is a great opportunity for a developer looking for an innovative and challenging environment with fantastic opportunities for growth and progression.

The successful candidate will possess excellent technical skills, be used to working to deadlines, will be enthusiastic and both a self-starter and a team player.

This is a permanent opportunity based in our Port Talbot, Wales office with the opportunity for some remote work.

At Keytree we are passionate about our products and the evolving technologies we use to build them. The ideal Developer will need to share our passion for craftsmanship in software design and development and continuous improvement in the techniques, tools and languages we use; as well as have an appreciation for business objectives and delivering superior, innovative software solutions.

Keytree is offering a highly competitive salary plus benefits as well as excellent opportunities for professional development.

We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.
Port Talbot

items.content:
Diverse development stack, constantly evolving and evaluating improving technologies.
Remote working potential, flexi-time, continuous training & development programmes.
Sociable, innovative and collaborative working environment.
An established creative design agency in Cardiff Bay are looking for a PHP Web Developer to join their rapidly expanding team. The company focuses on 3 core areas; identity branding, graphic design and web development, with developers and designers working in tandem. The aim is to double in size over the next 12 months, due to a rapid rise in client workload.

What skills you’ll need

Extensive knowledge of HTML5, CSS3 and PHP development.
PHP frameworks, such as Laravel or Magento. But WordPress is a must.
Proven commercial experience with JavaScript and its related libraries (jQuery, AngularJS, NodeJS, ReactJS etc.).
An understanding of Webpack, Sass, Git, ES6 or Grunt/Gulp would be ideal.
Capability to analyse requirements and create effective solutions.
What you’ll be doing

Sitting within the development team, you will take responsibility for developing a breadth of solutions, primarily using PHP. The company’s client base is very diverse and spreads across multiple industry sectors, but for all projects you will focus on brand & identity. You will be involved in taking the clients through workshops to fully understand needs, before liaising with the designers. To ensure the best approach is collaboratively decided upon when developing the website/application. Depending on bandwidth, there may be a client-facing aspect to the role, so you’ll need to be personable & communicative, self-starting and able to work in a fast-paced environment.

What you’ll get in return for your experience

Competitive package that includes; flexi-time and remote working options that increase with time. A collaborative business that are supportive of training, so if there are any courses or qualifications that you feel would benefit your career, they will offer funding and support to do so. It’s a very social environment with monthly outings as an office, pizza parties and Friday night drinks. They even have their own in-house games room!

What next?

This is a unique and exciting opportunity, so if you're interested please send your CV into Rich for more information!
Cardiff Bay
Permanent
£20,000 - £30,000 a year

items.content:
Currently searching for talented Full Stack Developers for a full-time 12 month REMOTE contract!

In this role you will be design, develop, document, test, and debug new and existing software systems, hardware/software interfaces, and/or applications according to industry established software engineering principals and best practices.

You will be working collaboratively within an agile team to execute on the full system development lifecycle including analyzing user needs to determine technical requirements; developing technical specifications based on conceptual design and requirements; developing well-crafted and documented source code; integrating hardware using software; automating manual tasks; and consulting with the end user to prototype, configure, refine, test, and debug programs or systems to meet needs. Identifies and evaluates new technologies or methods for implementation and continuous improvement.

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree with 4 years of experience. A minimum of 10 years relevant work experience may be considered in lieu of the required degree.
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as React, Backbone, or Angular
  • Experience developing APIs and RESTful Web Services
  • Experience with iterative development practices such as Agile or Scrum
  • Experience with ASP.NET, C#, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SQL, JSON
  • Understanding of and experience with Agile delivery and Scrum facilitation
  • Knowledge of secure coding practices (cross-site scripting and SQL injection)
  • Experience with DevOps, Automation, and CI/CD tools and practices
  • US Citizen

items.content:
Work From Home Data Entry

We are currently looking for online support in our work from home Panelist Program. This is a legitimate opportunity for someone who enjoys sharing opinions about products, services and trends in todays market place. As a Team Member, you will be performing various jobs such as online data entry, performing email response, reviews, surveys and other online projects. This work at home job opportunity is very rewarding and will help shape the marketplace and influence new products coming to market. In some cases you will even get to see products before the general public and even participate in testing them online.


Entry Level Skills

  • Strong outgoing personality with superior communication skills and great work ethic.
  • Data entry and strong organizational skills.
  • Effective listening and analytical skills, as well as the ability to summarize information and offer solutions.
  • Familiarity with home computers and have at least an average working level typing ability.
  • You should be professional and positive and also possess a high degree of self-motivation and have the ability to work independently in your job.
  • Excellent time management and administrative skills with a keen attention to detail.
  • Ability to create, implement and manage processes to achieve set outcomes in a work at home job environment.

Other Requirements

This is an online work at home position, so you will be required to have the following:

  • Good Working Entry Level Personal Home Computer, less than 4 years old.
  • Legitimate high-speed home internet access.
  • Full time & Part time telemarketing position jobs.

Compensation

  • Earn from $2.00 - $70.00 Per Online Survey
  • Entry Hourly Pay $18.00 - $24.00 Per Hour

Apply

If you are the type of person who is self-motivated and comfortable working on your own at home, enjoy such work as email customer service, data entry and reviewing products, then you are the person we are looking for.

    • Intro

    We’re looking for an experienced Developer, preferably with mobile experience, that shares our passion for technology and who is prepared to join a dynamic, fast-paced environment. This position is for working on-site or remote (our only concern is to have the best onboard).

    Your Mission:

    We will be counting on you to help us build a product that customers love by leveraging your skills and knowledge. Our payment platform is paired with a mobile cryptocurrency wallet to facilitate payments in our ecosystem. We are developing both for iOS and Android, using React Native/Swift/Java stack. You are expected to coordinate with other developers working directly with the Wallet product. Furthermore, you will be coding and designing the infrastructure and technical approach to guarantee mobile security as required for this kind of Fintech project.

     

    Main requirements

    • At least two years of commercial experience as a developer within a team
    • Experience building and deploying React Native or React applications
    • Be concerned about security. We practice and follow security and privacy by design
    • Have experience with one or more state management solutions, like Redux. Hooks (React) also valued
    • Previous experience in writing tests, code debugging and analysis
    • Able to deal with application submission/provisioning process
    • Excellent communication skills in both technical and non-technical discussions, as we are a remote team



    Nice to have

    • Previous experience building and deploying apps in Android (Java or Kotlin) and/or hybrid languages
    • Be familiar with iOS SDK
    • Experience and passion to deliver an exceptional product, specifically ensuring a great UX

    Perks

    • We understand your value, so we offer a competitive salary + lunch allowance
    • You will have paid vacations and a budget for personal fitness
    • Well-being is a big thing for us, so we offer you Free Health Insurance
    • We have an always-learning mentality, so we provide you with a budget to organize Meetups as well as a budget to attend conferences

    • We believe in a world without borders, so we allow you to work remotely

items.content:
Full-stack Software Engineer (FotA)

Company: Volkswagen Digital Solutions
Location:
Requires Work Permit
Level: Senior
Language: English
Full-stack Developer
Skills:
  • Amazon Web Services
  • AngularJS
  • Embedded Systems
  • Java
  • React

    • Intro

    The Volkswagen Group is forging ahead with digital transformation and Volkswagen Digital Solutions is part of this represented for its 3 tech units: AMS, MAN Digital Hub and SDC:LX.

    MAN Digital Hub | Lisbon  
    MAN Truck & Bus, a business unit of Volkswagen Digital Solutions, is one of Europe’s leading commercial vehicles manufacturers, serving customers in over 120 countries. We’ve come a long way since we started more than 250 years ago and now we are upgrading our business to digital!

    The MAN Digital Hub in Lisbon together with MAN Truck & Bus SE develops and shapes the future of commercial vehicles by driving digitalization. Our journey is to create value to the customer, to create, to extend & to disrupt our business models and to deliver quality.

    Therefore we rely on talented and passionate Fullstack Software Engineers – people like you! 
    Join us on our journey and together with our international teams build our mobility vision for tomorrow. 

    Your project within MAN Digital Hub.
    MAN Now is a new offering which delivers on demand over-the-air functionality and preferences for users to extend and tailor the features of vehicles. It makes use of RIO (see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aB_oH9MYoBM ), a cloud-based platform, that enables real-time connection between trucks, different applications and end-users. 

    We are looking for a Full Stack Software Engineer to work in a cross-functional product team, that is responsible for all areas of the application, i.e. frontend, backend, infrastructure and embedded integration/interfaces. “You build it, you run it, you own it”. 
     
    What you will do… 
    • Provide DevOps tools (Gitlab CI, SonarQube, JFrog Aritfactory) and cloud infrastructure (AWS) 
    •  Working in the context of automotive IoT, you will use DevOps principles to create, test and deploy backend solutions, web-based tools and customer-facing interfaces. 
    • You will develop over-the-air functionality for our trucks using Agile methodologies, and be responsible for integral parts of our technical roadmap. 
    • You will be able to work with UI/UX designers to implement efficient and user-friendly interfaces as well as corresponding backend microservices based on Java Spring Boot. 
    • You will develop prototypes, MVPs and products for near-vehicle features - “features over the air” (FotA). For example: Over the air updates of Map data or delivery of real-time traffic data. 
    • You will create advanced internal web-based tools like roll-out management for over the air updates of millions of vehicles. 
    • You will have end-to-end responsibility for the products you build, including usage of hardware test setups to validate compatibility with embedded systems. 
    • You advise your team and other teams on all questions around Full Stack development in an IoT environment. 
    • You take initiative to solve problems and overcome roadblocks. You will interface between design, technology and user. 
    • You are happy to learn new technologies and to solve problems in innovative and hands-on ways 

    Main requirements

    You have the following qualifications…
    • Minimal Bachelor's degree in computer engineering, computer science, related knowledge area or comparable job expertise 
    • Relevant experience in the conception of complex IT solutions and in an international context. 
    • Very good English skills, both written and spoken. 
    • Solid experience with Clean Code and Clean Architecture principles as well as common software design patterns. 
    • Experience with the use and integration of cloud services and with the use of cloud paradigms, like Infrastructure-as-code, use of PaaS, microservices architectures, continuous delivery, AWS solutions. 
    • Solid experience with Full Stack development with focus on REST APIs and event-driven architecture (one/multiple of Kafka, Kinesis, SQS, MQTT) 
    • Solid experience with server-side Java frameworks and implementation of projects with Spring Boot, and REST web services. 
    • Knowledge of HTML5, CSS, SASS, JavaScript, Typescript and JSON as well as in the connection of web services considering the REST paradigm. 
    • Experience with one/multiple JavaScript frameworks like AngularJS, ReactJS, vue.js, Backbone.js, Knockout.js. 
    • Experience in the technical implementation of solutions, using MVVM / MVC design patterns. 

    Perks

    What’s in it for you…
    • Be part of our amazing startup atmosphere and help  of our local company culture, with the support of a solid international group 
    • An Agile environment where your ideas are welcome 
    • A very talented international team just as passionate and goal-oriented as you 
    • Flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home if needed
    • The opportunity to evolve with continuous training and constant feedback 
    •  Access to Udemy 
    • Health insurance for you and your family 
    • Smartphone with voice/data plan 
    •  Hakuna Matata Sessions aka our weekly knowledge sharing session with snacks and beer to kick-off the weekend 
    • Fresh fruit every day and coffee so you can be healthy and stay fueled for the day 
    • The possibility to learn German, das ist super cool!

    Your project within MAN Digital Hub.
    With its open, cloud-based platform, RIO covers the global supply chain – from the consigner via the forwarding agent and transport company, shipper, dispatcher and driver to the recipient.

    MAN ServiceCare proactive maintenance management offers increased vehicle availability thanks to forward planning and smart bundling of maintenance appointments. The MAN service outlet takes care of vehicle analysis as well as the coordination and management of maintenance appointments. On the RIO platform you can now view the maintenance status and mileage of your vehicles.
     
    What you will do…

    Nice to have

    • Experience with Event-driven architectures. 
    • Experience with message brokers such as Kafka, ActiveMQ, SQS or similar. 
    • You know how ship your own code properly. 
    • Videogame skills. 

    Perks

    What’s in it for you…
    • Be part of our amazing startup atmosphere and help  of our local company culture, with the support of a solid international group 
    • An Agile environment where your ideas are welcome 
    • A very talented international team just as passionate and goal-oriented as you

    At IRELO, we're building a different kind of lead generation experience - one that puts our clients best interests first and strives to create innovative products. The IRELO team is passionate about pursuing our mission and living our values. Our desire to help our clients succeed drives everything that we do. It allows us to make bold decisions, build trust, grow and advance in our industry.

    Job description

    Using your extensive knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS you will improve diverse and complex in-browser web applications relied upon by hundreds of users every day. You will work with real-time data streams and several APIs. You will collaborate closely with Product, Design, Software Engineering, and QA to spec, build, test, and deploy new ideas. Our best fit would be an experienced developer who brings their wisdom gained in a fast-paced environment and is ready to have their voice heard in a smaller office environment. Come join the passionate team at IRELO and have control over your projects.

    Applicants must be located in AZ and not require VISA status.

    A typical week:

    • You'll brainstorm with Product Managers and Developers to conceptualize new features.
    • You'll collaborate with Application Engineering to build new features for our systems.
    • You'll learn about new web technologies and discuss potential solutions to problems.
    • You'll help our skilled support team triage bugs and troubleshoot production issues.
    • You'll take and give feedback for fellow engineers and review code.
    • You’ll create and implement A/B tests to validate changes that drive better customer experiences.

    Things we consider critical:

    • You have a curiosity about how things work.
    • You’ve been developing and operating web sites professionally and can point to things you’ve worked on.
    • You’ve deployed software in distributed environments, operated it at scale, and debugged it too.
    • You are able to analyze and optimize for performance in high-traffic internet applications.
    • You are a strong communicator. Explaining complex technical concepts to designers, support or other engineers is no problem for you.
    • You know how the web works. You know HTTP and TCP/IP and what a good API looks like.
    • You possess strong computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, programming languages, distributed systems, and information retrieval.

    Requirements:

    • Demonstrated experience with vanilla JavaScript, ES6+, and at least one modern JS framework (we use Vue.js daily)
    • Expertise in HTML5/CSS3 and use of pre-processing (SASS or LESS)
    • Experience in the node/npm/yarn eco-system for development and deployment
    • A master of build systems (webpack, Parcel, grunt, gulp, etc.)
    • TDD experience and an evangelist for testing frameworks
    • Practiced in front-end QA testing and testing automation (cypress.io)
    • git workflows, branch management

    Bonus Points:

    • Node.js application development (chatbots, data streaming, etc)
    • Static Site Generators / Netlify Experience
    • OpenAPI Consumption / Creation / Documentation
    • Serverless Applications
    • Authored UI/UX components
    • Actively involved in the open-source community
    • Experience in Agile development environments
    • Comfortable with vanilla command-line tasks and CLI tools
    • Familiarity with basic application management in Linux
    • An eye and passion for beautiful and performant UI/UX
    • Willingness to learn new and developing technologies
    • Ability to work effectively on multiple projects with demanding deadlines in a team environment
    Apply now!

items.content:
Senior Software Engineer — apply your frontend skills to biotech and factory automation!

Company: Zymergen
Location: Emeryville, CA, USA
Job type: Full-time
Skills:
  • Python
  • robotics
  • Vue.js
  • Vuex
  • D3.js

    • Job description

    Zymergen is hiring a Senior Software Engineer on our Automation team to help write the software that translates experiments designed by our scientists into actions performed by robots and automated laboratory equipment. For this role we are looking for a "full stack" generalist who has the experience and interest to be our team's frontend expert.

    Zymergen’s Automation team is building the technology for a reconfigurable, highly automated industrial microbe factory. Combined with the work done by our colleagues who are geneticists, data scientists, research associates, and many other disciplines, our work leads to new chemicals with properties unlike anything that can be derived from petroleum.

    ABOUT THE JOB

    You will contribute to the code that controls the many different types of machinery that make up our microbe factory, adding support for new equipment types, improving the user interfaces for scientists, scaling the scheduling software to support larger transport systems, improving observability tools to monitor the factory, and generally working towards support for more complex automated workflows.

    We call this role “Software Engineer” and not “Automation Engineer” on purpose: Our tech stack combines a modern web tech stack with a few cherry-picked components you’d find in a traditional process control system. Our codebase currently contains REST APIs served by Django apps, Vue.js for user interfaces (and simple Django forms with sprinkles of jQuery for others), Python’s asyncio in worker processes, and a collection of device drivers (also written in Python). Our infrastructure includes Kubernetes, Puppet-managed EC2 nodes, Kafka, MySQL, as well as a few Windows machines and PLCs.

    The project you will start on has been in flight for two years. Some days you will be working on a brand new service to add a major new feature. On other days you will be fixing bugs or troubleshooting misbehaving robots in production (you might be wearing a lab coat). We use two-week sprints to structure our work, with every team member being responsible for keeping track of one or two ongoing efforts. Who works on what is driven just as much by our current skills as by what we want to learn.

    One specific area our team is trying to get better at is frontend development and we hope that you can play a role in that. Be prepared to spend 50% or more of your time designing and implementing user interfaces. All our users are internal to Zymergen: They include scientists who need to tell the robots what to work on, support engineers who troubleshoot misbehaving robots, and managers who rely on utilization data from our dashboards.

    ABOUT YOU

    You have several years of experience working in technical software development role (SWE, SRE, web dev, etc). We do not expect you to have prior experience in the biotech industry or in working with robots. To make sure we can get you up to speed quickly on those things, you’ll need to bring a solid fundamental knowledge and recent hands-on experience with software development, working in a team, and the two foundational languages in our tech stack: Javascript and Python.

    You might have a CS degree, or not. (If you do, you would be the first team member who has one.) We want to hear the stories about how you used your skills in thoughtful and interesting ways, whether you learned them in a school or elsewhere.

    We are looking for a software engineer who cares about the product we are building at least as much as the code they are writing. Nobody gets micromanaged in our team, even junior engineers own complete problems and participate in architecture decisions and project management. Because you join the team as an experienced engineer, we expect you to be comfortable dealing with ambiguity and ready to mentor others to become excellent at it too.

    In addition to writing code every day, you will review the work of others both at the design and implementation stage, design significant new features and infrastructure from scratch, and help maintain and prioritize our backlog and road map. When we deploy our work to a prototype system, you will be hands on with testing and troubleshooting, even in situations when it’s not clear if the problem is software or hardware or biology.

    You will be the sixth member of a team of people who are excited to both introduce you to our tech and to learn from you! When you arrive, we will have an onboarding plan that gets you ready for working on critical path features and the gnarliest bugs within two or three months. We will save you a spot in the schedule for our biweekly chalk talk lineup, too!

    A note on logistics: This is not a remote job. At least some of your work will involve (expensive!) machines which are located in our laboratories in Emeryville, CA. Emeryville is one of the biotech hubs in the Bay Area’s “tech industry” and easy to commute to: Zymergites bicycle or ride public transit from Berkeley and Oakland, take the train or company shuttle from the South Bay, and BART or drive from SF. We don’t have fixed working hours: Most of us meet in the office on most weekdays. Most meetings happen between 11am and 4pm, if you work from home you can always videocall in.

    Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. Zymergen may agree to sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills for this job. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.

    Apply now!

    • Company description

    Viking Sasquatch builds products that solve pain points in the Mortgage Lending, Title Insurance and Real Estate arena.

    We are a 100% digital company with folks working all around the world. Our moto is "We make cool shit with people we like!"



    The main product that we are currently building is a “Pricing Engine” that crosses through FinTech/InsureTech/PropTech. PWA built with Vue.JS Front End, MySQL Backend, integrations powered by Mulesoft and it will live with the Google App Engine. The UI/UX is designed in Zeplin making it super easy for you have everything you need to build this out.

    Job description

    We are looking for an expert JavaScript developer who is highly skilled with Vue.js and Nuxt.js. Your primary focus will be developing user-facing web applications and components. You’ll implement them with the Vue.js framework, following generally accepted practices and workflows. You will ensure that you produce robust, secure, modular, and maintainable code. You will coordinate with other team members, including front-end, back-end developers and UX/UI designers and domain experts. Your commitment to team collaboration, perfect communication, and a quality product is crucial.

    Responsibilities

    • Developing user-facing applications using Vue.js, Nuxt.js, Vuetify.js
    • Building modular and reusable components and libraries
    • Implementing automated testing integrated into development and maintenance workflows
    • Staying up-to-date with all recent developments in the JavaScript and Vue.js space
    • Keeping an eye on security updates and issues found with Vue.js and all project dependencies
    • Proposing any upgrades and updates necessary for keeping up with modern security and development best practices
    • Maintaining project code and documentation in Gitlab

    Skills

    • Highly proficient with the JavaScript language and its modern ES6+ syntax and features
    • Highly proficient with Vue.js framework and its core principles such as components, reactivity, and the virtual DOM
    • Familiarity with the Vue.js ecosystem, including Vue CLI, Vuex, Vue Router, and Nuxt.js
    • Good understanding of HTML5 and CSS3, Material design system including SASS/SCSS
    • Understanding Jamstack architecture, single page apps, and static websites
    • Knowledge of functional programming and object-oriented programming paradigms
    • Ability to write efficient, secure, well-documented, and clean JavaScript code
    • Familiarity with automated JavaScript testing, specifically testing frameworks such as Jest or Mocha and libraries such as Chai or Sinon
    • Proficiency with modern development tools, like Babel, Webpack, and Git
    • Experience with both consuming and designing RESTful APIs
    • Experience with Docker and CI/CD pipelines in Gitlab, Google App Engine
    Apply now!

items.content:
Senior Front-End Developer

Company: Office of Educational Innovation and Evaluation
Location: Manhattan, KS, USA, Remote Allowed
Job type: Full-time
Salary: USD 55680-89090
Skills:
  • Django
  • Django REST framework
  • VueJS

    • Company description

    OEIE conducts program evaluations of both large- and small-scale projects for a broad range of clientele. Our service-oriented multidisciplinary team works in collaboration with clients to

    * develop evaluation components needed for competitive grant proposals and to

    * design and implement rigorous, comprehensive evaluation plans integrating technology that are tailored to address the needs of each project.

    * We provide high-quality, efficient, responsive program evaluations that support data-driven decision making.

    Job description

    Fully remote, On-site in Manhattan, KS; or On-site in Olathe, KS (Kansas City area).

    The Office of Educational Innovation (OEIE) at Kansas State University is looking for a senior front-end web developer that has the experience to be the driving force that helps direct the front-end for our nationally-recognized PEARS SaaS application! We are a small team of highly skilled software engineers, support and QA experts, and evaluators. We greatly value learning and working together as a team to achieve our goals. As part of this team, you will have personal ownership of a product that is making a real difference in the lives of people across the nation!

    PEARS measures the impact of nutrition educators and extension agents as they work to improve public health, apply the latest research to agriculture, and foster youth development and leadership, among many other efforts. We have the privilege to serve and support the tireless efforts of these public servants, helping them understand what works and what doesn’t, so funding can be used as efficiently as possible.

    You will also work with the latest industry-standard technologies on a well-structured code base. The back-end of PEARS is built in Python using the Django framework. The front-end is mostly JQuery, but efforts are underway to adopt Vue.js and leverage related tools. As a senior front-end developer, you would help spearhead this transition by:

    • Setting up build tools like Webpack, Gulp, LESS/Sass, etc. and training teammates on best practices.
    • Helping to establish patterns for building Vue components and general Javascript/CSS/HTML elements.
    • Refining our UI/UX and exploring new tools and patterns.
    • Helping steer technical innovation and advocate for front-end development best practices and application organization.

    The successful candidate should have:

    • Experience setting up a build chain using tools like Wepack, Gulp and LESS/Sass.
    • Experience building complex front-end systems using Vue.js, React, or Angular.
    • Ability to teach other team members and establish best practices for Javascript and CSS and other front-end tools and technologies.
    Why Join Us?

    OEIE is a fast-paced and growing office in the College of Education at Kansas State University. OEIE provides technical assistance and capacity building services in evaluation and program development to various state and federal agencies, universities, foundations, and businesses.

    As part of these efforts, we developed the Program Evaluation and Reporting System (PEARS) to streamline data management and evaluation efforts of K-State Extension and nutrition education programs. Since 2016, the program has been adopted in 28 additional states in the U.S. (and growing)! The team has recently received a national award for Excellence in Extension Evaluation from AEA and an Award for Innovation from NETC.

    Benefits to working for OEIE include:

    • Ability to work on-site in Manhattan, KS, remotely, or at a satellite office at K-State Olathe in the Kansas City area.
    • Very competitive health, leave, and retirement plans, plus other K-State Employee Benefits.
    • Sit/stand desk in your own office.
    • New Macbook Pro and the tools you need to succeed.
    • Annual conference trip (dependent on funding).
    Apply now!

VueJS Front end Developer

Company: Cycloid
Location: Paris, France, Remote
Job type: Full-time
Salary: EUR 30000-60000
Skills:
  • #vuejs
  • Github
  • UI
  • UI Design
  • UX
  • UX Design

    • Company description

    Our vision: we empower people.
    Our purpose: we want to simplify DevOps and Cloud adoption, empower people (dev, ops, project manager, CTO) to focus on what matters. Cycloid team works on 2 connected activities:
    - we develop Cycloid: a DevOps platform which integrates a Cloud designer which creates infra as code on Terraform, a service catalogue, a continuous integration, continuous delivery pipeline, logs, events centralisation and tracking the Cloud cost.
    - we provide services on Cloud as your DevOps team: Design / Audit / Build / Migrate / Managed Services / DevOps As A Service
    We are splitting the work between people who have the same skills to break the monotony, share the knowledge and avoid that we get bored when we have to work on non-fancy things.
    We develop and test our code, we don’t have people dedicated to writing tests, we believe that the same people who implement features, fix bugs, etc, must implement the tests. We do code reviews, we don’t merge into mainstream any substantial code without being reviewed and approved.
    We take the time that we need to build useful products and provide great services.
    We are a teal organization which means that:
    We believe in collective intelligence to innovate and bring people well-being in the center of everything. Flat structure is the way. Management should be redefined to place the company at the service of people not the opposite.
    We are a distributed remote company, which pay co-working place for people who needed and with an office in Paris. However, everyone at Cycloid meets once every quarter at our headquarters in France to define collectively the strategy/road map/features that coming in the next quarter. Then, everyone defines their own agenda and priorities that to achieve his own goal during the quarter.
    We are fully transparent on revenues, salaries, metrics and believe that everybody should have the same variable plan doesn't matter the function.
    We are committed to having equality between women and men. In that way, we strongly encourage women's application.

    Job description

    Cycloid: The DevOps platform to simplify and speed up DevOps and cloud adoption.

    The Cycloid team works in two connected areas:

    • we develop cycloid.io: a DevOps platform including TerraCognita, StackCraft, a service catalogue, CI/CD container pipeline, logs centralisation and cost tracking.

    • we provide services as your DevOps team: we Design / Audit / Build / Migrate / and provide Managed Services through “DevOps As A Service”

    We are 30 passionate people building a fantastic Teal organisation since 2015. Our product and DevOps team are already contributing to numerous IT services across Europe. We speed up our development thanks to a 4,5 M€ fundraising in 2019.

    Your are :

    • A passionate, knowledgeable and friendly front-end developer, with some skills on VueJS, ES 7 and above, ES Lint, Jest and SCSS

    • Some knowledge on SVG based libraries, such as Joint.js and D3.js is definitely a plus

    • With several years of experience crafting professional looking and user-friendly UI

    • You also have a good eye for design and aware of what makes a positive UX

    • You have enough English skills to fully work remote with people across Europe

    • No interest in managing others! Contribute, share and manage yourself is enough

    If you can support us in getting things shipped, that you code well first time and in a timely manner - all the while maintaining a good communication (with great gif game), you will be truly welcomed!

    Indispensable skills:

    • Vue.js, or other javascript frameworks (React, Angular, Ember etc)

    • Keeping up to date with best practises and new technologies within FE

    • Style pre/post processors (PostCSS, SCSS, LESS, Stylus etc)

    • Style methodologies, e.g. BEM

    • Jest or other testing suites (Mocha, Chai, Jasmine etc)

    • Good knowledge of git and Github (PR’s, issues, rebasing, cherry-picking etc)

    • Ability to find the best GIFs and emoji for all situations

    • Full English proficiency

    • Full Remote proficiency

    • Github, Slack, Trello, Hangout full proficiency (no emails...it’s so 20th century !)

    Nice to have:

    • Experience with webpack

    • E2E testing

    • Experience with CI/CD tools

    Apply now!

items.content:
Software Developers, React / Symfony

Developer
Anywhere
Company: CobbleWeb
Full Time

Overview

Outstanding ideas need outstanding execution. We work closely with digital entrepreneurs and forward-thinking companies to launch high-performing websites and mobile applications. Our approach is based on the Lean Startup Methodology, Design Sprints, and Agile Development.

Why work with us? 

You are guaranteed to never be bored if you work with the CobbleWeb team. We are not a cookie cutter web development agency. Every project will have unique challenges and will demand the use of the latest technologies. Strategies will vary to maximise each site’s flexibility and speed while still accommodating our clients’ specific needs. This is not a job for the faint of heart.

What are we looking for?

We are looking for a few good men and women with passion and purpose. Who believe that good UX and UI can mean more than just a pretty website. Who know that the right design with the right functionality can result in a transformative experience for both user and platform owner. That a website can take an idea and convert it into a vibrant enterprise. In other words, we are looking for developers just like us.

Skills required:
  • Expert PHP developing skills using Symfony framework
  • Expert React developing skills using Redux-Saga and Axios
  • Experience developing with Bootstrap and SASS
  • Experience with REST APIs
  • Experience with test automation using Behat, Jenkins, Selenium or other testing framework would be advantageous

    • General requirements:
    • User centric and care about good coding
    • Conscientious and have a good work ethic
    • Resourceful and creative

      • Our London, UK headquartered agency is able to produce high-quality outcomes due to a close-knit team of dedicated subject experts situated across the world. Every quarter, we meet for a few days somewhere in Europe for a hackathon.
