Our company culture and environment has the excitement of a start-up with the intensity of a growing healthcare information technology company solving national issues. There is a pervasive sense that the work we do is making a big impact in the lives of our customers and those they serve.Job Duties Serve as the primary app developer and responsible for app design and UI, all development, testing, debugging and on-going enhancements Lead Welligent's mobile development initiatives as the primary app developer and grow Welligent's mobile practice area Responsible for the ongoing evolution of our existing mobile apps, to enhance functionality and provide a better experience for end users Working within our existing application frameworks, provide creative input, expertise and technical methods Make a significant impact by working directly with the company and product owners, developers and other team members to improve upon an existing strong enterprise application with an extensive national user base Work with the business users to understand and document functionality requirements Collaborate with other technical team members including Welligent's web-services team to understand/ensure data requirements are met As needed, perform business and data requirements gathering and data analysis tasks Identify and document relevant data design, process and specifications Willingness to understand business context and problems and communicate them clearly in written and oral format Requirements Bachelor's degree required Advanced knowledge/experience with Angular with Javascript Advanced knowledge/experience with Cordova and plugins Knowledge of jQuery, Ionic, FullCalendar framework Must be familiar with PouchDB integration for SQLite Experience with SQLite offline storage Basic knowledge of TypeScript Basic knowledge of C++ for comping Windows package Must be familiar with NodeJs package manager PHP (must be familiar with curl basic authentications) Data encryption - AES, Hash NodeJs, must be familiar with package manager using the command line Sass (a plus but not needed since UI already built) User interface design and front end development experience Knowledge of HTML, DHTML, CSS and JavaScript Experience with Android Studio, Xcode/Swift, Visual Studio Experience with Apple, Google, and Microsoft store submission process and knowledge of creating and publishing provisioning profiles and certificates for all platforms. Must be familiar with HTTP services Some knowledge of Red Hat Linux server, basic knowledge of command line connection using SSH Knowledge of relational database design Ability to work independently and solve complex software problems Strong analytical and problem solving skills Knowledge of Healthcare IT, EHR/EMR or clinical systems preferred Experience working in a small team to build and enhance complex enterprise software applications Green card or US Citizenship required BenefitsIn addition to health, dental and 401K benefits, Welligent's competitive perks and benefits include the potential for year-end bonus, flexible work schedule, casual office environment in an up-and-coming area of Norfolk near Old Dominion University, no dress code, Starbucks coffee and an amazing group of co-workers.

items.title: Salesforce Software Developer-remote considered
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=1, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Company Information
Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. That's Travelers. Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers - and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Job Summary
Travelers is looking for energetic, creative and talented people to join our Sales Enablement technology team, powered by the Salesforce platform. You will be responsible for the design, development, testing and implementation of all components of our Salesforce implementations. You will work with a team of talented engineers and contributors from across the company to enable effective and scalable solutions that will be leveraged by thousands of Travelers personnel. Working within an agile delivery model, this team will have a profound effect on driving efficiencies, increasing revenue and enabling a strategic technical foundation for the future. You will work with Salesforce capabilities including Lightning, Financial Services Cloud, and expansion into our growing portfolio of Salesforce Cloud technologies.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
  • Develop, implement and maintain standard configuration and customizations using APEX, VisualForce, Lightning Components and JavaScript
  • Integrate Salesforce platform with source applications using defined integration patterns to ensure production readiness and an outstanding user experience
  • Participate in agile delivery activities such as design, estimating, retrospectives and continuous improvement
  • Create and execute test scripts for assigned development work
  • Ensure availability of the Salesforce platform and provide on-call support to resolve application issues when necessary
  • This position is open for candidates to work remotely.


Minimum Qualifications
A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or its equivalent in work experience, and five years of programming/development experience.

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
  • 3 years or more as a Salesforce Developer (APEX, VisualForce, Lightning) is required
  • Experience in Salesforce CRM integration, developing and deploying custom integration solutions using APIs and API management systems is desirable
  • Proficiency with Data tools (SQL Server, SQL, ETL, Dataloader, etc.) is desirable
  • Experience working as a team member in an Agile delivery model
  • Working knowledge of test automation tools like Selenium
  • Working knowledge of CA Agile Manager (Rally) or similar ALM tools
  • Working knowledge of automated deployment / DevOps tools and technologies
  • Working knowledge of source control management tools such as Git


Job Specific & Technical Skills & Competencies
Technical Knowledge: Able to expertly assess, design develop, and support applications, systems and solutions to achieve business and/or technical requirements. Demonstrates technical expertise for multiple languages, applications, systems, technologies, and/or frameworks, and has the ability to influence technical direction or defect resolution. Fully understands business applications and/or technical system environments in which the system operates.
Communication Skills: Ability to communicate thoughts/designs/ideas in an unambiguous manner and adjusts communication based on audience. Exhibits active and effective communication skills with team members - including active listening and effective written and verbal communication skills. Effectively contributes and communicates with the immediate team. Able to present complex technical concepts to audiences of varying size and level.
Business Knowledge & Partnership: Able to develop business partnerships and influence business priorities through solution identification aligned with business objectives and goals. Able to communicate in business terms and describe IT capabilities and concepts in ways that the business can understand.
Problem Solving & Decision Making: Able to proficiently diagnose root causes and solve complex problems. Able to evaluate alternative solutions and assess risk before taking action. Has the ability to reach sound decisions quickly and escalates appropriately. Demonstrates ability to optimize the use of all available resources.
Team Orientation: Able to maintain and enhance partnerships across the organization to achieve objectives. Practices objectivity and openness to others' views. Able to recognize and support team priorities.
Leadership: Accountable to set technical goals and priorities for self and other team members. Exhibits team leadership and collaborates with partners.
Planning and Project Management: Demonstrates ability to identify critical project tasks and establish clear priorities while keeping the bigger picture in mind. Able to effectively collaborate with Project Manager and utilize sound project management practices. Able to manage time and competing priorities.
Financial Awareness: Able to assess the financial impact of recommended designs/solutions.

Environmental/Work Schedules/Other
  • This position is open for candidates to work remotely.
  • Requires occasional weekend and/or overnight work hours.
  • Requires periods (1 or more weeks) of travel as needed.
  • Requires travel up to 5% of the time.


Physical Requirements
Operates standard office equipment. Requires extended periods of computer use. Requires extended periods of sitting.

Licensing or Certificates
  • Salesforce.com certifications such as Certified Platform Developer I, Certified Platform Developer II are strongly preferred
  • Remain current with Salesforce technologies and best practices, including Salesforce certifications as appropriate


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Travelers is an equal opportunity employer.
To apply for this position please CLICK HERE

items.content:
The Role

A tenacious, passionate and talented Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is required to join a well established, expanding and innovative Software House in the idyllic setting of Pembrokeshire. As the Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) you will join a multi skilled Web Applications Team and be involved in maintaining, extending and improving website framework, designed for re-use across multiple stores and sales channels. As well as this, you will be building brand new web applications from the ground up. This role has the potential to be within a leadership capacity, dependent on your experience and you will be provided with lots of opportunity to grow.

As the Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) you'll collaborate with colleagues, clients and other vendors to work out the best solutions to the ever-changing needs of a growing client base whilst working to keep them at the cutting edge of technology. Within your role as Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript).

Are you an Object Orientated Developer that posses transferable, good developer skills?

Are you the person that will be continually 'playing with' things, to ensure that you are using the best one for the task at hand? You will have the opportunity to expand your knowledge and experience in new and exciting technologies that you are interested in through lots of R&D time - specifically in the following technologies: NodeJS, React or Vue.


Role Essentials


  • Experience using OOP.
  • Experience working with PHP Frameworks, eg. Laravel, Symfony, Zend
  • You have a deep understanding of object oriented programming and design patterns
  • You know HTML inside out and have worked with some HTML APIs
  • Experience working with Cloud Tchnologies including AWS
  • You're comfortable with CSS and have experience with pre-processors eg. SASS
  • Commercial experience working on large scale projects where you have shown good decision making

Role Desirables

  • eCommerce and Payment Gateways
  • NodeJS experience
  • Javascript Frameworks, eg. AngularJS, React
  • Automated testing
  • Caching systems, eg. Memcached, Redis
  • Degree in Computer Science - recent graduates welcome

The Company

An award-winning, successful and friendly place to work, where you are given a good degree of autonomy to design and develop solutions. Teams collaborate and share ideas freely, and hierarchy and bureaucracy is kept to a minimum. In addition to the technical stuff, you'll collaborate with your peers, clients, and other vendors to work out solutions, find the quick wins, and diagnose problems.

As well as a generous salary offering you will receive benefits such as flexible working hours, remote working options, unlimited tea and coffee, onsite canteen, free lunch every Friday, state of the art hardware and the opportunity to take part in regular hackathons, plus much more!


Full Stack Developer (PHP, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) - PEMBROKE - + Additional benefits package including flexible working hours, Remote working, progression scheme, Healthcare, Annual Hackathons

Oscar Technology is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Pembrokeshire
Permanent
£25,000 - £45,000 a year

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=14, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=12}
items.content:
Web Development Course Mentor at Thinkful

Remote | Part-time

At Thinkful, we believe that if schools put in even half the amount of effort that students do the outcomes would be better for everyone.

We put in outlandish amounts of effort to create an education that offers our students a guaranteed return on their investment. we partner with employers to create a world-class curriculum built for today. We go to ends of the earth to find mentors who are the best of the best.

As a Course Mentor, you will support students by acting as an advisor, counselor, and support system as they complete the course and land their first industry job. To achieve this, you will engage with students using the below range of approaches.

  • Mentor Sessions: Meet with students 1-on-1 in online video sessions to provide technical and professional support as the student progresses through the curriculum.
  • Group Sessions: Host online video sessions on topics of your expertise (in alignment with curriculum offerings) for groups of student seeking live support between mentor sessions.
  • Grading: Reviewing student checkpoints submissions and delivering written feedback, including analysis of projects and portfolios.
  • Technical Coaching: Provide in-demand support to technical questions and guidance requests that come to the Technical Coaching team through text and video in a timely manner. This team also provides the TA support for immersive programs.
  • Assessments & Mock Interviews: Conduct 1-on-1 mock interviews and assessments via video calls and provide written feedback to students based on assessment rubrics.

Requirements

  • 3+ years relevant professional work experience
  • Proficiency with front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery)
  • Node.JS and React.JS at an industry level; full MERN stack proficiency a plus
  • Demonstrates genuine student advocacy and empathy for beginners
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment
  • Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection and webcam
  • Teaching, mentoring and/or coaching experience a plus

Benefits

  • This is a part-time role (10-25 hours a week)
  • Fully remote position, with a flexible schedule
  • Access to all of Thinkful Courses for your continued learning
  • Community of 500+ like-minded professionals looking to impact others and keep their skills sharp
  • Grow and develop as an educator with your managing Squad Lead and Squad
Apply for job

4+ Years Using PHP/Laravel4+Years JavaScript (Framework Flexible)Experience Leading a Team

Desired Skills & Experience

React Native a Plus

What You Will Be Doing

Tech Breakdown

50% Front End50% Back End

Daily Responsibilities

80% Hands On20% Management Duties

The Offer

Medical Insurance & Health Savings Account (HSA)401(k)Paid Sick Time LeavePre-tax Commuter BenefitFULLY REMOTE

items.title: Frontend React Developer - REMOTE!
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=41}
items.content:
Frontend React Developer

Exciting opportunity to capitalize your career as a React developer with a global company from the comfort of your home! We are seeking a high-achieving professional that can create innovative applications and solutions for high-profile clients.

This position is a hands-on development role, building web applications from prototypes to enterprise scalable solutions. You will work together with a team to understand and solve technical challenges.

You will be working with a high-performing team of UI and UX professionals and the sole Front End developer and will create elegant code that will be utilized to build out products that are second to none and enjoyable to use.

This is a tremendous opportunity to be part of a global, growing organization that will continue to grow. Sharpen your already top-notch skills and gain exposure to cutting edge technology, while diversifying your skillset by supporting clients across multiple industries. This is a fantastic role that will advance your career and join a highly collaborative team! Feel free to work remotely and enjoy the occasional trip to New York City for visits to the US Headquarters.

REQUIRED SKILLS:

  • 5+ years Front End development experience using JavaScript (ES2015+), HTML5, and CSS
  • 2+ years using React
  • Previous experience working on the agency side and/or with UI/UX teams

PREFERRED SKILLS:

  • Git (GUI or CommandLine) and GitFlow methodology
  • JIRA (or other ticketing/project management tools)
  • Unit testing experience

Must be authorized to work in the U.S./Sponsorships are not available

items.title: Mid-Senior Level Developers (Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=5, c=2, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=34}
items.content:
Our client is looking for experienced software developers to build awesome software for their clients. Clients like Discovery Channel, NPR, and Microsoft rely on them to build high quality products for their customers. If you're a junior developer, capable of building world-class software, and ready to collaborate with an amazing team of developers, let's talk.

Responsibilities for this position include:

  • Delivering cutting-edge, consumer software products.
  • Developing:
    • Cross platform and native mobile apps.
    • Responsive web applications.
    • Cloud infrastructure and services to support web and mobile product ecosystems.
  • Collaborating with client stakeholders though Agile process to refine requirements and acceptance criteria and maximize stakeholder value.


Requirements:

  • At least 5 years of industry experience building production quality software. Generally, they prefer engineers with more than 10 years of industry experience.
  • Experience working from home, and working as part of a distributed team. We are looking for self-directed engineers who are most productive in flexible work environments.
  • Experience with Agile software process, including writing user stories and acceptance criteria, and iterative and incremental delivery.
  • Rigorous experience with Agile engineering techniques including:
    • Continuous integration and deployment
    • Test automation and test driven development
    • Reuse and refactoring
    • Emergent design
  • Polyglot development experience, and a track record for learning new technology stacks.
  • Deep experience with JavaScript development and JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, React, and Node.
  • Experience integrating disparate systems through APIs and other technologies
  • Experience with React or React Native a plus.
  • Experience with C# web applications and Xamarin mobile apps a plus.

This is a contract position (initial engagement will be six months with the likelihood of extension, or conversion to being a full time employee of our client) working from home. There will be the occasional meeting in our clients Northern VA offices, but the majority of time you will be working remotely. We are only looking for candidates in the continental US at this time.

The hourly rate for this position can be up to $120/hr. (1099 or c-2-c), depending on your level of experience. If you would prefer to be an employee of AAJ during the contract period, we can discuss appropriate compensation level.

If this sounds like you, please respond with your Salary/Hourly rate requirements as soon as possible.

Please no agencies. Please do not apply if you are not in the Continental United States.

===================================================

About AAJ Interactive Technologies:

AAJ Interactive Technologies, established in 1997 by cutting-edge technology executives, is a technology professional-services company supplying project-based consulting, staff augmentation and recruiting services to leading firms throughout Metropolitan Washington, DC.

We work differently from most of our competition. We have been in both a position of hiring, mentoring and managing large staffs inside a corporate culture, as well as consultants for hire. This unique perspective allows us to understand both sides of this business. We take the time to ensure our consultants/candidates placed will be successful.

We believe that because of our principals we have succeeded where others have failed. The greater DC technology space can be full of companies that are not really looking out for your interests. Ask around, we re not one of them! We want you to succeed, and we ll do everything we can to help you do just that!

- provided by Dice

items.content:
JavaScript Web Developer (React/Redux) - 1 day telecommute!

Exciting opportunity for a JavaScript Developer to join a world-class technology leader in Atlanta!

In this direct-hire role, you will join a team responsible for designing, developing, & supporting new custom UI components for enterprise-wide single page applications using React JavaScript, React, Redux, HTML5, CSS, Java, & other Front End technologies and testing tools. These large-scale applications will need to integrate with disparate systems using RESTful web services, JavaScript APIs, and various other Back End systems.

In order to be successful in this role, you must have a solid foundational understanding of JavaScript and modern JavaScript frameworks beyond jQuery as well as a good understanding of functional programming principles. We are looking for a passionate individual with excellent analytical skills, someone who pays close attention to details, enjoys working with modern programming software, and can take on complex tasks with little direction.

If you are interested in joining this world-class company building high performing applications and working with a team of accomplished technologists that offers 1 day telecommute, please apply to Visionaire Partners today!

REQUIRED SKILLS:

  • 3+ years JavaScript Development
  • Professional React experience
  • Advanced HTML5 & CSS
  • Functional/asynchronous programming
  • Experience with Server Side web technologies
  • Excellent communication skills and passion for Front End development

PREFERRED SKILLS:

  • Bachelor's Degree
  • Redux
  • Experience with iterative/test driven development
  • Node.js, Ruby on Rails, PHP, Django
  • Experience with client side testing tools like Jest, Mocha, Chai, Sinon, Jasmine, etc.
  • Open-source frameworks like Spring
  • Git or similar source control

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=8, mobile=23, go=0, nodejs=30, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=13, java=1, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=28}
items.content: Welligent, a fast-growing Electronic Health Record (EHR) software vendor based in Norfolk, is seeking an experienced mobile application developer to develop and support custom-developed Welligent apps. A leading national software vendor, Welligent provides a comprehensive, enterprise cloud-based software solution which comprises practice management, clinical, billing and reporting functions. Ancillary to its cloud-based solutions, Welligent also offers mobile apps which offer a sub-set of functionality or complementary functionality to our cloud-based solutions. Welligent's customers include community-based behavioral/health and human services providers in more than 30 states. Our company culture and environment has the excitement of a start-up with the intensity of a growing healthcare information technology company solving national issues. There is a pervasive sense that the work we do is making a big impact in the lives of our customers and those they serve.Job Duties Serve as the primary app developer and responsible for app design and UI, all development, testing, debugging and on-going enhancements Lead Welligent's mobile development initiatives as the primary app developer and grow Welligent's mobile practice area Responsible for the ongoing evolution of our existing mobile apps, to enhance functionality and provide a better experience for end users Working within our existing application frameworks, provide creative input, expertise and technical methods Make a significant impact by working directly with the company and product owners, developers and other team members to improve upon an existing strong enterprise application with an extensive national user base Work with the business users to understand and document functionality requirements Collaborate with other technical team members including Welligent's web-services team to understand/ensure data requirements are met As needed, perform business and data requirements gathering and data analysis tasks Identify and document relevant data design, process and specifications Willingness to understand business context and problems and communicate them clearly in written and oral format Requirements Bachelor's degree required Advanced knowledge/experience with Angular with Javascript Advanced knowledge/experience with Cordova and plugins Knowledge of jQuery, Ionic, FullCalendar framework Must be familiar with PouchDB integration for SQLite Experience with SQLite offline storage Basic knowledge of TypeScript Basic knowledge of C++ for comping Windows package Must be familiar with NodeJs package manager PHP (must be familiar with curl basic authentications) Data encryption - AES, Hash NodeJs, must be familiar with package manager using the command line Sass (a plus but not needed since UI already built) User interface design and front end development experience Knowledge of HTML, DHTML, CSS and JavaScript Experience with Android Studio, Xcode/Swift, Visual Studio Experience with Apple, Google, and Microsoft store submission process and knowledge of creating and publishing provisioning profiles and certificates for all platforms. Must be familiar with HTTP services Some knowledge of Red Hat Linux server, basic knowledge of command line connection using SSH Knowledge of relational database design Ability to work independently and solve complex software problems Strong analytical and problem solving skills Knowledge of Healthcare IT, EHR/EMR or clinical systems preferred Experience working in a small team to build and enhance complex enterprise software applications Green card or US Citizenship required BenefitsIn addition to health, dental and 401K benefits, Welligent's competitive perks and benefits include the potential for year-end bonus, flexible work schedule, casual office environment in an up-and-coming area of Norfolk near Old Dominion University, no dress code, Starbucks coffee and an amazing group of co-workers.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=95}
items.content:
Senior Frontend Developer with experience using Vue.js sought to join a growing financial technology company. This role has the potential to be based remotely or in their central London office. The company's innovative platform can be embedded into their client's systems which categorises and prioritises relevant research in a tailored way for asset managers to access without having to build further systems that interfere with existing workflows. The company are now entering their next phase of growth which is solely focused on introducing their platform into new markets and they now require a seasoned Frontend Developer to join the team.

The role will mainly see you working in a small agile team creating new user-face features from design whilst improving existing ones in Vue.js and working with the wider teams to design new functionalities. Successful candidates will need to display solid frontend experience using Vue.JS although developers with knowledge using React or Angular open to learning Vue.js will also be considered. The primary focus for the directors is hiring the right personal traits as opposed to what skills you can bring to the table, so passion, an ability to learn, a team player mentality and individuals who want to make a difference are high on the list with the only mandatory technical requirement being Vue.js experience. Candidates from a full stack background using Python will earn extra marks and help put your CV to the top of the pile.

A competitive salary depending on experience is on offer up to £90k and extensive benefits alongside the opportunity to work with a truly welcoming team. Hurren and Hope are the companies chosen talent partner for this recruitment campaign. If this could be a good match for your career aspirations please contact us and we'll be happy to provide more information.

'It's about people, not sales!'

items.content: If you are a Senior Frontend Developer with experience, please read on!Headquartered in San Francisco with a new location in Salt Lake City, we are a software consulting firm specializing in end-to-end web and mobile app creation. Business is booming and we are building our team in SLC to keep up with our rapid growth.Top Reasons to Work with Us Competitive Salary and Bonuses Excellent Benefits (health, vision, dental, etc.) 401k Match Fun, positive and collaborative work environment Remote, with preference to local candidatesWhat You Will Be Doing Work on a variety of projects and various technologies Create amazing web applications Design and build product featuresWhat You Need for this Position 5+ years' experience building web applications Frontend UI building and styling experience Expertise in JavaScript and React HTML, CSS/SASS Mobile application development using Dart, Flutter, React Native or SDK is a plus! Understanding of Python, Node or Ruby is a plus! Backend API building experience is a plus! Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also: do NOT change the email subject line in any way. items.content: OverviewWe are searching for a Product UI Development Lead who wants to lead a team of talented software engineers in defining, designing, and developing the user interface of our network automation software. Itential provides powerful network automation software to companies worldwide, from Fortune 500 telecommunications and financial service companies to enterprises of all sizes. We are committed to building world-class products that accelerate the move toward software-driven networks and next generation, agile network operations. Our corporate headquarters are in Atlanta with offices in the UK and Latin America and we are growing fast!Job DescriptionProduct UI Development Leads at Itential are members of our Product organization, and are responsible for developing the front-end user interface within our proprietary automation platform. You will work with multiple software engineers and product managers to continuously improve the UI of our automation solutions. You are great at solving problems, debugging, troubleshooting, designing, and implementing solutions to complex technical issues. Most importantly, you are a software developer with front-end focused JavaScript skills that wants a challenging environment to continue developing your skills!Technologies We Use: JavaScript, JSX, JSON, HTML & CSS, React, Mocha/Chai, ESLint, Postman, WebpackResponsibilities And DutiesDesign and develop user interfaces as a leader of an Agile teamUnderstand end user requirements and how they translate to functionalityDrive the creation of User Stories and development tasks within JiraMaintain constant contact with your Product Managers on status of the team's technical development tasksLead code reviews for your development team and maintain coding standards Ensure that your team's code is tested, robust, and secureMentor junior developers and members of your teamQualifications And SkillsBachelors degree in Computer Science or equivalent 5+ years experience as a software developer in an enterprise environment2+ years experience using front-end technologies and frameworks related to JavaScript developmentUnderstanding of Agile development methodologies Comfortable using Linux/*nix CLI Salary: $80,000 - $110,000/year, depending upon experienceLocation: Anywhere in the US (remote, work from home)Benefits And PerksA 401(k) plan, partially matched by Itential Free beer and Jenga Fridays! Catered technical Lunch & Learns Fully stocked soda fridges and snack pantries Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage Flex work time Volunteer and community engagement opportunities Find out more at This is a direct hire position. No third parties or recruiters accepted. No S-Corp or Corp-to-Corp.2d1GkVLQkI

This role is 100% remote in the US. We are an e-commerce software company that is executing a paradigm shift in the way that companies market their products. We are impacting small business owners in a powerful way. We have an immediate opening for a Senior Python Engineer. If you would like to have an immediate impact on an influential team, read on!

What you'll be doing:
• Work on a fast paced team and turn ideas into functional code.
• Play an important role in the development of best practices in software design, implementation and code standards.

room, beer on tap, standing desks and free lunches and more!

items.content:
My client in Madison is looking to hire a VueJS Developer to join their growing team. They are open to fully remote candidates so location isn't an issue. However, candidates who can occasionally come to the office will be preferred.



If interested, please contact Hannah at




We are looking for a motivated Senior Software Engineer with full web stack experience to help deliver these solutions to our customers. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will leverage Vue.js, Go and related open source solutions to help meet a diverse set of customer needs. You will participate in architectural decision making to advocate reliable and compliant solutions to expand our platform.


You will work directly with the Product Team to understand their needs, and design and deliver solutions based on the platform to meet those needs. You will collaborate with Engineers to ensure the platform continues to adapt to the increasingly-complex demands of our customers.


Expected Competencies


Need to have:


? Experience with any of the new javascript frontend frameworks. (Vue.js/Vuex, React/Redux, Elm)


? REST API development experience with Python and/or Go


? Experience with Postgres


? The patience and empathy for mentoring and leading mid-level developers


? Experience working in an Agile environment, including daily standups and constructive code reviews


? Strong knowledge of containerization technologies (Docker, Vagrant, etc.)


? Scripting experience with Bash, Python, Ruby, etc.


? Five years of experience working in Unix/Linux environments


? Experience with cloud environments such as AWS or Azure


? Experience with using Git effectively in a group environment



Nice to have:


? Experience writing extensive tests with a passion for automation


? Experience with configuration management (Terraform, SaltStack, Puppet, Ansible)


? Exposure to Kubernetes


? Any experience with pair programming


? Knowledge of continuous integration tools such as Jenkins or Gitlab CI


? Healthcare system development within a HIPAA and HITRUST compliant environment



Find Us on Facebook!


Follow Us on Twitter!


Beacon Hill is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace. Individuals with Disabilities and Protected Veterans are encouraged to apply.


Company Profile:


Beacon Hill Technologies, a premier National Information Technology Staffing Group, provides world class technology talent across all industries on a contract, direct (permanent), contract-to-direct and project basis. Beacon Hill Technologies' dedicated team of recruiting and staffing experts consistently delivers quality IT professionals to solve our customers' technical and business needs.


Beacon Hill Technologies covers a broad spectrum of IT positions, including Project Management and Business Analysis, Programming/Development, Database, Infrastructure, Quality Assurance, Production/Support and ERP roles.


Learn more about Beacon Hill Staffing Group and our specialty divisions, Beacon Hill Associates, Beacon Hill Financial, Beacon Hill HR, Beacon Hill Legal, Beacon Hill Pharma and Beacon Hill Technologies by visiting


We look forward to working with you.


Beacon Hill. Employing the Future (TM)

items.content: Welligent, a fast-growing Electronic Health Record (EHR) software vendor based in Norfolk, is seeking an experienced mobile application developer to develop and support custom-developed Welligent apps. A leading national software vendor, Welligent provides a comprehensive, enterprise cloud-based software solution which comprises practice management, clinical, billing and reporting functions. Ancillary to its cloud-based solutions, Welligent also offers mobile apps which offer a sub-set of functionality or complementary functionality to our cloud-based solutions. Welligent's customers include community-based behavioral/health and human services providers in more than 30 states. Our company culture and environment has the excitement of a start-up with the intensity of a growing healthcare information technology company solving national issues. There is a pervasive sense that the work we do is making a big impact in the lives of our customers and those they serve.Job Duties Serve as the primary app developer and responsible for app design and UI, all development, testing, debugging and on-going enhancements Lead Welligent's mobile development initiatives as the primary app developer and grow Welligent's mobile practice area Responsible for the ongoing evolution of our existing mobile apps, to enhance functionality and provide a better experience for end users Working within our existing application frameworks, provide creative input, expertise and technical methods Make a significant impact by working directly with the company and product owners, developers and other team members to improve upon an existing strong enterprise application with an extensive national user base Work with the business users to understand and document functionality requirements Collaborate with other technical team members including Welligent's web-services team to understand/ensure data requirements are met As needed, perform business and data requirements gathering and data analysis tasks Identify and document relevant data design, process and specifications Willingness to understand business context and problems and communicate them clearly in written and oral format Requirements Bachelor's degree required Advanced knowledge/experience with Angular with Javascript Advanced knowledge/experience with Cordova and plugins Knowledge of jQuery, Ionic, FullCalendar framework Must be familiar with PouchDB integration for SQLite Experience with SQLite offline storage Basic knowledge of TypeScript Basic knowledge of C++ for comping Windows package Must be familiar with NodeJs package manager PHP (must be familiar with curl basic authentications) Data encryption - AES, Hash NodeJs, must be familiar with package manager using the command line Sass (a plus but not needed since UI already built) User interface design and front end development experience Knowledge of HTML, DHTML, CSS and JavaScript Experience with Android Studio, Xcode/Swift, Visual Studio Experience with Apple, Google, and Microsoft store submission process and knowledge of creating and publishing provisioning profiles and certificates for all platforms. Must be familiar with HTTP services Some knowledge of Red Hat Linux server, basic knowledge of command line connection using SSH Knowledge of relational database design Ability to work independently and solve complex software problems Strong analytical and problem solving skills Knowledge of Healthcare IT, EHR/EMR or clinical systems preferred Experience working in a small team to build and enhance complex enterprise software applications Green card or US Citizenship required BenefitsIn addition to health, dental and 401K benefits, Welligent's competitive perks and benefits include the potential for year-end bonus, flexible work schedule, casual office environment in an up-and-coming area of Norfolk near Old Dominion University, no dress code, Starbucks coffee and an amazing group of co-workers.

items.content:
FullStack Developer

Full-time
Washington DC
Remote job
Startup

Posted Today – Accepting applications

Are you looking to work on a small team that is delivering a SAAS product for high growth Enterprise clients? We are a team of 5 people who are building sentimement analisys into commerical real estate touring software — think Matteport, Panoskin and Revit.

Currently we are looking to bring on another experienced developer who is comfortable writing backend and front end code. We’re based in Washington DC, but some of our team is located elsewhere in the US. We’re open to working with anyone from anywhere.

General process, is fairly typical. We run on two week development sprints, do regular deep dives into design meetings so the team is aligned, and hold bi-weekly retrospectives.

Some of the technologies we’re using — Heroku, AWS, IBM Watson, Matterport SDK, Google Cloud Services, Stripe and Asana/Notion for coordination.

We are working with some of the leading real estate developers and architects in the US, and we’re excited to bring our platform to market.

You have

  • At least 3 years of experience developing web applications with Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, Vue.js, HTML, and CSS
  • Familiarity with Git

Bonus points for experience with our tools

  • Machine Learning
  • Selenium
  • AWS

You are

  • Eager to work remotely and independently, from anywhere in the world.
  • Comfortable with video calls, and contributing to retrospectives, and design discussions.
  • Not looking for relocation - we’re a distributed team, and plan to stay that way.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Full Stack Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Big Data, Government, Military
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: APEX Expert Solutions | No office location

Technologies

angularjs
java
jira
intellij-idea
raptor

Job description

APEX bridges the gap between sensor and analyst in the evolving field of intelligence analysis. APEX tightly couples analysts, operators, and engineers to produce an unmatched level of problem-solving capacity for any situation.

Spanning various disciplines, including geospatial intelligence (GEOINT), signals intelligence (SIGINT), and human intelligence (HUMINT) analysis, APEX analysts, operators, and engineers work with operational mission partners to deliver novel technology, tactics, techniques, and procedures (T3P), relevant and modern training, and innovative technology solutions.

If you are a motivated individual willing to tackle challenging, and interesting problems, come be a part of our dynamic team!

Job Description

Apex Expert Solutions is seeking a highly motivated, self-directed professional to fill the role of  Senior Full Stack Developer. This position is based remotely.

Duties and Responsibilities:

The candidate will be part of two very dynamic and forward leaning teams. The Raptor team is creating cutting edge solutions for warfighters in the area of geo-visualization and sensor integration. And the Atlas team is building a high performance computing enabled data management and analysis platform.

On the Raptor team the candidate will be primarily tasked to assist the Keymaker team in making improvements and fixes to the Raptor plugins and core code. Raptor is written in Java and RaptorWeb is in AngularJS, it is expected that this position will require proficiency in both. They will participate in team meetings and sprint planning, facilitate QA and testing where needed and be involved in architectural and design events. Work will be performed using IntelliJ, JIRA, Confluence and Git(Fisheye+Crucible+Bitbucket).

As part of the ATLAS R&D effort the candidate will help conceptualize and implement user interfaces related to prototypes the team creates. The tooling  and implementation approach will align with what the ATLAS product team uses where possible. Tasks will involve creating novel approaches to visualization of numerous data types such as geospatial, temporal, textual, etc. The ideal candidate will enjoy learning new concepts as well as applying previously honed skillsets.

Education:

  •  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical discipline.

Qualifications: 

  • 5+ years of experience writing in Java, AngularJS and Material Design.
  • Ability to get access to DI2E which requires US citizenship

Desired Qualifications:

  • Experience coding in Raptor, WorldWind and OpenLayers 

Location:
Remote

Apply now

About APEX Expert Solutions

  • Do you want a career that matters?
  • Do you want to make a difference?
  • Are you creative?
  • Do you enjoy a fast-paced, highly dynamic environment?
  •  Are you passionate about data analytics or engineering?

If so, APEX may be the place for you! We are looking for talented technology professionals to join our team.

APEX Expert Solutions is a multi-discipline solutions provider headquartered in Arlington, VA, with additional locations in North Carolina and the Boston Metropolitan area.  APEX delivers analytical, operational, and engineering support to the government’s most important organizations.

Benefits

  • Vacations and holidays off
  • Cutting edge technology
  • Fantastic medical, dental and vision insurance
  • Work from home options
  • Social activities and events
  • Competitive salary and bonuses
  • Business casual attire
  • Collaborative environment

items.content:
Senior Frontend Developer – Remote Position

United Kingdom, London
Company: Hurren & Hope

Overview

Senior Frontend Developer with experience using Vue.js sought to join a growing financial technology company. This role has the potential to be based remotely or in their central London office. The company’s innovative platform can be embedded into their client’s systems which categorises and prioritises relevant research in a tailored way for asset managers to access without having to build further systems that interfere with existing workflows. The company are now entering their next phase of growth which is solely focused on introducing their platform into new markets and they now require a seasoned Frontend Developer to join the team.

The role will mainly see you working in a small agile team creating new user-face features from design whilst improving existing ones in Vue.js and working with the wider teams to design new functionalities. Successful candidates will need to display solid frontend experience using Vue.JS although developers with knowledge using React or Angular open to learning Vue.js will also be considered. The primary focus for the directors is hiring the right personal traits as opposed to what skills you can bring to the table, so passion, an ability to learn, a team player mentality and individuals who want to make a difference are high on the list with the only mandatory technical requirement being Vue.js experience. Candidates from a full stack background using Python will earn extra marks and help put your CV to the top of the pile.

A competitive salary depending on experience is on offer up to £90k and extensive benefits alongside the opportunity to work with a truly welcoming team. Hurren and Hope are the companies chosen talent partner for this recruitment campaign. If this could be a good match for your career aspirations please contact us and we’ll be happy to provide more information.

‘It’s about people, not sales!’

Apply for job

Software Developer (m/w/d) Ruby on Rails, Remote

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer
Company: HAUSGOLD - talocasa GmbH | Hamburg, Deutschland

Remote details

Office Location: Hamburg, Deutschland. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

ruby-on-rails
ruby

Job description

HAUSGOLD digitalisiert den Verkaufsprozess von Immobilien für Verkäufer, Käufer und Makler mit dem Ziel mehr Transparenz und Effizienz zu schaffen. Unsere eigenentwickelte Software und eine professionelle Kundenbetreuung bilden zusammen mit unserem Netzwerk von mehreren tausend Maklern vor Ort eine einzigartige Basis für unser weiteres Wachstum.

Anfang 2014 gegründet, haben wir uns inzwischen zu einem der führenden PropTech Unternehmen im deutschsprachigen Raum entwickelt. Unser Team aus mittlerweile über 50 Mitarbeitern und namhafte Investoren wie der Deutschen Bank oder Rocket Internet bilden die Basis unseres Erfolgs.

Wir vergrößern unser Development-Team und suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Dich als Software Developer (m/w/d) Ruby on Rails in Hamburger Schanzenviertel oder Remote.

WELCHE AUFGABEN AUF DICH WARTEN

Als Ruby on Rails Developer bei HAUSGOLD konzipierst, entwickelst und wartest Du Services in unserer serviceorientierten Architektur und hilfst uns vorhandene monolithische Systeme abzulösen. Du entwickelst Schnittstellen für Web und Mobile und dokumentierst Deine Arbeit für das Team. Neben Codereviews und Workshops unterstützt Du unser Team mit Deinem Know-How.

Einen kleinen Einblick bekommst Du hier: https://hausgold.github.io/ 

DEINE QUALIFIKATIONEN

  • Du verfügst über eine Ausbildung oder ein Studium im Bereich der Informatik oder hast einen vergleichbaren Abschluss
  • Du hast sehr gute Kenntnisse in Ruby on Rails
  • Du hast Erfahrung mit agiler Softwareentwicklung
  • Du hast Erfahrungen mit der Versionsverwaltung unter Git
  • Du nutzt REST-APIs und TDD/BDD
  • Idealerweise hast Du bereits Erfahrungen mit Docker sammeln können
  • Konzentriertes und sorgfältiges Arbeiten sowie eine strukturierte und koordinierte Arbeitsweise runden Dein Profil ab

Darüber hinaus sind folgende Kenntnisse von Vorteil

  • Bootstrap mit Sass
  • Grundkenntnisse in der Frontend-Entwicklung mit Angular oder React
  • Erfahrung mit Responsive Design unter der Verwendung von HTML5 und CSS3

Im Übrigen handeln wir nach der Maxime, dass man nicht alles schon können muss, aber gerne lernen möchte.

WAS WIR DIR BIETEN

DEINE BENEFITS

  • Hier kannst Du proaktiv Fragen stellen, brainstormen und auch in Remote zusammen mit Deinen Kollegen arbeiten
  • Du hast eine zuverlässige Entwicklungsumgebung mit u.a. High-Speed Internet und Phone Access
  • Bei uns hast Du ein Umfeld, in dem Du fokussiert und ohne Ablenkung arbeiten kannst

WAS HAUSGOLD DIR DARÜBER HINAUS BIETET

  • Ein aufstrebendes Technologieprojekt mit professioneller Entwicklungsmethodik

Du bist Developer aus Leidenschaft und hast Lust Dich in unserem Internet-Startup einzubringen? Dann bewirb Dich ONLINE mit Deinem aussagekräftigen Lebenslauf inklusive der Angabe Deines möglichen Eintrittstermins sowie Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung.

Deine Ansprechpartnerin ist Lynda. Melde Dich gerne bei uns, falls Du Fragen zu Deiner Bewerbung hast.

items.content:
Engineering Manager - Passenger Team - Full Remote in Europe

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead, Manager
Industry: Carsharing, Marketplace, Transportation
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Heetch | No office location

Technologies

microservices
go
docker

Job description

⚠️Read before applying:

We're a young company iterating over our remote culture so for now, we're only working with people in locations where the time zone is: -3 hours > Paris time zone < +3 hours

Passenger Team @Heetch

The top priority of our user-centric team is the happiness of our passengers. From the moment they decide to join us until they enter our marketplace, passengers will be using our products. And our mission is to make sure they get the stellar experience they deserve. The scope of the team includes passenger acquisition, to ensure that passengers can signup smoothly in a few seconds, and passenger account, to provide a wonderful lifecycle experience to our passengers and help them oversee their passenger account between 2 rides. Given our business scope, our team is working side-by-side with other Product teams and partners (Operations and Marketing teams), allowing us to build features that will empower passengers with new ways to ride.

Mindset

  • Move fast not furious.
  • Don’t be scared of failure, learn from it and try again.
  • Unit and functional tests are as important as code.
  • Code is always evolving we do not think in versions.
  • We’re not just here to push code, product ownerships equally spread amongst the team.

Our team's values

  • Work wherever you want: We’ve always been remote first but also have shiny offices in Paris, London, Brussels and Casablanca.
  • Open communication: Everything is public within the team.
  • You are not alone: We use Slack and video calls every day.
  • Promulgate Knowledge: Whether it's organizational, cultural or technical, we're eager to learn!
  • Continuous improvement: We do weekly team retrospectives and have a strong Speak Up value.

What will be your role?

As an Engineering Manager, you will 100% remotely manage a fast-growing engineering team to build a product on a highly scalable technology stack (full microservices architecture in Golang running on top of Docker).

Does it sound like you?

  • You have more than 4 years of engineering leadership experience with at least 2 years managing multiple teams in different locations.
  • You've already worked in a fast-paced environment within a small company.
  • You have strong communication skills: You're able to interact with a variety of profiles, from technical to non-technical.
  • You show a significant track record of attracting, retaining, and mentoring top talent within the industry.
  • You're committed to controlling unconscious biases in recruiting for your team in order to attract diverse candidates.
  • You have a proven ability to motivate and inspire a talented and creative technical team to perform.
  • You understand and are experienced in building highly scalable, highly available distributed systems.
  • You can develop a comprehensive platform performance and scalability strategy while continuously delivering product improvements.

What will you do?

Deliver

  • Work with engineering, product, and UX teams to facilitate project delivery by ensuring alignment and on time delivery
  • Define, implement, and oversee a flexible and effective development process to reach the team's delivery goals
  • Offer a collaborative and welcoming development environment for your team members
  • Deliver high quality, high availability, highly reliable, scalable, and secure distributed systems

Coach

  • Support and inspire an ambitious group of engineers in their career goals
  • Work with our people operations team to maintain our high performance and high morale
  • Oversee a distributed team (fully remote across Europe) of motivated engineers spanning all experience levels
  • Facilitate continuous learning and improvement for the team and its members
  • Provide technical and non-technical guidance to the team, both individually and as a group
  • Maximize team productivity and build loyalty by deeply understanding & incorporating various motivations, working styles and preferences
  • Cultivate high engagement, performance and commitment to the product through a motivational & visionary approach
  • Develop and mentor upcoming leaders and key engineers

Hire

  • Be actively involved in hiring and growing our engineering team
  • Plan and implement hiring strategies to attract talent within your team
  • Advocate for engineering and management on the blog or at social and tech events
  • Recruit outstanding technical talents from diverse backgrounds while continuously enhancing our recruiting strategies and programs

Drive changes

  • Help us grow and evolve our engineering culture
  • Work with other engineering managers to drive cultural changes across the organisation

What will be your main challenges?

Now in a Bootstrap phase, you’ll play a major role in leading the team’s dynamic, growth and culture. Your main challenge will be to create the team’s vision based on what was handled by other teams before and take ownership of your defined scope to deliver impactful results.

What's next?

If your application is selected, the process will be composed of 3 steps:

  1. Interview with your line manager (1h30)
  2. Interview with a panel of Engineering Managers (1h30)
  3. Day on site (Paris) to meet your future team and stakeholders
Apply now

About Heetch

Heetch is a mobility app with a simple mission: We want people to enjoy going out.
Every night and every day, our drivers are doing their best to make their rides unforgettable and friendly! We are focused on young people's expectations and are competing within a fast-paced market.

The service launched in Paris in September 2013 has been growing ever since, with thousands of daily rides in France, Belgium, and Morocco. With more than 1 million users in Europe, we are proud to be one of the fastest growing French startups!

Benefits

  • Full remote and flexible ways of working
  • Paid conferences attendance/travel
  • Code Retreat
  • 2 company seminars
  • Travel budget to visit your co-workers
  • Heetch Credits

items.content:
Employer: www.lex.lawyer


Location: peckhamlevels.org (with some home working)


Type: full time permanent


Pay: £70-100k+ depending on experience





From the team that brought you www.monacosolicitors.co.uk and www.monacodigital.co.uk, we're now building a groundbreaking legal app called Lex which is intended to open up legal services & access to justice to the average person, globally. We need a senior developer and we’ve made a video for the role here.


The concept of the app is to give people video calls with a lawyer at the press of a button, to deal with their problems like employment, matrimonial, tax and property. Most people have never used a lawyer (other than perhaps for conveyancing) and we want to change that. It is similar to the Babylon health app but for lawyers instead of doctors. 


 


This is a fantastic opportunity to make a difference and work with a dynamic and forward thinking startup team. We encourage teamwork and open discussion, especially for problem solving, and we have a real passion for bringing the provision of legal services up to date using tech. In fact, Monaco Solicitors was recently shortlisted in the Law Society Excellence Awards for innovation in technology.


 


The product team currently consists of 1 front end dev and 2 designers plus a product owner. To give you a little sneak peek of what you will be building, our app will feature the following:


 


Account creation (both Lawyers and clients)



  • Lawyer and user profiles

  • Calendar booking system with availability

  • Cloud stored documents/paperwork

  • Provision of advice from Lawyer in paid sessions, including video call

  • Payment gateway


 


Skills Required



  • Building React & React Native apps 

  • Building PWA (progressive web apps)

  • Javascript, ES6+

  • NodeJs (AWS lambda / serverless)

  • Minimum 6-8 years of Experience in creating Web & Apps solutions

  • IT infrastructure and cloud development

  • Software architecture design

  • DevOps

  • Project and product management


 


Responsibilities



  • Coding (minimum 50% of the role)

  • Analysing requirements and coming up with appropriate solutions

  • Setting up the workflow for devs 

  • Guiding and participating in stack selection

  • Project management, agile / scrum 


 


Nice to have



  • AWS ecosystem experience


 


Benefits



  • Competitive salary

  • Pension scheme

  • Opportunity to work from home 

  • Unique office space (converted multi-storey car park in Peckham

items.content:
Frontend Lead Developer

Position overview

Your task at Neufund will be to create architecture and build innovative front-end/mobile solutions for our investment platform. Neufund has a deep blockchain tech stack and complex product delivered to demanding users. You will work in an agile team with experience in React, NodeJS, Typescript, Ethereum, Solidity, Go, Rust, Haskell, Python, IPFS, PostgreSQL, NoSQL, HTML5/CSS and more. You will also work closely with our backend team and be responsible for delivering desktop and mobile apps.

You

  • Write the code for expressive and innovative UI/UX.
  • Create architecture for desktop and mobile applications.
  • Work at the forefront of blockchain and open source.
  • Introduce new solutions and optimizing current ones.
  • Work on cross-functional teams with UX designers.
  • Come up with original and elegant solutions to problems.

What we ask for

  • Proficient knowledge of React, React Native, NodeJS, Typescript.
  • Experience with state management solutions (preferably Redux).
  • Experience with both production-quality code and rapid prototyping.
  • At least 7 years experience as a front-end engineer.
  • Experience with Ethereum blockchain is a plus.
  • Ability to work in an agile energetic startup environment.

What we offer

  • Competitive compensation. We want professionals with real experience.
  • Share Success. Through our Employee Stock Option Plan all Neufunders become shareholders in the company.
  • Flexible Working. Work from home on a Friday, or choose to take the day off and make it up over the weekend.
  • Healthy Food. Team lunch once a week, breakfast buffet, snacks and beverages all week long.
  • Team Offsites. Meditation workshops, team building and educational presentations. We grow together during offsites in beautiful location.
  • Sports Card. Access hundreds of sports venues in Berlin and across Germany with membership to Urban Sports Club.
  • Career Coaching. Develop your career path with a professional career coach on the side.
  • Holiday Season. No matter what your plans for the winter holiday season, our shop is closed between December and January.
  • Relocation Support. We sponsor visas and offer relocation support. We will help you to get to Berlin and get settled.
  • Grow with Neufund. Let’s practice mindfulness and learn together over our team workshops.

Get in touch!

Feel free to send us questions and applications at 

Apply now

items.content:
Chili Piper

Front End Engineer

verified
Worldwide
Chili Piper is seeking talented, motivated engineers to join our fully remote team building interactive data applications. As a part of growing front-end team, you will work with designers to constantly improving our users’ experience. You will also collaborate with others throughout our organization and technology stack to build products that are revolutionizing the way our clients achieve their business goals. On the front-end team, we feel strongly about developing solutions that are both technically and aesthetically sound. We invite you to bring your experience and perspective to conversations about the future growth of our applications and environment. We work closely together, with a healthy and non-combative review process aimed at improving code as well as developing each other’s skills. In short, we strive to write solid, thoroughly tested, and readable code; and we are seeking a new contributor to our already highly effective team. **How We Work ** Freedom and flexibility. We’re a 100% distributed team working from around the world. Our team members can work from wherever they want in the world, as long as they show up on our weekly all hands meeting on Zoom. Solve interesting problems. The software landscape has exploded. There are dozens of solutions for each problem. We want to be different. We come up with new angles on existing problems or invent better solutions to help companies with their sales and marketing. Then we turn these ideas into beautiful, smart software. Autonomy and ownership. Working on a distributed team means you don’t have someone micromanaging you or looking over your shoulder to make sure you’re getting things done. We’re a team of do-ers who take full ownership for their results. Be helpful. Our first value as a company is help. Help our customers be successful. Help our prospects get the right information and make the right decision whether or not it includes our products. Help our team members reach their full potential. # Responsibilities ● Participate in technical planning & requirements gathering phases including Design, code, test, troubleshoot, and document engineering software applications. ● Ensuring that technical software development process is followed on the project, familiar with industry best practices for software development. ● Develop applications in languages including React JS ● Demonstrate the ability to adapt and work with team members of various experience level. ● Translating designs and wireframes into high quality code # Requirements ● Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model ● Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles (2+ years of work experience with React) ● Experience with popular React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux) ● Familiarity with newer specifications of EcmaScript ● Experience with data structure libraries (e.g., Immutable.js) ● Knowledge of isomorphic React is a plus ● Familiarity with RESTful APIs ● Knowledge of modern authorization mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token ● Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools ● Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc. ● Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements ● A knack for benchmarking and optimization #Location - Worldwide

Junior Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Bioinformatics, Computer Software, Digital Health
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Self Decode | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-08:00) Pacific Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

python
javascript
git
oop
sql

Job description

Job Type and Pay: 

We are looking for a talented backend Django developer. Pay will be in accordance with abilities and experience.

  • Full-time or part-time
  • Position is remote
  • No agencies
  • Must work a minimum of 4 hours within PST time zone between 9AM to 8PM PST

Requirements:

  • Good communication skills
  • 1-2 years of professional experience in web development
  • Strong skills in Python, HTML, CSS and JavaScript
  • Experience with Git
  • Solid understanding of object-oriented programming (OOP)
  • Good understanding of relational databases (SQL)

Plus:

  • Professional experience with any of the following:
    • Django web framework
    • React
    • Vue
    • Data engineering
    • Linux and command-line interfaces
    • AWS
Apply now

About Self Decode

About Us:

We are a fast-growing and leading company in the personalized health space. We build software to help interpret peoples’ genetics, lab tests and symptoms in order to give personalized health recommendations.

  • Our primary goal is to give people the tools they need to live a healthier and better life
  • We are a flat organization and prioritize efficiency
  • We work as a team and every input and suggestion is taken into account, no matter who it comes from
  • We thrive on open communication and dedication
  • We are a meritocracy and people who show good abilities can move up in the organization fast.

Our three companies:

Selfhacked.com - With over 1.5 million visitors per month, SelfHacked is the best source of scientific information on supplements and health topics with integrity, no agenda or ideology. We strive for completeness and accuracy, and we work to make it accessible for everyone. The SelfHacked team includes 4 PhDs, 1 PharmD, 2 PhD students, 2 MS in biology, and a few biochemistry graduates.
SelfDecode.com - We analyze people's DNA (over 15,000 users so far) and symptoms and give them health recommendations based on their DNA that are simple and easy to understand using our custom-built algorithms. 
LabTestAnalyzer.com - Provides high-quality, science-backed information and lifestyle, diet, and supplement recommendations based on lab test results.

We are very selective in our process because we look for a very long-term, full time partnership with our employees. 

We try to keep the process as short as possible, so that we don't waste anyone's time. We've designed our tests and procedures so that if someone doesn't score above a certain threshold for a given segment, they are booted from the application process early. Most people will not spend more than 10 min of their time on our process. People who do well keep progressing and ultimately get hired and love working for our company!

If this is the type of company you want to be a part of, apply now! 

Benefits

  • Remote

items.content:
Senior Front End Developer - *3D Rendering* [REMOTE]

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time

Technologies

reactjs
javascript
3d
rendering
three.js

Job description

This is a senior-level position, we are not currently considering candidates who do not meet the minimum requirements listed below.

Clevertech is a remote-first software development team building transformative enterprise solutions. Our world-class, senior developers are making a truly meaningful impact with these highly complex and substantive solutions. Currently, we are seeking a Senior Front End Developer with strong math and 3d rendering background.

In this position, you will be presented with real-world constraints and data, based on systems rules you'll produce 3d renderings on the fly that maximize particular business utilizations.

Basic Requirements:

  • B.S. in Computer Science/Mathematics, or comparable field experience
  • MUST HAVE professional working knowledge of 3D modeling workflows and software (WebGL, OpenGL, ThreeJS, etc.)
  • Production-level experience leveraging ReactJS
  • Minimum 5 years of professional development experience (A technical assessment will be required)
  • Native-level English; ability to clearly communicate complex concepts verbally
  • Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates able to work in North American time zones

Expected timeline:

We move quickly. If you are the right person, we want you here. We’ve moved from application to hire in 1-2 weeks time.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Set yourself up for success and take a look at our Interview Process prior to filling out your application.

Clevertech's Career Growth Video

Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work

Getting Hired

We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers and our video highlighting Clevertech's Culture

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend

items.content:
**Who we are**
Sticker Mule is the Internet's fastest-growing printing company. We are privately-owned, profitable, and powered by an outstanding, globally distributed team who cares deeply about delivering a great customer experience at the highest technical standards. Our software engineering team operates from 17 different countries, and we're always looking for more exceptional engineers to join us.
See more about our teams [here](https://www.stickermule.com/about) and [here](https://www.keyvalues.com/sticker-mule)
**What you'll do**
1. Design, build, test, deploy and maintain web applications and services.
2. Write clean, performant code in accordance with our team’s code style guidelines.
3. Work to improve and maintain the code health of all our software.
4. Collaborate with team leads and stakeholders to ensure that we’re always building the best possible solution in the optimal way.
5. Participate in peer code reviews.
6. Share expertise with other members of the team, mentor junior developers.
**About you**
1. You have a minimum of 3 years professional software development experience.
2. You’re highly competent in JavaScript. Experience with Golang would be a benefit.
3. You have experience building single page applications, ideally with with React.
4. You possess strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
5. You have great written and verbal communication skills in English.
**What we offer**
1. A competitive salary.
2. Remote working with flexible schedule.
3. Opportunity to make a large impact as part of a small, highly motivated team.
4. Varied, interesting technical challenges to work on.
