items.content:
Mobile Chapter Lead Front-End (m/f/d)

Company: Raisin
Location: Berlin, DE
Level: Senior
Language: English
Mobile Apps Developer
Skills:
  • Android
  • iOS
  • Mobile Architecture
  • Mobile Web Design
  • React
  • React Native
  • Team Leadership

    • Intro

    We are a dynamic, successful, and fast growing FinTech company based in Berlin, that aims to making savings and investments digitally accessible to improve customer benefit. Our goal is to provide customers all over Europe with simple, secure, and profitable savings and investment products without barriers. We have received more than €195 million in funding from well-known investors including Thrive Capital, Ribbit Capital, Index Ventures, Yuri Milner, Tom Stafford and PayPal.
    Raisin has been very successful over the last few years at delighting it’s customers through enabling deposits and investments without barriers across the EU. 

    Your mission as an experienced Leader & React Native Developer is to enable teams to build great solutions with delighting UI’s and an amazing mobile user experience. Increasing the engagement of existing customers and winning over new customer groups and market segments are amongst the key objectives.

    Your Responsibilities:

    • You are Chapter lead, with accountability for the improvement of our overall mobile engineering capability, including talent, workflows and tools
    • You are Key contributor in a cross-functional mobile team
    • You are a hands-on team lead and mentor
    • You ensure a high working morale, teamspirit, and productivity
    • You develop both your chapter’s soft- and technical skill-set according to the company goals and needs
    • You coach your chapter to remove obstacles independently, but you also get your hands dirty, when needed
    • You are a role model and inspire your chapter to live our principles of customer-centric innovation, entrepreneurship and responsibility
    • You are a key contributor to an efficient development environment and optimal workflows for the whole engineering organization
    • You are a great communicator and empathetic motivator when needed 

    Main requirements

     Your Profile:

    • You bring at least 3 years of leadership experience
    • You know how to manage software projects to a successful delivery in a collaborative way
    • Entrepreneurial mindset and the ability to guide teams towards a common goal in a fast-paced international environment
    • You have strong experience (3y)  with React Native / Redux and have a portfolio of nice examples that showcases your experience
    • You have a deep understanding of the app integration and delivery lifecycle, including code signing and app store reviews
    • You are an open-minded and creative team player enjoying constructive code and architecture discussions
    • Writing clean, maintainable and well-documented code comes naturally - we strongly believe in the power of clean code
    • Android (Java) and/or iOS (Swift) experience is a plus
    • Fluency in English, German language skills are a plus though not mandatory 

     

    Our Benefits:

    Be part of a diverse team of more than 34 different nationalities, who strongly believes in agile cross-functional methods, collaboration and appreciation in our daily work. We are professional and work hard to always be the best in our field. You find us in our open office in beautiful Prenzlauer Berg well connected to public transport and surrounded by a great variety of restaurants and supermarkets.

    • Relocation and visa support as well as a relocation reimbursement
    • Personal training budget of 1,700 € and four full training days
    • Free choice of hardware
    • Beginner German classes directly at the office and financial support for acquiring a language certificate 
    • Hungry all the time? Breakfast, snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks are provided
    • Stay up to date at regular townhall sessions with our founders and feel free to ask any kinds of questions
    • Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days 
    • Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than 20 € per month 
    • We offer you a company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20 %
    • Enjoy yearly company retreats to exciting European cities and other team events, such as Lunch Lottery, Tech Lunch, Xletix and Raisin Ladies Events

items.title: Software Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=6, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=29, embedded=0, frontend=30}
items.content:
About Tutorful Founded in 2015, Tutorful is a tech start-up situated in the heart of Sheffield. Our vision and mission is to make tutoring affordable and accessible to all. We now have over 10,000 tutors across the UK delivering over 10,000 lessons per week, both in person and online. Our revolutionary approach to tutoring and our fantastic growth have helped us become recognised as one of the top 100 startups in the UK. We’re building a stellar team to help us achieve our goal. We strive to create an environment where you can do your best work - our people are empowered to make the bold decisions others wouldn’t, and make a genuine impact on the lives of thousands of young learners. Join us, and you’ll be challenged and supported in equal measure.


The role


We are looking for a full stack developer who can help define and build the customer-facing side of our business. The role will include: Joining a small, autonomous, agile team using modern web development methodologies such as continuous delivery. Working with your team to come up with ideas and define the backlog, with the aim of solving real customer problems. Bringing new features to life, from initial design through to writing well structured modular code, automated tests, and deployment. Working closely with other teams around the office, including product managers, marketing and customer support. What we’re looking for We don’t have an ideal candidate, and aptitude and a willingness to learn are just as important than qualifications or experience.


 


With that said, having familiarity with some of the technologies and methodologies below would be beneficial:


Prior experience and success building products as a full stack developer.


Knowledge of PHP 7, and a modern framework such as Laravel or Symfony.


Experience building and using scalable APIs. Familiarity with modern devops, including deployment pipelines.


Fluency with at least one major Javascript framework (ideally Vue, but experience in React or Angular would also be applicable).


An understanding of scalable frontend architecture. Familiarity with modern tooling such as Grunt/Gulp, Webpack, Docker, Git etc.


 


If you have skills that align with this role and you could contribute to our goals but your experience or salary expectations don't match what we're offering, don't be put off. We look for the right people and we are flexible, so we'd still encourage applications from strong candidates.


 


Benefits: Some of our benefits include: 25 days holiday, with an extra day for each year you are with us (up to 28).


An additional 5 days holiday through salary sacrifice.


Genuinely flexible working, with remote working on Wednesdays.


A great office environment, including free fruit, beer on Thursday afternoons, and regular company-organised socials.


Regular conference opportunities and a dedicated training budget.


A generous equity scheme for senior employees.


Please send CV’s if you feel you would be a good fit for this role. We look forward to hearing from you.

items.content:
Vue.js Developer (Remote)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: X-Team | No office location

Technologies

javascript
vue.js
reactjs
angular

Job description

Most important:

  • Experience with Vue.js, Vue Router and Vuex
  • Experience with Sass, Less and/or CSS Modules
  • Experience with Webpack
  • Ability to build and improve a REST/JSON API client
  • Ability to debug API responses
  • Write high-performance, reusable code for UI components
  • Experience with testing frameworks

Nice to have:

  • Experience working remotely
  • Familiar/involved with open source projects
  • Experience with type checking solutions (e.g. TypeScript)
  • Experience within a continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) environment
  • Experience with a backend language/framework (e.g. Node, Python, Go, PHP)

Personal:

  • Independent, self-motivated
  • Fluent in English, written and spoken
  • Proven track record of always learning and growing
  • Proactive attitude
  • Possess a spirit of generosity

Perks:

  • Get the chance to work with big brands like Riot Games (League of Legends), Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc., Coinbase (#1 crypto exchange), BeachBody (#1 fitness company), etc.
  • Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world. 
  • Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads.
  • Be part of the most energizing community for developers in the world by participating in our Seasons, a 3-month experience filled with challenges, rewards, games, competitions, and more, all centered around a theme that will inspire and energize you. 
  • Get $2,500 per year (Unleash+) to spend on doing more of what you love and staying energized. Use it on conferences, courses, video games, photography equipment, a gym membership, adventure sports, baby/pet sitting, productivity apps, restaurants, coworking, headphones, etc. #NeverStopExploring 
Apply now

About X-Team

"Motivated developers, ready to join your team."

X-Team is a 100% remote international company, originally founded in Melbourne, Australia. We help companies scale their development teams by providing them with extraordinary teams of developers from around the world.

We believe in living a life of freedom that allows you to spend more time getting energized by your passions. We've fostered a unique, active lifestyle and culture around this idea that continues to attract thousands of developers to apply every day. Our community is the most energizing community for developers in the world.

What separates us from our competition is the level of attention and care we give our developers compared to other more "talent"-based solutions. We proactively support them, fund their learning and growth, connect them in roaming hacker houses around the world, and give them a remote environment that motivates and inspires them on a daily basis. While other companies simply place and drop their talent, we foster and cater to our unified teams of developers centered around the same beliefs, values and lifestyle.

We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age and aid them in being able to do so properly with the right people.

Who is X-Team meant for?

Any freelance developers with experience working on high-scale, remote teams and projects with a motivated, proactive attitude and compassionate, team-player heart. If you've worked with freelancing platforms before, that's not what we are. X-Team is a community of all likeminded people, carefully chosen to ensure we are able to create an environment of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we've created is truly special and not a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together, while becoming more motivated and energized than they've ever been.

Benefits

  • Get the chance to work with big brands
  • Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses around the world
  • Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads
  • Join our vibrant community
  • We provide up to $2,500 in funding for your growth & wellbeing
  • Gym reimbursement

items.content:
Remote - Frontend Developer - React JS- £25K - £35K DOE

A long standing SaaS company are looking for a Frontend Developer (React JS) to join their team. This company have had outstanding industry success over the last 25 years. They work with a large portfolio of clients, including over 20% of the FTSE 100!

Innovation is at the forefront of this company, they pride themselves creating cutting edge and unrivalled solutions. The successful Frontend Developer (React js) will work amongst their development team and will be involved heavily in the development of web based solutions.

They are currently in the process of developing a brand new 100% cloud based platform within Azure, and have lots of brand new projects. This role is a fantastic opportunity for a Frontend Developer (React JS) who wants to work within a tech focussed company, where you will be able to work on exciting projects.

To be eligible you must be currently living in the UK, and are able to commute to their North Yorkshire offices 1-2 times a month.

Skills

  • HTML5
  • CSS3
  • JavaScript
  • React.js or other JavaScript Libraries such as Angular.JS / Vue.js
  • Knowledge of ASP.Net / C# would be desirable but not essential.

Salary for this role is up to £35K DOE and benefits include: 20% of time allowed for innovation, 26 days holiday + bank holidays , private medical, pension and training.

To apply, please send your CV

items.content:
Front-end Developer - TypeScript, React, Redux - REMOTE UK (UK company, work from home) - £40,000 - £45,000 - ASAP.

We are looking for experienced Engineers for an exciting start-up who are making big waves in their industry.

Remote First - Work from anywhere in the UK as long as you can get to London one day per month
Cloud First
Greenfield - zero legacy
TypeScript
React
Redux
Latest IDE's
Latest versions of everything ("we are using the really shiny new stuff!")
R&D focus

This is one of those rare opportunities to get in somewhere at the beginning and grow with the business. You really can work from anywhere but most of the team are in East Anglia (around Ipswich). The only requirements are that you must be in London one day per month (expensed) and they have social events for team bonding (Milton Keynes Snowdome was the last one). The team are in constant contact via video and messenger, so you never feel alone, and the sprint is always moving forward.

Their full tech stack:

C#
.NET Core
TypeScript
JavaScript
React
Redux
MS SQL
Azure Cosmos DB

If you are a passionate coder, who loves to innovate and break the mould then please apply NOW or contact Simon Morris at Prime Appointments for more information and a confidential chat.

I have known the CTO of the business for many years. I had the pleasure of recruiting for his last venture where he took them from 30 staff to 200. He is passionate, empowering and extremely inspiring. He will help you have the career you want. The interview process will be quite informal, and we will give you all the information you need to help you through the process.

Prime Appointments, recruitment with a personal touch.

items.content: Welligent, a fast-growing Electronic Health Record (EHR) software vendor based in Norfolk, is seeking an experienced mobile application developer to develop and support custom-developed Welligent apps. A leading national software vendor, Welligent provides a comprehensive, enterprise cloud-based software solution which comprises practice management, clinical, billing and reporting functions. Ancillary to its cloud-based solutions, Welligent also offers mobile apps which offer a sub-set of functionality or complementary functionality to our cloud-based solutions. Welligent's customers include community-based behavioral/health and human services providers in more than 30 states. Our company culture and environment has the excitement of a start-up with the intensity of a growing healthcare information technology company solving national issues. There is a pervasive sense that the work we do is making a big impact in the lives of our customers and those they serve.Job Duties Serve as the primary app developer and responsible for app design and UI, all development, testing, debugging and on-going enhancements Lead Welligent's mobile development initiatives as the primary app developer and grow Welligent's mobile practice area Responsible for the ongoing evolution of our existing mobile apps, to enhance functionality and provide a better experience for end users Working within our existing application frameworks, provide creative input, expertise and technical methods Make a significant impact by working directly with the company and product owners, developers and other team members to improve upon an existing strong enterprise application with an extensive national user base Work with the business users to understand and document functionality requirements Collaborate with other technical team members including Welligent's web-services team to understand/ensure data requirements are met As needed, perform business and data requirements gathering and data analysis tasks Identify and document relevant data design, process and specifications Willingness to understand business context and problems and communicate them clearly in written and oral format Requirements Bachelor's degree required Advanced knowledge/experience with Angular with Javascript Advanced knowledge/experience with Cordova and plugins Knowledge of jQuery, Ionic, FullCalendar framework Must be familiar with PouchDB integration for SQLite Experience with SQLite offline storage Basic knowledge of TypeScript Basic knowledge of C++ for comping Windows package Must be familiar with NodeJs package manager PHP (must be familiar with curl basic authentications) Data encryption - AES, Hash NodeJs, must be familiar with package manager using the command line Sass (a plus but not needed since UI already built) User interface design and front end development experience Knowledge of HTML, DHTML, CSS and JavaScript Experience with Android Studio, Xcode/Swift, Visual Studio Experience with Apple, Google, and Microsoft store submission process and knowledge of creating and publishing provisioning profiles and certificates for all platforms. Must be familiar with HTTP services Some knowledge of Red Hat Linux server, basic knowledge of command line connection using SSH Knowledge of relational database design Ability to work independently and solve complex software problems Strong analytical and problem solving skills Knowledge of Healthcare IT, EHR/EMR or clinical systems preferred Experience working in a small team to build and enhance complex enterprise software applications Green card or US Citizenship required BenefitsIn addition to health, dental and 401K benefits, Welligent's competitive perks and benefits include the potential for year-end bonus, flexible work schedule, casual office environment in an up-and-coming area of Norfolk near Old Dominion University, no dress code, Starbucks coffee and an amazing group of co-workers.

items.content:
Surevine

 

Senior Front End Developer

We aren’t looking for a ‘Rock Star’ or a ‘Ninja’. We aren’t looking for a ‘Super Star Developer’ either. We want a team player; someone who is tenacious about getting things done as part of a team in an environment that expects creativity and quality delivery. Be a rebel but be part of our rebel alliance. Skills and experience Essential * Layout and presentation skills in HTML, CSS and related technologies * Expertise in JavaScript with a minimum of 5 years’ experience – ES6; Babel JS * Experience of modern web frameworks and libraries, in particular React JS * Single Page Applications (SPA) – Create React App / Next JS / Gatsby; React Router / Reach Router; Redux & Redux-Saga * Unit Testing – Jest; React Testing Library / Enzyme; Snapshot Testing * Web Accessibility – WCAG; Axe * Web application user interface design skills and experience * A thorough understanding of web concepts: HTTP, REST, web services, etc * Experience working on Agile projects, particularly Kanban or Scrum * Tenacious technical problem solver * Good communicator * Demonstrable experience of working with version control, build tools, code-quality and testing tools. Desirable * Experience with Government Digital Service (GDS) * Experience with Design Systems – Storybook; Styled Components / Emotion * Experience of test automation – Cypress; Puppeteer * Experience in any of the following is useful: Typescript; ESLint; Standard JS / Prettier; JSON Schema; Sketch * Experience of developing for deployment to the public cloud (e.g. AWS, AWS Amplify, Azure, etc.) * Experience using the Atlassian suite (Jira, Confluence, etc.) * Working knowledge of best practices: version control, unit testing, CI and documentation * Comfortable using the command line to support application development and deployment - GIT; Bash scripts * Experience with developing and deploying with container technologies, in particular Docker. Responsibilities * Develop solutions that meet the needs of users by considering the user at every step of the delivery process; from understanding the need to designing the solution and delivery * Work as an integral member of a small, remote team * Agree and deliver on sprint commitments * Design and implements secure software components * Participate in the iterative user needs analysis and design phases * Ensure that code is well-tested in development and to take part in systems integration testing where required, to meet the agreed level of quality (Jest) * Participate in peer review processes * Supporting the team through the full release cycle * Participation in development support for the resolution of bugs, provision of hot fixes and support of the production system as required by application operations * To follow and enhance the organisation’s software engineering practices and processes. We make cool stuff, and we need you to help us make that stuff cool! Surevine gives its people a platform to develop their individual talents into strengths in an environment which expects creativity and is obsessive about innovation.

items.content:
JavaScript Reverse Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Mobile, Product Development, Web Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: eyeo GmbH | Cologne, Germany

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Cologne, Germany. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

javascript
ecmascript-6
google-chrome-devtools
dom-manipulation

Job description

What you'll do

Due to the growing number of individuals using ad blockers, some companies have developed a way around ad blocking that shows ads even if an ad blocker is present. We do our best to stop these circumvention efforts in order to keep users in charge of their browsing experience. This is where you come in: help defend user choice by contributing to one of the biggest ad blockers in the world.

During your work day, you'll be expected to

  • Reverse engineer techniques used to get around Adblock Plus
  • Develop stateless JavaScript functions and other solutions to counter these techniques
  • Keep up-to-date with current ad blocking and circumvention techniques
  • Align with internal stakeholders to combine anti-circumvention efforts

A little bit about you

  • Strong knowledge of core web technologies, especially DOM manipulation and JavaScript (ES6+)
  • Strong proficiency of browser developer tools (e.g. Chrome Developer Tools or Firefox Devtools) to analyze JavaScript code
  • Good understanding of how JavaScript engines in browsers and browser extensions work internally
  • Willingness to work in a geographically distributed agile team

It's great, but not required, if you have

  • Prior experience and contribution to open source projects
  • Knowledge and experience analyzing network traffic
  • Experience in auditing web pages (e.g. security audits, pen-testing or website accessibility audits)

Most of our developers work remotely and so can you. We’re happy to pay for a coworking space, or if you prefer, we can help you relocate closer to our offices in Cologne or Berlin.

Not sure if this is for you? Consider contributing first.

When applying, please include a code sample or, preferably, references to open source projects you’ve worked on.

Apply now

About eyeo GmbH

We create open source software that puts users in control over their online browsing experience. Our desktop and mobile products, such as Adblock Plus, Adblock Browser and Flattr, help sustain and grow a fair, open web, because they give users control while providing user-friendly monetization. Our most popular product, Adblock Plus (ABP), is currently used on over 100 million devices.

Benefits

  • Choose Your Own Hardware & Software
  • Flexible Working Hours (you choose when you start work)
  • Home Office & Remote Work
  • Subway Ticket (Travel for free in Cologne or Berlin)
  • Diverse International Team
  • Games! (foosball, flipper, ping-pong, PS4 & VR-games provided)
  • Paid Relocation (we support your move to Germany in any way we can)
  • Free Drinks, Barista Station (make your own cappuccino) & Fruits

items.title: Engineering Lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
About Distributed


We're building the world's Elastic Workforce - reinventing work and re-telling its story.


We help businesses deliver technical projects better than ever before through our platform and on-demand Elastic Teams. Customers use our platform to scope any technical project and be matched with a fully managed Elastic Team to deliver. Our Elastic Teams are a collection of engineers and data scientists from the top tier of remote freelancers around the world.


We have recently secured £3m in seed funding and are now hiring a number of exciting roles for exceptional growth ahead. Want to know more? read: https://distributed.co/about


Engineering Lead 


We are looking for an exceptional Engineering Lead to support and coach our high-performing engineers and help shape and drive both technical product decisions and engineering practices.


You will be joining the company at an exciting stage as our Elastic Team and deliveries completed through the platform continue to rapidly grow. Our Elastic teams have delivered products for everyone, from massive financial organisations to bleeding edge tech startups building their first products. At Distributed, you will get to work on it all.


Responsibilities



  • Manage and motivate a growing team of fully distributed remote engineers while also being a hands-on engineer yourself.

  • Ensuring technical excellence by setting a high bar for our engineering practices and delivery, developing tools, processes, and documentation to scale our platform and team.

  • Leading technical decisions on behalf of our team and customers that will shape the future of the Distributed platform.

  • Mentoring using your interpersonal skills to help the engineering team work through technical challenges. You’ll help them improve and develop over time to meet their personal career objectives.


Requirements


You:



  • Have experience managing the performance and development of high-performing engineers.

  • Have an empathetic leadership style and you build strong, effective relationships.

  • Your previous titles may include Senior Developer, Tech Lead or Engineering Manager.

  • Get excited about designing and implementing complex web applications

  • Knowledge of industry best practices for building scalable and highly reliable SaaS/PaaS applications.


Bonus:



  • Experience in enterprise SaaS

  • Experience managing fully remote teams.


Compensation



  • Competitive salary (£70,000-£100,000 depending on experience) and equity available.

  • Employee pension plan.

  • Private healthcare.

  • Catered team lunches provided every Friday.

  • 34 days of holiday a year (26 days + Bank holidays).


Why you'll love working at Distributed


We are a high performing team of around 20 people based near Shoreditch. We celebrate our diverse group of talented employees and we pride ourselves on our transparent, collaborative, friendly and respectful culture.


We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, stock options, pension plans and private healthcare. We host regular company socials, weekly catered lunches and the office is full of snacks, coffee and beers on tap.


We value learning and will help you with your personal development in every way we can. The team regularly exchange books, podcasts, recommended readings and we actively support further education. Our mission is to help you succeed and flourish within the company and your career.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=5, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer at Mozilla

Remote

Location: Remote US

Why join Mozilla engineering?

Learn: Code review at Mozilla includes pushing to passionate contributors around the world. Building Firefox and its family of products requires knowledge up and down the stack, and extremely high standards for security and optimization. Beyond the browser, we’re developing AR/VR, IoT, and voice recognition products that respect and protect privacy.

Grow: We’re dedicated to helping every team member develop. We give engineers trust and responsibility from day one, offer generous stipends for learning opportunities, and provide mentorship, especially around key leadership skills like collaboration and clear, kind communication.

Make Your Mark: We’re small but mighty, challenging the biggest behemoths on the internet with a staff the size of their marketing departments. That means every engineer can have an outsized impact on products that touch tens of millions of users ultimately influencing how the entire internet works.

The Role

The Firefox Accounts team is looking for a passionate and experienced engineer to help design, build, and maintain our scalable, high availability systems. You will be deeply involved in the technical details of implementation, as well as collaborating with the product, design, QA, and data analysis teams to figure out the best way to expand our capabilities.

Firefox Accounts has millions of users around the globe and powers many of the services at Mozilla. We have ambitious goals and plenty of enthusiasm – come work with us and make an impact.

What you’ll do:

  • Write clean, performant, open source, and standards compliant code
  • Review code from other team members (as well as get your own code reviewed)
  • Maintain effective unit tests and documentation
  • Participate in stand-ups, bug triages, retrospectives, and other team meetings
  • Make accurate estimates for upcoming work, communicate technical solutions effectively, and report progress
  • Work in the open as part of the Mozilla open source project, and engage with Mozilla’s global community
  • Be an advocate for the web

What we’re looking for:

  • You enjoy working the full stack front to back, inside and out.
  • You possess a deep understanding of web technologies (JS, CSS, DOM, HTML)
  • You have at least 3 years developing and maintaining robust web products
  • You uphold standards for quality and performance by performing code reviews, fixing bugs, creating tests, and maintaining documentation

Bonus Points:

We value a variety of voices. You don’t need to check every box on this list to apply.

  • Experience integrating with payment gateways; International payments a plus
  • Experience scaling a platform to millions of users.
  • Are comfortable working in a diverse community spanning many regions and timezones
  • Experience working with open source projects and collaboration tools

Feel good about your work again.

At Mozilla, we’re serving humanity by maintaining a safe, open internet while also helping the individual humans employed here to reach their personal and professional goals. With a relatively small team serving hundreds of millions of people, a culture of exploration, and a commitment to mentorship, opportunities abound to learn and grow at Mozilla.

Our values drive our actions

  • Purpose is built into our work, with our mission driving every decision
  • We challenge assumptions, the status quo, ourselves, and each other
  • We are transparent: in our code, our business partnerships, and our everyday interactions
  • We seek out people from diverse backgrounds and with perspectives different from our own
  • We pair purpose with performance and put people ahead of profit

Our impact is global

  • 1000+ paid staff from over 30 countries
  • Thousands of volunteer contributors across six continents
  • 10 global offices: Beijing, Berlin, London, Paris, Mountain View, Portland, San Francisco, Taipei, Toronto and Vancouver
  • Hundreds of home offices globally

Our benefits are world-class

  • Flexible work environment (nearly half of Mozillians work remotely)
  • Industry-leading paid parental leave (up to 26 weeks of fully paid leave for childbearing parents and up to 12 weeks for non-childbearing parents)
  • Reimbursement for professional development (up to $3,000/year)
  • A work setup including the latest hardware and software of your choice
  • Wellness programs we reimburses up to $1700/year for expenses like child and elder care, mental wellness, and personal enrichment

About Mozilla

A lot of companies say they’re mission-driven. Our unique corporate structure guarantees that every decision we make upholds our mission: to make sure the internet stays available, safe, and welcoming to everyone. Beholden to neither shareholders nor investors, Mozilla Corporation is wholly owned by the not-for-profit Mozilla Foundation.

Along with 20,000+ volunteer contributors and collaborators all over the world, Mozilla Corporation’s staff designs, builds, and distributes software that allows people to enjoy the internet on their own terms. Our flagship product the Firefox browser has expanded into a family of products that protects users and alerts them of risks. Mozilla’s Emerging Technologies group incubated and sponsors Rust Stack Overflow’s most loved programming language for the last four years and is building safe, private versions of virtual reality, internet of things, and voice recognition.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply for job

items.content:
Trint is the scale-up that blows manual transcription out of the water. Our productivity platform automates the transcription process using artificial intelligence, letting users focus on extracting more value from the spoken word in big verticals like media, research and video production.

The company’s vision is shaped by its CEO and founder Jeff Kofman, an Emmy-winning foreign correspondent and war correspondent who estimates he transcribed thousands of hours of interviews, news conferences and speeches during his 30+ year broadcast career.

Team Trint is crazy passionate about our product. We’re team players, we care about our users and we’re proud of our diverse and inclusive culture. The company has 50 employees (+ two dogs) with our HQ in Shoreditch in London; our North American HQ is in Toronto. We’ve just closed a £3.5M Series A, so we’re well positioned to reach for the sky.

Customers include: The Associated Press, The New York Times, ESPN, Vice News, The Washington Post, Thomson Reuters, Fox Sports, Der Spiegel, Deutsche Welle, Yale University, Nike and AirBnB.

Frontend Developer at Trint

Our latest front-end developer helping build cutting-edge innovations for our world-leading automated transcription platform

You’ll be expected to:

  • Lead implementation details from a Frontend perspective. Working as part of the development team, design and UX ensuring the quality bar is kept high.

  • Form best practice approaches to styleguide driven development, directory structures, build process (webpack), component hierarchy, SCSS and data management.

  • Help guide team members, providing constructive criticism and suggestions through code reviews, Slack or on video calls.

  • Help develop processes and maintain tools and libraries across the Frontend repos in conjunction with the development team.


You will work with:

  • HTML, CSS (SASS) JavaScript (ES5, ES6, ES7) and some TypeScript

  • React, Redux, Apollo and GraphQL

  • Web media technologies

  • Our monorepo is managed and built with lerna and webpack

  • Agile development practices (Scrum, TDD, pair programming, CI/CD)

  • GitHub and Slack for collaboration and communication

  • Incredible colleagues!


You must have:

  • Three or more years industry experience coding performant, public facing web projects with at least some design studio or agency experience.

  • Expert knowledge of React, SPA Routing, Webpack, BEM and bundle optimization.

  • Expert knowledge of JavaScript in the browser, including common tools and approaches.

  • Experience choosing and evaluating different frameworks and approaches, with a good idea of the pros and cons of such decisions.

  • Experience working in a cross-disciplinary environment, collaborating with other practitioners to deliver the best end result.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


Ideally you’ll also:

  • Have a presence online, on awards sites or be willing to demo your work.

  • Have experience in leading features, mentoring and working with other developers.

  • Be comfortable talking to project stakeholders and clients who may not be technical.

  • Have a good working knowledge of at least one server-side technology, preferably Node.

  • Have some experience working with teams including remote workers, with ideas on how to get the best from this scenario.

  • Be comfortable talking through your work and explaining your decisions.

  • Knowledge of D3, complex SVG builds or canvas based projects would be a bonus.


Benefits:

  • EMI share option scheme

  • Learning and development opportunities

  • Team events & social Fridays

  • A relaxed & sociable office environment

  • Flexible working

  • Gym subsidy

  • Office snacks

  • Cycle to Work scheme

  • In-house yoga

  • 25 day holiday allowance + bank holidays

  • Critical Illness Cover

  • Income protection insurance

  • Workplace pension scheme

  • And more to come. We're on the look-out for new and exciting perks that help us on our journey to becoming an employer of choice, so watch this space.

Candidates seeking employment at Trint are considered without regards to race, colour, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, disability, gender identity, or sexual orientation. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will create a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users. Come join our team.

items.content:
Frontend Engineering

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: B2B
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Sherpany AG | Zürich, Schweiz

Remote details

Office Location: Zürich, Schweiz. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

agile
react

Job description

Sherpany`s mission is to give back time by turning formal meetings from time-wasters into value-creators. Our team is building a mobile and web based platform that allows effective choice making by digitally transforming meetings and decision making processes. In cutting administrative, organizational and repetitive work Sherpany`s platform is actively sparing resources like paper, shipping and transportation. Within the next 5 years we aim to give back over 2 Mio. hours of extra time to people making decisions thereby enabling them to focus on value-adding work. Our headquarter is located in Zurich and we have offices in Lisbon, Berlin, Paris, Milan and Wroclaw.

Your new role:

Together with your frontend team you will design responsive front end applications, monitor development results, as well as provide technical support for existing applications. Furthermore you support other engineers, share your knowledge with your colleagues and contribute to agile projects.

This job is for you, if:

  • you have experience in front-end engineering
  • you are solution-oriented and have an autonomous and proactive working style
  • you are experienced with agile methodologies and mindset 

How you can imagine us:


Our corporate culture means a lot to us, which is why we regularly organize great team events and donate working hours for a good cause. At Sherpany hierarchies are flat, your ideas and inputs are always welcome and heard. Furthermore we offer flexible working hours and home office possibilities in order to maintain your work-life balance. 

Looking forward having you on our team soon! 

Apply now

About Sherpany AG

Our mission is to get time back.

We are building the first mobile and web based platform that allows effective decision making by digitally transforming the meeting process of executives and Board Members.

With our platform we will have given back over 2 Million hours to directors within the next 5 years.

Benefits

  • Personal Apple computer
  • Private Insurance
  • Fully equipped kitchen area
  • Flexible schedule
  • Coffee around the clock
  • Play ground corner

items.content:
Senior Front-End Developer - UK home based.

We aren’t looking for a ‘Rock Star’ or a ‘Ninja’. We aren’t looking for a ‘Super Star Developer’ either. We want a team player; someone who is tenacious about getting things done as part of a team in an environment that expects creativity and quality delivery. Be a rebel but be part of our rebel alliance.

Skills and experience

Essential

  • Layout and presentation skills in HTML, CSS and related technologies
  • Expertise in JavaScript with a minimum of 5 years’ experience – ES6; Babel JS
  • Experience of modern web frameworks and libraries, in particular React JS
  • Single Page Applications (SPA) – Create React App / Next JS / Gatsby; React Router / Reach Router; Redux & Redux-Saga
  • Unit Testing – Jest; React Testing Library / Enzyme; Snapshot Testing
  • Web Accessibility – WCAG; Axe
  • Web application user interface design skills and experience
  • A thorough understanding of web concepts: HTTP, REST, web services, etc
  • Experience working on Agile projects, particularly Kanban or Scrum
  • Tenacious technical problem solver
  • Good communicator
  • Demonstrable experience of working with version control, build tools, code-quality and testing tools.

Desirable

  • Experience with Government Digital Service (GDS)
  • Experience with Design Systems – Storybook; Styled Components / Emotion
  • Experience of test automation – Cypress; Puppeteer
  • Experience in any of the following is useful: Typescript; ESLint; Standard JS / Prettier; JSON Schema; Sketch
  • Experience of developing for deployment to the public cloud (e.g. AWS, AWS Amplify, Azure, etc.)
  • Experience using the Atlassian suite (Jira, Confluence, etc.)
  • Working knowledge of best practices: version control, unit testing, CI and documentation
  • Comfortable using the command line to support application development and deployment - GIT; Bash scripts
  • Experience with developing and deploying with container technologies, in particular Docker.

Responsibilities

  • Develop solutions that meet the needs of users by considering the user at every step of the delivery process; from understanding the need to designing the solution and delivery
  • Work as an integral member of a small, remote team
  • Agree and deliver on sprint commitments
  • Design and implements secure software components
  • Participate in the iterative user needs analysis and design phases
  • Ensure that code is well-tested in development and to take part in systems integration testing where required, to meet the agreed level of quality (Jest)
  • Participate in peer review processes
  • Supporting the team through the full release cycle
  • Participation in development support for the resolution of bugs, provision of hot fixes and support of the production system as required by application operations
  • To follow and enhance the organisation’s software engineering practices and processes.

We make cool stuff, and we need you to help us make that stuff cool! Surevine gives its people a platform to develop their individual talents into strengths in an environment which expects creativity and is obsessive about innovation.

Apply now

items.content:
Full Stack Software Engineer (Remote)

Clipboard health's engineering organization is nascent yet seasoned through the responsibility of maintaining heavy usage and growing noteworthy revenue through the products and features that it has built and maintained. Clipboard health has nonetheless only scratched the surface in the space of products and experiences for its users and is thus growing very rapidly.

As a software engineer at Clipboard you will be joining a small organization where your voice will be heard yet carries a large business responsibility. You will not be building things with the hope that people need it but rather filling the desperate needs of our users while innovating in ways they didn't even know they were needing. You'll have to be adaptable, learn quickly and have a interest understanding technical tradeoffs deeply.

You'll additionally be expected to understand the business and user needs that you are solving with the features that you are building. As you'll be the on the frontlines of getting the feature delivered to customers you are expected provide input while you build features in the case that there are better solutions or other considerations that you believe are important that may have not been explicitly asked of you.

Responsibilities

  • Quickly understand new technologies and lead technical decision making
  • Develop critical projects, working with other web engineers.
  • Be directly involved in the entire development lifecycle of improvements to existing and launching of new Clipboard Health products
  • Work with your team to improve our delivery processes and advocate for building maintainable, high quality code in a distributed codebase.
  • Work with React, Node, MongoDB, Ionic

Minimum Qualifications

  • 5+ years of software engineering work experience
  • 5+ years experience coding in Javascript
  • Have 2+ years of experience working remotely as an engineer on a distributed team
  • Care deeply about the details in both well-crafted code and user-facing ships
  • Excellent knowledge of: Node, React, MongoDB
  • Strong knowledge of JavaScript (ES5, ES6), the DOM, HTML, CSS.
  • Have excellent documentation and communication skills.

Apply now

items.content:
Front End Developer

REQUIREMENTS

We are looking for a Front End Engineer who cares deeply about creating great software within an agile team of developers. You will be responsible for working with the team to design, create and improve our website and apps.

We’d like you to:

  • Create efficient, reusable and flexible UI components using Javascript, HTML, CSS, AngularJS, Angular, React, JQuery
  • Write code clean and experiment front end technologies such as Angular JS
  • Be a major stakeholder in the development of Tailsters greenfield customer facing app, as well as the continued development of other products
  • Capitalise on your previous years of experience as a Front End Developer and move into the forefront of an exciting startup
  • Continue building a comprehensive reusable suite of Javascript components across our web and apps using AngularJS
  • Desire to continue to write clean and testable code
  • Enjoy working within an Agile environment, and feel comfortable estimating the complexity of your work
  • Love working with other sociable people in an open and collaborative way
  • Celebrate personal successes
  • Acknowledge our failures as a team
  • Be an animal lover - we’ve got dogs in the office (after all, it’s what we do!) and you can bring your own dog into work.
  • Have a sense of humour, be sociable and be a nice person.
  • You’ll also have a penchant for rubbish dog puns, and a predilection for Chicken Katsu (#notcompulsory :))

What we are looking for:

  • A good understanding of the JavaScript fundamentals
  • Good understanding of Responsive design, HTML(5), CSS(3), JavaScript and JQuery
  • Extensive experience with either AngularJS or Angular
  • CSS
  • RESTful
  • GIT
  • Big bonus if you have experience in writing mobile apps either with Native/JS.

BENEFITS

  • Your benefits will include holiday entitlement of 20 days per year for a full time employee, in addition to public holidays, plus a day off on your birthday
  • Flexible dress code
  • Pet Friendly office
  • Flexibility in working from home when required
  • Monthly socials
  • Katsu Fridays
  • Perkbox benefits

Apply now

⠀⠀⠀ ⠀
What your day looks like in this role:

What’s in it for you?

  • Competitive salary - $90K - $120K depending on experience

  • Work remotely

Apply now

About Surevine

Surevine builds secure, scalable collaboration solutions for the most security conscious organisations; joining people up and enabling collaboration on their most sensitive information. Our systems are accredited to handle the most sensitive information, whilst still delivering an intuitive and engaging user experience which actively promotes participation; building smart, secure networks of connected people. Our own smart research and development and customer sponsored R&D into collaboration technology delivers constant innovation, building products born out of genuine user needs.

items.content:
Senior Frontend Developer (remote)

Company: CodersRank
Location: Debrecen, Hungary, Remote
Job type: Full-time
Skills:
  • #vuex
  • Pug
  • Typescript

    • Company description

    OUR MISSION
    We want to help the software engineers to grow in their career and be a better engineer.
    OUR VISION
    As a first step, we want to provide our users a detailed and precise evaluation of their current experience using many sources (GitHub, GitLab, StackOverflow, HackerRank, Medium, Udemy, etc). On the meanwhile, help them to improve: recommend relevant jobs, or for example, if somebody wants to be a frontend developer we want to be able to provide a personalized learning path (books, articles, GitHub repos, Twitter accounts to follow, etc) based on the other success frontend developers.
    FOUNDING
    Established: 2017
    Stage: Early Stage
    Investments
    Innonic Group Zrt: 200,000 USD
    Hiventures: 1,240,000 USD
    OUR SHORT HISTORY
    CodersRank is a multi-award-winner startup (regional Get In The Ring competition & Central European Startup Award etc). But we know business is not about gathering various awards. Although we are a small bunch (yet), but we have plans for world domination - or at least, we’d like to be in business for a long, long time. And fortunately, we’ve also had the necessary investments to reach our goals.
    In the first year, nearly 15,000 coders joined our community. So we won't stop but focus on reaching 100,000 coders worldwide for the next year.

    Job description

    We are looking for experienced software engineers who love tackling convoluted problems and coming up with clean, stable solutions that scale. The ideal candidate would be someone who has a genuine passion for designing and implementing elegant software solutions. They would also be intimately familiar (and up to date) with their development ecosystem for making sound decisions when it comes to choosing the right tool or library for the job. We expect our senior engineers to be able to contribute across the entire frontend stack, as well as collectively oversee the integrity of the frontend codebase.

    RESPONSIBILITIES
    • Help developers around the world to measure and improve their skills
    • Collaborate in technical reviews to strengthen our architecture and system designs and assist others with coding and troubleshooting.
    • Help our mid-level FE developers to pick up best practices
    • Establish automated frontend testing tools
    • Help in optimizing FE loading time
    MUST HAVE
    • 5+ years experience as a frontend developer
    • Intimate knowledge of JS ecosystem (tooling, libraries, etc.).
    • Expert-level familiarity with one or more JavaScript frameworks, preferably Vue.js.
    • Knowledge of good practices, preferred design patterns, and writing idiomatic Javascript code.
    • Experience with SASS/SCSS
    • Working no further than 3 hours from CEST time zone. (because of this we cannot accept applicants from America and Asia)
    • Experience with front-end testing
    NICE TO HAVE
    • Experience with high traffic websites
    Apply now!

items.content:
Senior Full Stack Software Engineer

United States, California
Company: CyberCoders

Overview

Minimum Required Skills:
REACT, Java, Spring, Mocha, JIRA, jest, Chai, RESTful API, GIT

If you are a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer with experience, please read on!

A Full Stack Engineer will develop and maintain amazing web applications for our content discovery portal. The Engineer will also be responsible for the design and implementation of our internal software applications.

This position must work full time out of our Hayward, CA location. Remote work is not available for this role.

What You Will Be Doing

In this role, the candidate will collaborate with other teammates to implement solutions to problems that impact the company’s top software engineering priorities. They will also introduce, assess, and implement new technologies that will help the company provide an exquisite user experience to its customers and support our critical production services.

-Engineers in this position have solid programming fundamentals, are willing to learn new technologies, and can work effectively with a team.
-Create amazing applications in a modern single-page JavaScript framework (React).
-Lead usability and design reviews for our applications
-Develop delightful APIs for our services
-Participate in application infrastructure and architecture design
-Break down feature requests into actionable plans and assist when needed with the creation and execution of test plans
-Ensure development projects fulfill business requirements and delight end-users

What You Need for this Position

-5+ years of software development experience
-Experience with frontend technologies (React a plus) as well as Java and Spring
-Familiarity with front-end testing frameworks such as Chai, Jest, Mocha, etc and JUnit on the backend
-Familiarity with Jira, Git and agile development methodology
-Expertise in RESTful APIs. gRPC API experience a plus!
-Experience building solutions with Amazon Web Services infrastructure and services
-Experience with build systems (Webpack, Gradle), CI systems, Chef / Inspec, Terraform, and Docker a plus!

What’s In It for You

-Stock options
-100% of healthcare premiums are covered for you and all dependents!
-On-site gym
-Meals and refreshments provided
-Commuting benefits
-Paid parental leave (child-bearing and non-childbearing)So, if you are a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer with experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Security Clearance will be needed – therefore, only US citizens can be considered.Please apply directly to by clicking ‘Click Here to Apply’ with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

– Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Copyright 1999 – 2019 . CyberCoders, Inc. All rights reserved.
– provided by Dice

Job Title:

Full stack C# .NET and web-based developer This role reports to the Development Manager and will require travelling to office in Hemel Hempstead, Hertfordshire for the initial training period. Thereafter this is a home working position with ad-hoc requirement to travel to office.

Job Description:

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Full Stack Java Developer to join a core team of developers who provide web-based framework to then allow other developers to create line - of - business applications. You will be working closely with the development manager to extend and enhance the framework to meet new requirements and new industry standards in a constantly evolving process with high demands. In this role you will find a certain degree of creative freedom to create new systems.

Skills and attributes required:

A great enthusiasm for creating quality software in particular creating systems which are elegant, extendable, and sustainable over the long-term
Long-term experience of C# .NET and ASP.NET
Long-term experience of browser-based technologies, with a deep understanding of JavaScript

Demonstrable experience of working with modern web-based frameworks and toolchains
Experience of relational databases, in particular, Microsoft SQL Server
A strong ability to work on own initiative and achieve timely results
Experience of Isomorphic Smartclient is desirable but not essential

Angular / React / JavaScript / .Net

javascript

frontend

Job description

  • Are you looking for a remote work on international projects?
  • Are you looking for 40 hours a week workload?
  • Is it suitable for you to use time tracker at work?
  • Is your current qualification level Middle or Senior?

Soshace is an online platform that will provide you with remote work with hourly payment on modern projects lasting on average 6-9 months and more.

We are looking for a long-term partnership so when the first project ends we’ll find you a second one and after that the third and so on.

We expect you to work on our projects 8 hours a day Monday-Friday in your time zone. 

  • Do you have more than 3-year commercial experience with JavaScript?
  • Do you have a 1-year experience in commercial projects with one of the frameworks: React or Angular 2+?
  • Do you know HTML, CSS, cross-browser and adaptive layout?
  • Do you have experience in commercial projects with Node.js? (it would be a plus)
  • Can you provide a portfolio of relevant projects?
  • Do you have good writing and speaking skills in English (Upper-Intermediate and above)?

If you answer “yes” to all questions, send us your CV and be ready to provide a portfolio of projects you took part in.

The hourly rate we offer depends on your qualification level and geography:

  • Middle $20-$30 an hour
  • Senior $30-$50 an hour.

We have the next stages of the interview: 

  1. Primary interview (a detailed discussion of your resume and portfolio)
  2. Online test
  3. Interview with a technical specialist.
Apply now

About Soshace

Soshace is a community of professionals. Since 2015 we’ve made different projects with clients all over the world.
Our clients are companies from the USA, The UK, Australia, Canada and Europe.

We are looking for a broad range of freelancers that are professionals in web development!

We have a large pool of job offers (from our clients) including job offers with relocation opportunities.
We also offer remote work with hourly pay on exciting projects lasting 3 months and more.

Benefits

  • 100% Remote work
  • Flexible schedule
  • International projects
  • Team work
  • Modern technology stack
  • Different projects
  • Long-term partnership

Full Stack Software Engineer (Remote)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Healthcare, Heathcare Staffing, Web Technology
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Clipboard Health (YC W'17) | No office location

Technologies

reactjs
mongodb
javascript

Job description

Clipboard health's engineering organization is nascent yet seasoned through the responsibility of maintaining heavy usage and growing noteworthy revenue through the products and features that it has built and maintained. Clipboard health has nonetheless only scratched the surface in the space of products and experiences for its users and is thus growing very rapidly.

As a software engineer at Clipboard you will be joining a small organization where your voice will be heard yet carries a large business responsibility. You will not be building things with the hope that people need it but rather filling the desperate needs of our users while innovating in ways they didn't even know they were needing. You'll have to be adaptable, learn quickly and have a interest understanding technical tradeoffs deeply.

You'll additionally be expected to understand the business and user needs that you are solving with the features that you are building. As you'll be the on the frontlines of getting the feature delivered to customers you are expected provide input while you build features in the case that there are better solutions or other considerations that you believe are important that may have not been explicitly asked of you.

Responsibilities

  • Quickly understand new technologies and lead technical decision making
  • Develop critical projects, working with other web engineers.
  • Be directly involved in the entire development lifecycle of improvements to existing and launching of new Clipboard Health products
  • Work with your team to improve our delivery processes and advocate for building maintainable, high quality code in a distributed codebase.
  • Work with React, Node, MongoDB, Ionic

Minimum Qualifications

  • 5+ years of software engineering work experience
  • 5+ years experience coding in Javascript
  • Have 2+ years of experience working remotely as an engineer on a distributed team
  • Care deeply about the details in both well-crafted code and user-facing ships
  • Excellent knowledge of: Node, React, MongoDB
  • Strong knowledge of JavaScript (ES5, ES6), the DOM, HTML, CSS.
  • Have excellent documentation and communication skills.
Apply now

Benefits

  • Unlimited Vacation
  • Remote

items.content:
Mid, Senior or Lead Frontend Engineer at Gremlin

Remote

Location: Bay Area, Remote in U.S.

Gremlin is on a mission to make the internet more reliable. By pioneering the discipline of Chaos Engineering, Gremlin is helping leading internet companies bolster resiliency in a world with increasingly complex software. We’re building a simple-to-use platform which helps engineering teams safely and securely test their systems for weaknesses, fix problems before they become outages, and ultimately gain another 9 of availability.

More reliable systems translate to more sales for ecommerce businesses (even on the busiest of days), increased uptime for SaaS businesses with SLAs, and fewer late night on-call sessions for engineering teams.

About the Role of Frontend Engineer

Gremlin’s frontend engineers build a stunning and flexible end user experience which targets modern browsers and devices by using the latest and greatest JavaScript features and tooling. Day to day activities consist of implementing browser-based, client-side features across multiple codebases in a clear and reusable manner. It is particularly important that candidates for this position are open-minded to new practices, techniques and technologies and are able to take responsibility for their own continuing education.

Responsibilities

  • Implement features across multiple React codebases using the latest technologies
  • Own and improve the UI deployment process
  • Take part in the (very reasonable) on-call rotation, triaging and rectifying customer-facing issues
  • Automate and improve testing of features using Jest, Cypress, etc.

Key Skills and Attributes

  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks, namely React
  • Experience with styling, namely CSS, SASS and Emotion
  • Attention to detail and strong opinions towards UX

Nice to Have

  • Node.js experience
  • CSS-in-JS experience
  • Experience with Gatsby.js and GraphQL
  • A curiosity about SRE, DevOps Practices and/or Chaos Engineering

About Gremlin

We’ve lived and breathed managing incidents, being on-call, and performing Chaos Engineering for a decade. Our founders, Kolton Andrus and Matthew Fornaciari, have served as Call Leaders’ at Amazon and Netflix, where they were responsible for guiding on-calls through triage and resolution of global outages at internet scale. After years of developing and advocating Chaos Engineering internally, they’ve captured their learnings in the Gremlin product and aspire to democratize the practice.

We’re backed by top tier investors, Index Ventures, Amplify Partners, and Redpoint Ventures, and have closed major enterprise customers with names you’ll recognize.

Our team is a mix of industry veterans and people eager to learn and bring their knowledge over from other sectors. We value work-life balance, and you’re a phenomenal fit if you value:

  • Transparency: Your communication is clear, concise and above all honest, even when the topic is difficult or uncomfortable.
  • Integrity: Do you choose to do the right thing, especially when it’s difficult?
  • Make It So: Are you the type of person that works to be the change you wish to see at a company?
  • Ownership: You use your skill and judgement to make decisions and autonomously act upon them, owning the outcome.
  • Unabated Ambition: Do you aspire to help build a lasting company?

If you’re passionate about building and designing tools that help the best companies in the world deliver more reliable service to millions of customers each and every day, we’d love to hear from you.

Location Agnostic. Equal Opportunity.

Gremlin is an equal opportunity workplace committed to a diverse and inclusive culture. Though we boast a remote by default culture, we are headquartered in the Bay Area, with offices in San Jose & San Francisco.

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=11}
items.content:
User Experience Specialist at By Light Professional IT Services

Remote

Job Locations US-Remote Work | US-Remote Work

ID

2019-4594

# of Openings

1

Category

Information Technology

Clearance

Tier 4 – High

Overview

By Light is hiring a User Experience (UX) Specialist to support the Human Centered Design (HCD) of user experience interfaces. Our growing team is building a new UX Human Centered Design group to focus on leveraging both Design Research and Interaction Design to create elegant and effective user interfaces and software for the public sector. We think about UX Design with a focus on the importance of the customer/user and take a user-centered design approach beginning with an understanding of the business problem and performing the user research to understand where that intersects with the customer’s needs.

Responsibilities

  • Conduct user research by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data and leverage results of this data to inform design decisions.
  • Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes based on scalability requirements, as well as create websites, custom applications, and other interfaces that are easy to use.
  • Design and structure the human-centered research portion of projects by planning for and leading teams through fieldwork, findings analysis, and insights syntheses.
  • Participate in product ideation and conceptual development. Participate as a contributor to an interdisciplinary team that includes creative and market leads, project management, strategists, and hardware and software developers.
  • Create visual designs that effectively communicate product function and brand identity, including the design and production of screen layouts, color palettes, typography, user interface elements, and icons.
  • Produce user requirements specifications, journey maps, service blueprints, personas, storyboards, scenarios, flowcharts, interactive prototypes, and design specifications.
  • Utilize project management skills to follow up on user experience issues and modify design features to accommodate a wide range of end users.
  • Provide UCD, HCD, UX and related design subject training to internal and external audiences.

Required Experience/Qualifications

  • A bachelor’s degree in computer science, design or another related field.
  • Minimum of five (5) years of experience working with user-centered design principles and best practices; visual design; and, user behavior and interaction models.
  • Minimum of five (5) years of UI design experience in an Agile delivery environment which supports incremental development of high-quality, fully-tested application component every few weeks.
  • Minimum of five (5) years of experience eliciting requirements and synthesizing information from multiple sources to design rich customer experiences.
  • High level of comfort working within a self-directed culture.
  • Working knowledge of standard industry graphics design Proficiency with design and presentation applications (i. e. Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, Paper, InVision).

Preferred Experience/Qualifications

  • Master’s degree in computer science, design or another related field.
  • U. S. Web Design System (USWDS) experience.
  • Proficiency with web standards and modern web technologies (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript).
  • Experience training others in UX and design concepts.
  • Experience working on Veterans Affairs (VA) projects and knowledge of VA processes (e. g. VIP, PMAS, etc.).
  • Active VA clearance and PIV.

Special Requirements/Security Clearance

  • Must have ability to successfully complete background check

By Light provides a broad range of hardware, software, engineering, and IT integration services. Headquartered in Tysons, VA, we support defense, civilian, commercial, and health IT customers worldwide. We offer an excellent benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, paid time off, paid holidays, and 401(k) match.

An Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

Apply for job

items.content:
Mid-Level React Native Engineer


 


Circa £50k + options. London based or work remotely if you prefer.


 


About Tandem


At Tandem, we’re on a mission to fix transport poverty. We’re a new startup focused on developing innovative transport technologies for people living in towns and small cities where bus services are inadequate and where if you don’t have a car, you might find it difficult to get to work, access healthcare, or get to the supermarket.


 


It’s a crucial social mission, but it’s also a huge business opportunity. Most mobility startups focus on the 30% of people who live in big cities like London, but actually, 50% of people live in towns and small cities of 10k-200k which are Tandem’s core market. Transport is the largest category of household spend in the UK and many other markets so this is a global multi-billion opportunity. 


 


Tandem has been founded by three experienced co-founders, we are backed by the Zinc accelerator and are working with support from the Connected Places Catapult and the Intelligent Mobility Design Centre at the RCA. 


 


We’re looking for a Mid-Level React Native Engineer to work on our mobile app.


 


About the role


You’ll work on the development of our ridesharing app that will be designed and developed from the ground up to meet the needs of our users. You will:



  • Work collaboratively with our CTO, designers, academic partners and the founding team;

  • Take ownership of new product features that will have significant business and user impact;

  • Work in a small, growing team with potential to shape the technical and product direction.


 


About you



  • You have strong mobile development experience and have experience using React Native;

  • Produce high-quality code – readable, maintainable and tested;

  • You’re a systems-thinker who’s excited by the challenge of shaping an entirely new product

  • You enjoy being part of a small team solving massive, meaningful problems

  • You’re comfortable in dealing with a degree of ambiguity and lots of moving parts


 


Working at Tandem


 


What we offer:



  • The chance to be part of a meaningful challenge and to see the impact of your work;

  • Real responsibility from the start and huge potential for growth

  • Working with a motivated founding team that is driven by a passion for positive social impact;

  • Central London office (zone 1) with flexible working practices and an openness for this to be a mostly remote role;

  • Competitive salary and equity.


 


Our values:



  • Our work matters. We’re solving one of the biggest problems in people’s lives - our work really matters. That means everyone’s work really matters - we hold ourselves to the highest standards. If we’re excellent - we’ll transform lives.

  • People front and center. We're building a company and technology to serve people. Whether our team, our customers, or our partners - we listen properly and engage deeply. Everything we build should put people front and centre - technology serves people, not the other way around. 

  • Travel together. We really do like to travel together - we want everyone to join us. We're building a team and a service open to all. We help each other navigate when the road gets foggy.

  • Anyone can sit in the front seats. We’re on a long journey. If anyone in the team spots a shortcut or is best-placed to drive for a bit - that’s great.  


 


How to apply


If you’re interested in working with us, contact the team via the Apply Now button. Please include your CV, a short cover letter and any relevant examples of your work. We can only accept applicants that have the right to work in the UK. No agencies please.

items.content:
Software Engineer

United States, North Carolina
Company: SignalPath

Overview

Are you an inventive software engineer? Do you want to work with exciting technology such as Scala, MongoDB, Kinesis, and Docker? Is it important to you to hold yourself to high standards? Are you a creative thinker who enjoys solving meaningful problems in innovative ways? Do you like interesting technical challenges? If so, SignalPath might have the perfect job for you.SignalPath is designing the next generation of software for the clinical research site. We focus on enabling efficient, collaborative, timely execution of clinical trials to make research an enjoyable, cost effective endeavor once more.You will join an interdependent, fun, engaged development organization that is focused on delivering high-quality software solutions. Write and maintain our core platform. You will be expected to maintain an eye towards best practices, including testability, scalability, monitoring, and performance. If you consider yourself a “full stack” engineer, you’ll also be working on our UI application. Partner with UI engineers and fellow platform engineers in the process of defining our RESTful API. Participate in and encourage a collegial, helpful, results-driven working environment. RequirementsEssential Experience Track record of delivering high-quality features and services in a SaaS web application. Hands-on experience and proficient knowledge of languages such as Java, Scala, Python, JavaScript and Ruby. Hands-on experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes. Exposure to working with basic AWS services such as EC2, S3, or Lambda. Exposure to working with and building asynchronous microservices. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field, or comparable experience. Professional knowledge of relational database systems, such as MySQL and PostgreSql. At least 5 years professional software development experience. Bonus Experience Written production Scala code. An understanding of the value of unit tests, and the importance of principles such as TDD. Experience with functional programming, in any language. Hands-on experience and proficient knowledge of JavaScript, Angular, CSS Pre-processors, and related UI technologies. Previously used any of the following Finatra, Finagle, AWS Kinesis, SBT, Specs2, Scalatest, and Typesafe config. Experience working with NoSQL data stores such as Redis, MongoDB, and ElasticSearch. Exposure to working with protected health information or in a regulated environment. Benefits Competitive health, dental, life and disability insurance plans Great location in downtown Raleigh. 15 days of vacation, plus 10 holidays Flexible work schedule Our Joel Test Scores Do you use source control? Yes. Git is our weapon of choice. Can you make a build in one step? Yes. With Jenkins. Do you make daily builds? Yes. Actually, many builds per day. Do you have a bug database? Yes. Do you fix bugs before writing new code? Yes. For our top 3 (out of 5) severities. Do you have an up-to-date schedule? Yes. Do you have a spec? Yes. We love our product owner. Do programmers have quiet working conditions? No. Well, sometimes. Our (naturally-lit) dev room does occasionally get too loud. You’ll hear some laughter, mainly because we like our teammates. We all have the flexibility to work from home, or in the park next door, or with headphones on. Do you use the best tools money can buy? Yes. Check this out JetBrains suite; Jenkins; 15″ MacBook Pros; Atlassian’s JIRA, Confluence and BitBucket Server; three always-on big-screen dashboards. And more. Do you have testers? Yes. They’re the best and saved our butts more than once. Do new candidates write code during their interview? Yes. And before the onsite interview, too. Do you do hallway usability testing? Yes. With people who really, really understand our users.

Apply for job
