tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=30, c=12, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=50}
items.content:
Full Stack Developer (C# Angular JavaScript SQL Azure Entity). Are you an experienced Full Stack Engineer looking for an opportunity to utilise and develop your skills whilst working from home?

Successful technology company that has created a SaaS platform for the construction industry is seeking a Full Stack Developer with C# and Angular skills to join their small team of developers. As a Full Stack Developer you'll be responsible for maintaining and developing the SaaS software and will ensure that is it scalable and performant. You'll be working closely with the Development Director to provide interpretation of client requirements and will break these down into manageable deliverables. The company's platform allows construction companies to monitor their progress during various stages of the construction lifecycle and is currently used by a number of leading construction companies across the UK.

This is a remote position, however you will be expected to travel into the Lincolnshire based office every quarter.

Requirements:
*Previous experience within a Full Stack Developer roles
*Strong knowledge of Angular, JavaScript and C#
*Familiar with the SQL database
*Advocate of Agile methodologies
*Excellent communication and collaboration skills
*Likely to be degree educated in Computer Science or similar (2:1 or above)
*Desirable: SaaS

As a Full Stack Developer (C# Angular) you can expect to earn a competitive salary (up to £45k) plus benefits.

Apply today or call to have a confidential discussion about this Full Stack Developer (C# Angular) role.

items.content:
Job Type: PHP Developer

Location: Remote (company offices in London, Malta, Gibraltar and Cape Town)

Contact name: Liam Burrell

Telephone: +

Salary: Up to £100,000 per annum

This company is regarded as one of the top online casino technology and services companies in SA, with offices in Cape Town, London, Malta and Gibraltar.

We are looking for PHP Developer's focused on the server side to help improve core platform services and ultimately build a next generation system.

Responsibilities:

  • Maintaining our custom website framework and making adhoc requests to specific sites
  • Adding new features to the website framework and to the CMS
  • Improving performance of the websites
  • Working closely with frontend team to assist with changes that require PHP functionality
  • Working on the development of various small internal applications as required
  • Implement unit testing on new and existing code
  • Diagnosing and fixing production issues
  • Taking part in code reviews
  • Not being phased by the strange variety of things that need doing in a small growing company
  • Being proactive and not just waiting to be told the next thing to do
  • Finding better ways that we can get things done
  • Working remotely

Requirements:

  • 3+ years commercial experience of PHP
  • Good understanding of front-end technologies, such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3
  • 2+ years writing raw SQL beyond just simple select statements and using PHP with MySQL
  • Knowledge of object oriented PHP programming
  • Understanding of MVC design patterns
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
  • Familiarity with Unit and Integration testing
  • Good interpersonal skills and a great team attitude
  • Proactive and highly motivated with the ability to quickly learn and adapt.

Ideal candidate would have:

  • Strong knowledge of the Laravel PHP web framework
  • Strong knowledge of common PHP or web server exploits, and their solutions
  • Experience with Jira or Wrike or similar project management tool
  • Experience using a modern JavaScript framework (we are just starting to use Angular but experience in React, Vue or similar is good too)
  • Experience migrating legacy codebases to cleaner architectures and modern frameworks
  • Some experience of the online casino industry

To apply, please send your CV to or call +

items.title: Remote Working Shopify Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=2, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=15}
items.content:
Remote working Shopify Developer - Halifax - c£35k - £45k + Bonus + Pension + Flexible working

Our client builds high-growth e-commerce businesses primed for success. They are a small, passionate team and are looking for the next person to join them on their adventure. Someone who will stand up and be counted, take a real lead in their area of expertise and produce work that the company can all be proud of.

What you'll do;

·Own all technical output within the business and shape the way they deliver Shopify projects for clients and own brands.

·Deliver mobile first sites on Shopify and Shopify Plus forclients.

·Push the boundaries of what is possible for our clients, challenge the norm and deliver exceptional ecommerce sites time after time.

·Build relationships with clients and partners with authenticity, candor and transparency to become a trusted technology and Shopify expert.

·Research and analyse technology and make recommendations to the business, so they can stay ahead of the curve.

·Represent the company externally at industry events.

·Unearth new opportunities. You'll stay consistently curious, always on the lookout for new opportunities to improve, e-commerce ventures and exciting investment projects.

·Continuously develop your knowledge and expertise in all things e-commerce.

·Be a beacon to the business, proactively sharing your skills and mentoring teams so we all dynamically progress.

·Collaborate with other members of our work squads to deliver truly exceptional e-commerce.

Who are we looking for?

We're a hungry, passionate start up, looking for the right person to join our Venture Forge journey.

Skills required;

·Minimum 5 years' experience in front end development - HTML, CSS (SASS, SCSS), JS

·Minimum 3 years' experience with Shopify - Liquid

·Experience in version control - GIT

·Shopify Plus experience and Ruby experience a bonus

·Ability to review, lead and mentor a team of internal and remote developers

·Excellent organisational and communication skills and the ability to make sure clients and colleagues receive the right information at the right time

·Experience with Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch or similar

·Ability to plan and shape new e-commerce website projects

What you get…

The company reward and incentivise our people to create a culture where creativity, agility and results are the order of the day. There are no hierarchies and they work in cross functional groups to bring the right experts together to get the best results possible. Located in Halifax, they are a walkable distance from Halifax train station and conveniently positioned half way between Leeds and Manchester with great access to the M62.

The basics

·Competitive salary levels

·Performance related bonus scheme linked to the growth of our business and brands

·Company pension scheme

·Working across industry leading brands

·Flexible working - you can work wherever you get the best work done

·Great office environment including roof top garden, free fruit, great coffee, music and games consoles

·Work / life balance is a given

The differentiators

·You'll have a real voice in the running of our projects and shaping of the business

·Work in an exciting entrepreneurial environment

·Your work will count. You'll make a difference everyday.

Sound like your thing? Please send through your CV and we will be in touch.

items.title: Wifinity: Senior Back End, Front End or Full Stack Software Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=5, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=16, go=0, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=15, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=33}
items.content:
Senior Back End, Front End or Full Stack Software Developer

Wifinity is growing, with many new projects and very interesting challenges on the horizon. To take them head on, we are growing our software development team, which is fully distributed. We are searching for senior software engineers capable of learning new technologies on demand and hit the ground running.  
There will be a lot of opportunities to move around different technologies and projects. 

Our stack contains Kotlin, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, the usual. We care about testing, continuous integration. We use Git for source control, with GitHub. You are welcome to use any editor, any OS, whatever tools you are happy with.

Requirements



  • 6 years or more of experience developing in a commercial environment.
  • Demonstrable experience learning new technologies on your own.
  • Development in 3 or more programming languages. 
  • Curiosity about networking. 
  • Version control experience. 
  • Residency in a timezone that's up to 3 hours ahead or behind UTC. 
  • Fluid written and spoken English. 
  • Back end: Experience with at least one JVM programming language (Java, Kotlin, Clojure).
  • Back end: Familiar with SQL databases, either PostgreSQL or MySQL.
  • Front end: Experience with HTML 5, CSS 3. 
  • Front end: Experience with JavaScript.
  • Front end: Experience with at least one language transpiling to JavaScript. 
  • Front end: Experience developing Single Page Applications. 
Nice to haves:
  • Mentorship experience.
  • Mobile development.
  • Knowledge of Git and GitHub.
  • Back end: Kotlin experience.
  • Back end: Experience with Amazon Web Services and/or Google Cloud Platform.
  • Front end: React, Angular or Vue experience. 
Benefits:
  • Fully remote position, work wherever you are.
  • Flexible hours, work whenever you want.
  • Various projects to move around to keep things fresh.
  • Work with ex-Googlers and ex-YCers.
  • Gym membership cover (up to £50/month).
  • Private health care (depending on location and up to £50/month).
  • Inclusive and diverse culture.

items.title: Developer Experience Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=17}
items.content:
Cypress.io

 

Developer Experience Engineer

Note: This is a remote-friendly position. West Coast and Central U.S. are preferred.  Do you get excited about developer tools? Do you have a keen eye for software quality/testing practices and methods? Do you enjoy sharing your knowledge with fellow developers? Are you eager to solve the challenges that developers like yourself face? If yes, then join the new Developer Experience (DX) team at Cypress to empower developers to build and ship higher quality software faster than ever before. The DX Engineer is a highly visible role that puts you right in front of the Cypress community via conferences, workshops, meetups, webcasts, and other speaking engagements. This responsibility requires you to be a technical expert and communicator with a strong ability to clearly articulate specific problems and solutions to support the diverse use cases of Cypress. The DX Engineer is a cross-functional role requiring you to collaborate with product design, engineering, marketing, and customer-success teams to ensure that users have a smooth, high-fidelity, and productive end-to-end experience with Cypress.  The DX Engineer is a high-impact role, acting as a spokesperson to scale awareness, increase product adoption, and build industry mindshare via development of tutorials, demonstration apps, custom plugins, integrations with other frameworks/services, and related methodologies. Most importantly, you’ll disseminate all this knowledge via formal documentation, blog posts, presentations, and video content that can be consumed by a diverse developer audience. Responsibilities  * Author and engage with the community to create curated presentations, videos, demonstrations, and learning guides to make it incredibly easy for developers to use Cypress. * Be a community leader to the Cypress community, creating an eager, inclusive ecosystem of developers who love our products and recommend it to others.  * Foster relationships with the open source community and establish partnerships that improve the experience and workflow of Cypress users across common frameworks and libraries. * Support product launch activities via validation of final experience, demonstration content, product messaging, engaging with early-access users, collaborating with launch partners, and more. * Develop demonstration apps, custom plugins, integrations with other frameworks/services, and testing-related methodologies Requirements * Exceptional written and oral communication skills to engage a variety of audiences, including developers, QA, and senior decision makers. * Extensive experience using client and server-side JavaScript and frameworks such as Angular, React, and Vue. * Driven, with an entrepreneurial spirit and sense of urgency. Must be resourceful, proactive, and deadline driven. * Highly organized, detail-oriented and possess a high level of integrity. * Collaborative team player that works well in collaborative situations and start-up environments. * Natural leadership skills and the ability to work with all teams in the company * Open-minded, accepting of different perspectives and willingness to measure and experiment. * Willingness to travel <20% to events and customer engagements. Benefits & Perks * Competitive salary * Health, dental and vision coverage * Life insurance and disability coverage * Remote-friendly * Generous paid time off and sick leave * Flexible work hours * Work with the latest technologies * Contribute to open source * Semiannual travel to work and play with our Atlanta-based team * Healthy office drinks and snacks * Modern laptop and equipment provided We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Cypress is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. To apply: Visit: https://smrtr.io/3qT4c

items.title: Senior Front-End Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=44}
items.content:
Rebilly

Senior Front-end Developer

verified
Worldwide
You’re the kind of person for whom architecture and design makes you tick. It’s in your blood; you love great design, and you strive to architect it every single day. You know what makes functional design great, and also know when pragmatism is called for. You know all the rules, and yet you’re willing to break them from time to time. As a Senior Front-End Developer with Rebilly, you’ll be responsible for guiding the architecture and design of our front-end applications. You’ll lead a team of developers to produce the highest quality software possible, and you’ll be responsible for mentoring them along the way. Our problems are hard, requiring dedication, expertise and the ability to look at solutions from many different angles. It will be your job to make the hard choices and deliver on time, bug-free code that delights our clients and maximizes their value. You’ll need to have passion, vision, and courage in order to take Rebilly to the next level and to make us the leading subscription billing service by 2025. Here’s what a typical day will look like at Rebilly: - Split your time between coding and leading, including weekly 1-on-1 meetings with other team members - Review developer code, providing suggestions on how, where and when to make improvements. - Ensure adherence to programming and documentation policies, code standards, testing, and release. - Mentor others with an emphasis on our core values, and above all maximizing customer success. - Help identify new initiatives, design new products and services, and improving our processes. - Work closely with developers on your team, and with the leads of other teams. - Assist with the mentorship and leadership of developers. **A Picture of Success** **OBJECTIVE #1 Customer billing portal** - Potential Obstacles: Creating a customer billing portal that is secure, customizable and performant is not an easy task. - Actions: Determine the requirements of the billing portal and breakdown the task for you and other team members to implement. Research best practices in portals security and apply them to the project. - Results: # of active customer billing portals. **OBJECTIVE #2 Third-party integrations** - Potential Obstacles: Translating an API into a third-party integration. - Actions: Using our existing integrations as a reference implement new connections to third-party applications in the UI. - Results: # merchants using integrations or similar. **OBJECTIVE #3 Improving App UX** - Potential Obstacles: Managing high levels of complexity in proposed interfaces while taking user experience into account. - Actions: Use your critical mind to interpret mockups and architect interfaces with existing features and reusable components. - Results: % Users who activate their trial account. **Apply!** Please send your resume through Apply By API: [https://app.applybyapi.com/posting/9/](https://app.applybyapi.com/posting/9/) **HIRING PROCESS** - Apply By API* - [https://app.applybyapi.com/posting/9/](https://app.applybyapi.com/posting/9/) - Small code challenge (unless you have extensive open source contributions) - Interview with the Product Team - Interview with the Product Team Lead - Offer and Hiring The total process should take less than 2 weeks. *We are only accepting applications through ApplyByAPI at this time. **WORKING AT REBILLY** Check us out at [https://www.rebilly.com/careers/](https://www.rebilly.com/careers/) Rebilly offers a competitive salary, training and development, birthday lunches, and provides the computer of your choosing. You are welcome to work out of our Montreal office, remotely out of Austin (occasionally meeting with our team here for lunch or happy hour, otherwise set up as a 100% remote/work from home environment), or anywhere on the globe that you choose as a fully remote employee. Further perks and benefits are dependent on your work location of choice. Rebilly is a Teal Organization, meaning our organizational structure may differ than what you’re used to, but we think you’ll be pleasantly surprised. In a very tiny nutshell, this means that as an organization we value self-management, self-organization, as well as the wholeness of the individuals that make up our team (meaning you should be yourself at work, and do the work that inspires you.) **ABOUT REBILLY** Rebilly is subscription billing software that helps businesses who need to handle recurring invoices and payments. Rebilly’s comprehensive feature set is built to help our merchants get more of their customers from the order form to the thank you page, and more renewals paid. We took lessons learned from years of experience in the subscription business and millions of subscribers and applied them to make our payment system clever, flexible, and easy to use for our clients. #Location - Worldwide

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=25, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=14, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=43}
items.content:
Conduit Ventures

Frontend (react) Engineer


US-only
The Conduit Ventures engineering team is seeking a Frontend Engineer with two or more years of experience in shipping production web applications. We’re looking for passionate engineers who are seeking new challenges and enjoy using the latest technologies. The C/V culture promotes a creative and engaging environment where new and innovative thinking is celebrated. In this position you will be responsible for developing web-based applications in cooperation with the rest of the C/V team. You must have a highly-refined skill set, a passion for learning new things, and a sense of current market trends and emerging technologies. **After one year at Conduit Ventures a successful Frontend hire will have:** * Shipped code for multiple venture-backed startups in varying industries * Expanded C/V’s engineering capabilities by disseminating frontend knowledge while also learning new technologies from other C/V team members and/or clients * Maintained a healthy work/life balance by taking time when needed and proactively communicating what is needed to be individually successful * Exhibited the universal traits of the Conduit Ventures team: Intellectual curiosity, Bias for action, Professionalism, and Humility # Responsibilities **Proactive Communication** * Be a highly effective and proactive communicator. We’re a distributed team, so strong communication skills are essential * Understand our clients’ business needs and relate them clearly to our technical work **Project Execution** * Develop, manage, and monitor timelines, tasks, deliverables, budgets, and resources * Work cross-functionally with production, graphic design, and content creation teams to provide clear direction for on-time deliverables * Appropriately document all activity/learnings and then effectively disseminate that information to the greater C/V team # Requirements **Key Requirements** * BS/MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience * Mastery of the latest JavaScript and web development trends (ES2016+) * Production experience shipping modern web applications in cloud environments * Experience with React, single-page applications, and modern frontend paradigms. (We will consider candidates possessing experience with other modern UI libraries) * Experienced with UI toolkits and CSS-in-JS techniques and libraries * Keen eye for good design and practical user experience/user interface design **Bonus** * Prior consulting experience * Experience working with or implementing GraphQL services * Experience with Node.js applications * Experience working with or implementing non-trivial webpack configurations as well as modern UI testing libraries and techniques #Salary $115,000 #Location - US-only

items.content:

You have a strong background in a broad range of technologies, including HTML/CSS, Angular, Git, and Firebase. In this full-time, remote, fast-paced and challenging role, you will:Work alongside talented co-founders on this billion-dollar and growing startupUse markup languages like HTML to create user-friendly web pagesMaintain and improve websiteOptimize applications for maximum speed and scalabilityDesign mobile-based featuresCollaborate with back-end developers and web designers to improve the usabilityGet feedback from, and build solutions for, users and customersWrite functional requirement documents and guidesCreate quality mockups and prototypesHelp Back End Developers with coding and troubleshootingEnsure high-quality graphic standards and brand consistencyStay up-to-date on emerging technologies

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=20, embedded=0, frontend=27}
items.content: PLEASE READ: You must have hands-on experience with HubSpot to be considered for this position.The Front-End Developer (FED) is a web development position responsible for both large website redesign projects as well as smaller initiatives both internal and for client contracts. This role has client-facing responsibilities including but not limited to: technical consulting of web development capabilities, web development in various platforms and frameworks, cross-platform web development testing, email development, client training.In addition to creating stunning websites and experiences that deliver measurable impacts for our clients, our development team is valued for their contributions, ideas and process improvements. We're looking for responsible developers that have experience working remotely and delivering high quality work. We also want you to be a long-standing member of our team that will look back years from now and be thrilled that you have made the right decision. You'll be challenged everyday and will gain valuable experience working with different CMS platforms and marketing automation and analytics tools such as HubSpot.The Day-to-DayResponsible for the success of SmartBug's website projects for our clients as well as internal web development initiatives.Responsible for collaborating and working with designers, UX specialists, project managers, QA specialists, and marketing consultants to ensure the delivery of high-end web products to our clients.Projects will mostly be built on the HubSpot COS, but other CMS or content management and marketing automation platforms such as WordPress, Shopify, Marketo, Pardot or others may be used to build websites.Involvement in website redesign project phases including requirements gathering, wireframes, creating copy decks, design, development, internal testing, user testing, launch, and post-launch support.Each phase has built in processes that require iterative improvements to help with the over all goals of rocking the customer experience as well as keeping projects profitable.Utilize strong attention-to-detail to create quality code based on internal web development standards.Give realistic estimates of work and deliver on those timelines.Learn Inbound Marketing principles in order to help facilitate our client's marketing goals and KPIs.Engage in self-learning activities to improve technical skills.Proactively identifies,, troubleshoots, and addresses issues as they arise.Responsible for the improvement and maintenance of web development processes by proactively gathering input from internal and external stakeholders and providing feedback and suggestions to management.Improve HubSpot knowledge by attending trainings and certification programs.Maintain the drive to be passionate about delivering a customer experience that exceeds expectations.Other responsibilities as assignedHave fun and make some great friends!Experience And Education RequirementsAuthorization to work in the U.S. without employer sponsorship is requiredB.S. in Computer Science or related field strongly preferred1-3 years of Front-End Development experience including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, HubSpot's backend language HubL, mobile responsiveness, web development best practices, email templating, and the desire for self-learning to take on additional tools and frameworks as needed.Basic working knowledge of backend programming logic in order to work with languages such as PHP on WordPress sites or other CMS.Minimum of 2 years of experience working with PHP and WordPressWorking knowledge of version control systems such as Git and SQL database basic is required to deliver quality products to our clients.Strong understanding of HubSpot both from a general user standpoint, as well as from a development perspective whether using the Visual Builder or coded templates.Minimum of 1 year of experience developing in HubSpot required, experience across multiple CMS systems preferredMarketing automation platforms (like Pardot, Marketo, etc.) preferredAbility to create application assets (images, etc.) from PSDs using Adobe Photoshop or Sketch while maintaining the full integrity of the original designUnderstanding of an experience implementing SEO a plusExperience with animation/motion graphics a plusExperience building APIs a plusStrong written and verbal communication and the ability to communicate challenges to project management and business leadersExperience using project management and bug tracking toolsProficiency in Google DocsExperience working remotely in similar roles strongly preferredInterview ProcessPhone ScreenVideo interview with Director of Web DevelopmentCoding testReference checkingFinal video interview with SmartBug's CEOOur Extensive Employee Benefits Program IncludesGenerous compensation package with performance incentivesHealth insurance with company contributionPaid maternity and paternity leavePaid vacationPaid time off401(k) with employer matchingFlexible spend planCompany-funded short-term disability and life insuranceLong-term disabilityAnnual leadership conference, SmartBugapaloozaTraining budgetThe flexibility of working remotelyAbout SmartBug Media™SmartBug Media™ is a globally recognized Intelligent Inbound™ marketing agency that assists businesses in growing revenue through content marketing, sales enablement, web development, marketing automation, and PR. For over 10 years, SmartBug™ has helped businesses increase qualified leads, close customers, and enhance the reach and loyalty of their brands. We're one of a handful of HubSpot Diamond partners in the world, the highest-rated agency in the history of the HubSpot ecosystem, and named HubSpot's Global Partner of the Year in 2018. With 5 Comparably awards won in 2018 and being certified as a "Great Place to Work" a second year in a row, it's clear that it's not just our clients that like us.dQYnGTLZPL

items.content: Job DescriptionAs the newest member of our development team you will be designing, maintaining, and improving our platform. Your PHP experience will help us enhance the backend of our platform but since we are a small team you'll be pitching in throughout the stack. To keep our team running like a well-oiled machine, you have mastered collaboration with your active and consistent communication. Our engineering team is remote but we get together in Boulder a few times each year. If you appreciate quality and want to work with true professionals who are building something useful, let's talk!How You'll Spend Your DaysDesigning, developing, and maintaining the current web application utilizing React.js & Bootstrap v3Building and Deploying through Webpack/GitlabCollaborating with development team to implement new featuresExecuting a standardized pipeline for delivering features to the business in an orderly fashionMaking sure that your team members can follow in your footsteps by documenting your workStretching yourself intellectually - challenging conventional thinking with your positive and curious mindWorking in a growth-stage start-up, pitching in wherever you can QualificationsWhat You'll Bring With You4 years of professional experience building software at the enterprise level and at least 3 years of front-end development experience using ReactJSEnough PHP experience to be comfortable with debugging existing work and handling minor feature tasks without assistanceWorking knowledge of SQL - enough to read and understand queriesExperience building web apps that work directly with RESTful API'sAbility to perform tasks across the entire tech stackAn understanding of security principles and how they apply to eCommerce applicationsStrong communication skills with the ability to articulate ideas and issues in a remote environmentOrganized professional capable of managing your time, tasks, and activities without daily guidanceA belief in transparency as a best practice. We all learn from every experience whether they are successes or mistakesAdditional InformationAs part of the team you'll enjoyCompensation commensurate with experience401K match programA passionate team of humans, and pets, to spend your days withGoldstone Partners is helping this successful startup through its hyper-growth stage, and we are looking for Superheroes. Principals only, please. Applications welcomed from US Citizens and Green Card holders only.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=13, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=7, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=56}
items.content: About HealthyWageHealthyWage is a leading provider of fitness challenges for Fortune 500 companies and other employers. HealthyWage also offers products directly to consumers, including the innovative and exciting HealthyWager, which lets you make a bet on your own weight loss. About the positionHealthyWage is looking for a Marketing Web Developer who is experienced in applying their expertise in front-end technologies to develop and support enterprise-class A/B and complex multivariate testing (MVT) for our business stakeholders. The candidate must have experience working in structured environments following defined development methodologies, including client/server and multi-tiered design and development. This position is an integral part of the Engineering team. The Marketing Web Developer will be challenged to utilize all available front-end technologies (HTML, JavaScript, CSS) to support development, implementation, and analysis of marketing-driven testing campaigns using tools like Optimost, Optimizely, Adobe Target, and Maxymiser. Leveraging a thorough knowledge of HTML/CSS, MVC frameworks, OOP techniques, and knowledge of JavaScript/DOM and JavaScript frameworks (jQuery, Prototype, Dojo, Ext, etc.), Marketing Web Developers at HealthyWage work in a collaborative environment to create technical solutions that support optimization and testing strategies of our business stakeholders. Approximately 50% of the developer's time will be focused on developing new pages to be A/B or MVT tested through the HealthyWage CRO program, and the remainder focused on optimizing the existing parts of our live website. ResponsibilitiesEnsure flawless design and execution of tests, based on hypotheses, success metrics, and business requirements put forth by the CRO teamPerform complex html and CSS updates and greenfield development as neededMake recommendations to optimize online opportunities, strategizing all online options and solutionsProactively anticipate issues and develop solutionsDevelop processes that enable the successful development of experimentsProvide support and troubleshooting to ensure cross-functional business partners are clear as to their roles and responsibilities throughout the test process Required skills2-4 years of experience focused on front-end web development1-2 years of experience developing A/B and multivariate tests using industry tools such as HP Optimost, Optimizely, Adobe Target, etc. (Training for specific tools may be provided)Strong command of essential web technologies, including XHTML, CSS, JavaScript, JS Libraries, AJAX, JSON, DOM scripting, unobtrusive JavaScript, XML/XSLT, and W3C DOM methods and propertiesBasic understanding of conversion optimization principles as well as practices and web analytics solutions (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, etc.)Understanding of tableless page layout and positioning, browser behavior and compatibility, and cross-browser issues and solutionsAbility to manipulate site content and functionality using client-side technologiesBonus: Experience with Python development, ideally DjangoSome experience with SQL and databasesStrong desire to apply technical development skills to innovative marketing solutions and products that make real impact on client businesses Nice to haveExposure to source code management tools like CVS and SVNExposure to Adobe Photoshop and other graphic-editing toolsExperience with email template development using providers such as MailChimp, Iterable, Mailgun What we offerCompetitive salaryVirtual Office Program, which allows you to work from anywhere, as long as you have access to outstanding Internet service and can get the job done. The Virtual Office Program is one of the best parts about working at HealthyWage. We've adopted tools that foster a strong, fun, fulfilling and productive work culture, even though most of us are distributed around the country. We supply your remote office with the best supplies and equipment. The Virtual Office Program is amazing for professionals who also happen to be expecting mothers, parents of young and school-age children, people with pets, people who get restless living in one place for too long, and people who just want to be able to work from the mountains or the beach or the farm...or New York City minus the crowded subway ride. ** Interested candidates should complete the following questionnaire to be considered for the position: **

items.content: Postscript is building a best-in-class marketing platform specifically for ecommerce. Backed by Y Combinator (YC W19), Postscript is growing fast and looking for remarkable people to help scale the company. This role is responsible for developing and managing our frontend systems. Our frontend is built with React JS and Bootstrap UI. We are looking for someone with strong frontend and UX skills combined with an intense passion for early-stage companies. You will help the team to build out our architecture and processes as we scale, and help with hiring to grow the engineering team quickly. You will have a large influence on both the product and the company. Primary DutiesArchitect, build and maintain the frontend codebase for our web applicationWork closely with the design team to deliver a beautiful, world-class productTake ownership and get creative with your solutionsDevelop and maintain systems to measure and improve UXImprove our internal development processes to minimize errors and improve team efficiency About You (experience)3+ years software development experience1+ years experience with ReactExperience working closely with backend and design teamsExperience with tools that measure product usage and UX performance About You (culture)You're a hacker; done is better than perfect, and all development efforts should be tied to significant business valueYou love early stage companies and being responsible for owning and improving a new, fast-growing code baseYou're excited for the chance to establish best practices in our development processes and act as a role model for the dev team as it grows You're excited to work a fully-remote teamYou're nice-no room for jerks on this team

items.title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Flexi Hrs / Part Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=13, c=2, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=37}
items.content:
Despite having a relatively small Development team in Nottingham these guys pack a big punch and are responsible for a family of online brands that generate over £50 million in online sales per annum. This makes them one of the largest online retailers in the UK and 2nd only to Boots in the city of Nottingham.

The team is responsible for every aspect of their e-commerce proposition - concept, architecture, UI / UX across their various online brands but also involves CRM and wider business systems development that underpins the business that supports such a significant operation.

The benefits to you 'The Developer' is a variation of work, technologies, problems to solve and solutions to develop and systems to integrate that ultimately allows the team to get into the joined-up thinking that they so enjoy! Not only is the work interesting but the team are very professional and knowledgeable in the sense that they structure projects properly, encourage collaborative working, use methodologies and processes that are fit for purpose and not just for the sake of it, which gives people the freedom to work creatively, autonomously / remotely.

Given the size and scale of the challenge and opportunity, they are also very technically focused, considering all emerging technologies and tools that ultimately drive improved UX. So in addition to projects, some greenfield some enhancements there is always an R&D mindset in the team!

At present they're a Developer down, one of the team has moved internally into their growing DevOps function, so there is a rare opportunity to join an established, very happy and stable team.

Want in?

We're looking for Developers with all or some of the following knowledge and experience.

C#, Javascript, SQL, in particular knowledge of Javascript frameworks (JQuery, Angular, React). Unit Testing / TDD, Web API Applications, Styling Pages CSS, HTML, CSS and Sass. Experience or interest of AWS, Cloud, DevOps, .NetCore

Package comes with remote / flexible working / flexible hours, free parking, 25 days holiday, healthcare and investment in your personal and technical development. Base salaries for a Mid / Senior are in the region of between £40,000 - £50,000 which is bang on market rate in Nottingham.

Contact Simon Bucknell or Laura Illingworth specialise exclusively in Software Development recruitment in the East Midlands. For a friendly and confidential discussion contact us at. EMBS, the exclusive search recruitment partner on this assignment

items.title: Senior Web Developer (Node.JS/Angular) - REMOTE
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=2, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=82, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=58}
items.content:
Resource 1 is seeking a Sr. Web Developer (Node.JS/Angular) for a contract position in Elkridge, MD.

Ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of experience with Node.JS and at least 7 years of experience designing, implementing and supporting web-based applications while adhering to design/development best practices and security standards. This individual will also need to have experience with Angular/Typescript (version 2 or above) and other Front End technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, XML, JSON).Selected candidate will join a team responsible for an application used for authentication management (setting up permissions/access for other users). Initial development will be on the middle tier with Node.JS and RESTful APIs, then move into UI development with Angular.

Ideal candidate would have experience developing in Angular and Node.JS within a MS Azure platform. MS Azure is not required for this position, but it is a plus. Candidates who have experience with the MEAN/MERN stack would be a good fit for this position. Looking for a senior resource with strong communication skills who can make sound technical decisions, think into the future to anticipate potential needs and obstacles, solve problems and add additional insight. This is an Agile development methodology environment, so relevant work experience is preferred. SQL Server development experience is a plus.

Technical Skills: Web Development, UI Development, Full-Stack Development, Middle Tier Development, Angular 2+, Typescript, Node.JS, JavaScript, Azure, NGRX, HTML, CSS, XML, JSON, Web Services (RESTful APIs) & SQL Server.

items.content:
Job Type: Senior Native Android Developer

Location: Remote (company offices in London, Malta, Gibraltar and Cape Town)

Contact name: Liam Burrell

Telephone: +

Salary: £60,000 - £100,000 per annum

This company is regarded as one of the top online casino technology and services companies in SA, with offices in Cape Town, London, Malta and Gibraltar.

We are looking for Senior Native Android Developer's to help improve core platform services and ultimately build a next generation system.

Responsibilities:

  • Working remotely
  • Creating whole new gaming apps from scratch
  • Working with the technical team to deliver end to end solutions

Requirements:

  • Experience developing native mobile apps
  • A good eye for layout with attention to detail
  • An understanding of what UX really means
  • Development experience using Mobile frameworks such as React Native, Ionic, and Cordova or Flutter
  • Experience in developing and deploying native Android as well as native iOS apps
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
  • Experience in developing and consuming web services using both REST and SOAP protocols
  • A familiarity with some form of content management system
  • Good interpersonal skills and a great team attitude
  • The ability to quickly learn new things and adapt
  • Keeping updated on the latest mobile development trends

Ideal candidate would have:

  • Prior experience working in Agile environments
  • Familiarity with managing multiple apps with lots of customization - but using shared code
  • Experience in applying themes to front-ends, to support multiple brands
  • Exposure to writing tests
  • Familiarity with AWS infrastructure

To apply, please send your CV to or call +

If you appreciate quality and want to work with true professionals who are building something useful, let's talk!How You'll Spend Your DaysDesigning, developing, and maintaining the current web application utilizing React.js & Bootstrap v3Building and Deploying through Webpack/GitlabCollaborating with development team to implement new featuresExecuting a standardized pipeline for delivering features to the business in an orderly fashionMaking sure that your team members can follow in your footsteps by documenting your workStretching yourself intellectually - challenging conventional thinking with your positive and curious mindWorking in a growth-stage start-up, pitching in wherever you can QualificationsWhat You'll Bring With You4 years of professional experience building software at the enterprise level and at least 3 years of front-end development experience using ReactJSEnough PHP experience to be comfortable with debugging existing work and handling minor feature tasks without assistanceWorking knowledge of SQL - enough to read and understand queriesExperience building web apps that work directly with RESTful API'sAbility to perform tasks across the entire tech stackAn understanding of security principles and how they apply to eCommerce applicationsStrong communication skills with the ability to articulate ideas and issues in a remote environmentOrganized professional capable of managing your time, tasks, and activities without daily guidanceA belief in transparency as a best practice. We all learn from every experience whether they are successes or mistakesAdditional InformationAs part of the team you'll enjoyCompensation commensurate with experience401K match programA passionate team of humans, and pets, to spend your days withGoldstone Partners is helping this successful startup through its hyper-growth stage, and we are looking for Superheroes. Principals only, please. Applications welcomed from US Citizens and Green Card holders only.

items.content:
JavaScript Web Developer (React/Redux) - 1 day telecommute!

Exciting opportunity for a JavaScript Developer to join a world-class technology leader in Atlanta!

In this direct-hire role, you will join a team responsible for designing, developing, & supporting new custom UI components for enterprise-wide single page applications using React JavaScript, React, Redux, HTML5, CSS, Java, & other Front End technologies and testing tools. These large-scale applications will need to integrate with disparate systems using RESTful web services, JavaScript APIs, and various other Back End systems.

In order to be successful in this role, you must have a solid foundational understanding of JavaScript and modern JavaScript frameworks beyond jQuery as well as a good understanding of functional programming principles. We are looking for a passionate individual with excellent analytical skills, someone who pays close attention to details, enjoys working with modern programming software, and can take on complex tasks with little direction.

If you are interested in joining this world-class company building high performing applications and working with a team of accomplished technologists that offers 1 day telecommute, please apply to Visionaire Partners today!

REQUIRED SKILLS:

  • 3+ years JavaScript Development
  • Professional React experience
  • Advanced HTML5 & CSS
  • Functional/asynchronous programming
  • Experience with Server Side web technologies
  • Excellent communication skills and passion for Front End development

PREFERRED SKILLS:

  • Bachelor's Degree
  • Redux
  • Experience with iterative/test driven development
  • Node.js, Ruby on Rails, PHP, Django
  • Experience with client side testing tools like Jest, Mocha, Chai, Sinon, Jasmine, etc.
  • Open-source frameworks like Spring
  • Git or similar source control

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=8, mobile=23, go=0, nodejs=30, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=13, java=1, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=28}
items.content: Welligent, a fast-growing Electronic Health Record (EHR) software vendor based in Norfolk, is seeking an experienced mobile application developer to develop and support custom-developed Welligent apps. A leading national software vendor, Welligent provides a comprehensive, enterprise cloud-based software solution which comprises practice management, clinical, billing and reporting functions. Ancillary to its cloud-based solutions, Welligent also offers mobile apps which offer a sub-set of functionality or complementary functionality to our cloud-based solutions. Welligent's customers include community-based behavioral/health and human services providers in more than 30 states. Our company culture and environment has the excitement of a start-up with the intensity of a growing healthcare information technology company solving national issues. There is a pervasive sense that the work we do is making a big impact in the lives of our customers and those they serve.Job Duties Serve as the primary app developer and responsible for app design and UI, all development, testing, debugging and on-going enhancements Lead Welligent's mobile development initiatives as the primary app developer and grow Welligent's mobile practice area Responsible for the ongoing evolution of our existing mobile apps, to enhance functionality and provide a better experience for end users Working within our existing application frameworks, provide creative input, expertise and technical methods Make a significant impact by working directly with the company and product owners, developers and other team members to improve upon an existing strong enterprise application with an extensive national user base Work with the business users to understand and document functionality requirements Collaborate with other technical team members including Welligent's web-services team to understand/ensure data requirements are met As needed, perform business and data requirements gathering and data analysis tasks Identify and document relevant data design, process and specifications Willingness to understand business context and problems and communicate them clearly in written and oral format Requirements Bachelor's degree required Advanced knowledge/experience with Angular with Javascript Advanced knowledge/experience with Cordova and plugins Knowledge of jQuery, Ionic, FullCalendar framework Must be familiar with PouchDB integration for SQLite Experience with SQLite offline storage Basic knowledge of TypeScript Basic knowledge of C++ for comping Windows package Must be familiar with NodeJs package manager PHP (must be familiar with curl basic authentications) Data encryption - AES, Hash NodeJs, must be familiar with package manager using the command line Sass (a plus but not needed since UI already built) User interface design and front end development experience Knowledge of HTML, DHTML, CSS and JavaScript Experience with Android Studio, Xcode/Swift, Visual Studio Experience with Apple, Google, and Microsoft store submission process and knowledge of creating and publishing provisioning profiles and certificates for all platforms. Must be familiar with HTTP services Some knowledge of Red Hat Linux server, basic knowledge of command line connection using SSH Knowledge of relational database design Ability to work independently and solve complex software problems Strong analytical and problem solving skills Knowledge of Healthcare IT, EHR/EMR or clinical systems preferred Experience working in a small team to build and enhance complex enterprise software applications Green card or US Citizenship required BenefitsIn addition to health, dental and 401K benefits, Welligent's competitive perks and benefits include the potential for year-end bonus, flexible work schedule, casual office environment in an up-and-coming area of Norfolk near Old Dominion University, no dress code, Starbucks coffee and an amazing group of co-workers.

items.title: Course Concierge: Wanted: Dependable full-stack developer, long-term position, exciting company
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=40, embedded=0, frontend=66}
items.content:
Wanted: Dependable full-stack developer, long-term position, exciting company

Hi there,

My name’s Edward. I’m co-founder of Course Concierge, the online course publishing company.

For the right person, we hope this is something of a Dream Job – and dream company.

If you are someone who…
- Wants to take pride in active and stimulating work;
- Gets excited at the prospect of being part of a team, with fast-paced and varied demands;
- Has the ability to work within tight deadlines and juggle multiple tasks with poise;
…this could be the opportunity you’ve been looking for.

We’re a great company to join. Here’s why…
- We’re new (just two-and-a-half years’ old) and you will be getting in at the ground level (only our second developer – and for which our first, Haris, is eager to have you)
- We have an unbelievably engaged team, with world-class people in every department (from video production to research to copywriting and design)
- Our clients are fantastic. We take on only a handful, and are incredibly selective in who we work with
- You can work from anywhere in the world. Though for this position we’d like someone in a North/South American timezone (between Eastern and Pacific), our current team of 12 spans eight countries
- You will have the dependence of a team and consistent, regular income – and time just enough around the edges to continue working on a few of your own things too should you wish.

This position is the right fit for…

…Someone who wants to be part of something.

Us having been at this a while now, we know the importance of development. A developer is the backbone of an online company, and relied on more than anyone. Without the right developer, the rest of the team cannot function.

The ideal fit for us is someone who is already very capable, but who wants to learn and is adaptable to learning our processes – as well as helping shape and further improve them.

(A key thing with Haris: we want you both able and comfortable jumping in to work on each other’s code.)

You need to…

- Like a big workload and be comfortable working quickly. We get a lot done in a day and you will be pushed
- Welcome revisions and embrace perfectionist tendencies (as well as our clients’)
- Be a clear and capable communicator. As a company, we take writing seriously. Great written English and attention to detail are essential
- Be someone we enjoy working with. Fit comes first, above everything else for us.

Nearly all of our communication is written (we use Basecamp 3, and are big fans of it), but we’d like you to be comfortable getting on the occasional call too.

As a Full-stack WordPress developer the position is the right fit for you if…

- You are someone who completely understands how WordPress works at the code level. You have built your own custom themes/plugins and you know how to extend WordPress core. 
- You understand how REST APIs work and you are comfortable consuming RESTful web services, either via the client (AJAX) or the server (PHP).
- You like finding smart and elegant solutions to coding problems, in line with WordPress coding and security best practices. Your code is clean, understandable and well commented.
- You have solid knowledge of PHP, MySQL, HTML, Javascript/JQuery, CSS. Experience on any kind of front-end framework (i.e. Bootstrap) or Javascript framework (React, Vue) is a plus.
- You are competent with version control systems (Git) and having experience with modern web development workflows and tools (Yarn, Gulp, Sass) is a plus.

Your day to day with us will comprise the following…

Throughout each project, we have five core development needs.

1. Lay the foundation

Setup of a client’s domain and hosting, and integration of a payment gateway (Stripe), membership plugin and email platform.

We use WordPress as a base for most things, and you need to be comfortable managing technical migrations.

2. Create a stunning website

Here’s an example, from one of our first clients…

http://theweekendwoodworker.com

From our designer’s PSDs, everything you create needs to live up to it – being wonderfully responsive, with no stone (from the thank you page to a nicely categorised list of pages on the back-end) left unturned.

3. Build a long-form sales page

Our designer makes sales pages that are many thousands of words digestible and enticing to read. We need you to do their work justice.

4. Creation of membership areas

We have a favoured WordPress membership plugin, and with it to create a layout that houses courses with clear and simple navigation.

We look to provide clients’ customers the best learning environment possible.

5. Checkout pages

Making sure payments are taken (reliably), membership entitlements are correct, and segments are created in a newsletter platform for buyers.

You’re familiar with best practices for security and testing.

*

The position will start at 15–20 hours per week, and hours will grow readily from there – pay set at a fair, mutually agreed hourly rate. We aim to have somebody with us for the long haul.

To apply…

Please write back (developer@courseconcierge.com) with *one* example of a project you have coded, along with a brief pitch on why you think you’d be a great fit.

Do not send more than one link or your entry will be disqualified.

Also, please do not send a resume, CV or attachment of any kind. We don’t care where you went to college (or even that you went at all) – all that matters is whether you can do it.

We won’t be able to get back to everyone, but for those who stand out, we will send a list of interview questions in writing, then, for the few we like best, set up a brief call to discuss the opportunity.

The deadline for submissions is September 15th, though those who apply sooner are at an advantage.

We’ll pick two candidates from interviews to begin a paid two-week trial (to assess on-the-job performance and cultural fit). One person will then be chosen for the ongoing role.

Thank you for reading. Best of luck, and we look forward to hearing from you,

Edward

items.title: Lead Ruby Software Developer & Foodie at Once A Month Meals
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=6, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=74, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=64}
items.content:
Lead Ruby Software Developer & Foodie

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Software Development, Web Development
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Once A Month Meals | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time +/- 4 hours

Technologies

ruby-on-rails
ruby
postgresql

Job description

Work on a product that improves the end users life, health and nutrition; while not giving up your own to do so!

Position: Lead Ruby Software Developer & Foodie

Reports To: Product Manager

Demand: Typically, 40 hours per week during normal business hours

Location: Remote (within the U.S.) or on-site in Dayton, Ohio (US Citizens only please; no companies)

Start Date: Flexible

Application: http://bit.ly/oammrubysoftware

Once a Month Meals (OAMM) is a Web-based product and community with the goal of empowering wellness through meal planning and freezer cooking. 

OAMM believes that your work, time and hobbies shouldn’t come at the cost of family and health. Gathering around the dinner table, eating with those you care about and enjoying a nutritious meal is paramount to our mission. Therefore, we create software to further empower individuals to bring back family dinner time without sacrificing the little spare time they have available—giving our users time for what matters most.

OAMM began as a blog in 2009 with a deep, rich, invested community. Over the last six years it has emerged as a SaaS product fueled by the passions and membership of the community. The technology side of our product is exciting and challenging to build but unlike many other SaaS products, it isn’t the technology that drives the product. The driving force is our community/membership. We believe strongly that these two things, technology and community, have to be in balance and we are looking for a software developer that can respect, appreciate and aspire to help us grow both. OAMM is also committed to steady growth through self-funding as we evolve our product.

The Position

Once A Month Meals is looking to add to its technology team an experienced Lead Ruby Software Developer. As part of the OAMM technology team, you’ll work with freezer cooking, “cooking math,” user accounts, ecommerce, and more. You’ll need to be comfortable with databases like MySQL and Postgres, and either understand (or be able to come up to speed quickly on) Solr. Experience designing, building, and supporting REST APIs with authentication is important, because we leverage a number of third party APIs for crucial aspects of our systems.

It will be important to have the experience and ability to do some long-term, big-picture architecture thinking but have the skills and desire enough to implement this architecture through solid, tested code. 

Your coding abilities are just one piece of the puzzle though. In addition to being able to write great code, this position requires a unique skill set. The following are vital to the success of this position:

  1. Ruby on Rails Depth of Knowledge - It isn’t enough to simply have used Ruby here and there, a deep understanding and application of it in your previous work is essential.
  2. Experience in the Kitchen - it doesn’t have to be freezer or batch cooking, although experience with those is a plus. Experience in the kitchen cooking, preparing recipes and/or meal planning is important to the role and to understanding the software’s main functions.
  3. A Love for Math - fractions, ceilings, scaling recipes and mathematical algorithms are a regular part of coding life in this role. If you told your high school math teacher you would never use algebra again, this probably isn’t the role for you. :)
  4. Organizational Leadership - the ability to be self directed, write scopes, document processes and communicate those to a team is imperative. This is a small team (front end developer, project manager and yourself) right now, which means that there is an expectation that you will be able to lead yourself and eventually others. Strong communication and decision making within the context of the greater team mission is important.
  5. Experience Working on a LIVE Product - proven experience designing, planning, and building web applications to scale is imperative. There are thousands of active users on this system requiring that the code needs to be incrementally built, tested and released to ensure zero disruptions to the user experience.

Your job duties will include:

  • Maintaining two Rails apps
    • Keeping the Ruby gems updated on staging and production environments
  • Watching and improving performance (speed and analytics) of APIs
  • Build, maintain and test new features
  • Develop automated, incremental, deployments and tests
  • Assistance in setting technical direction for the OAMM products

Skills/Tools/Qualifications:

  • Ruby
  • Rails
  • MySQL
  • Postgres
  • Git
  • Automated deployments (Capistrano, etc.)
  • Stripe API

Because we are a small (8 full-time and 3 part-time), fully-bootstrapped team, we all play multiple roles. As we grow, we want to continue to build a product design and development team. This position will be a key-player on that team with opportunity to impact the technical architecture and the future development team.

The ideal candidate is:

  • a self-starter—they seek out opportunities to learn new methods or technologies
  • a problem-solver—they figure out how to get things done
  • comfortable with task runners like gulp and grunt
  • competent with git and github
  • mindful of performance and interested in implementing tools like performance budgets
  • unashamed in their support of accessibility best practices as well as progressive enhancement and responsive design
  • able to communicate effectively in writing and in-person
  • willing to balance all constraints of a problem: user needs, timeline, budget, product vision
  • A meal planner - they see the benefits and are willing to plan meals for themselves on a regular basis
  • collaborative—nothing gets done in a vacuum around here, we need folks who recognize they’ll be better if they work with others

Experience with deeper software development best-practices (or strong desire to grow into them) is a plus:

  • work with other members of the product team to build modular, maintainable and reusable code
  • work with internal and external resources to implement fixes and features to the stack currently in place (WordPress, Sass, Rails)
  • recommend and implement best-practices around developer productivity, source-control, automated testing, API design, security, performance and share our learnings with the greater tech community

Additional experience in the following strongly desired:

  • Javascript frameworks such as React, Ember, or Angular, or Vue
  • Solr
  • CircleCI
  • Docker
  • PHP

The Culture

OAMM strives to create an environment where individuals are encouraged to work independently but enabled to work collaboratively. We spend a lot of time on Slack and in video calls interacting daily. We also get together in person at least twice a year for a retreat, usually to a warm climate. We value spending time with one another when we are at work, and caring for each person, while recognizing and encouraging a work-life family balance.

The Benefits

  • Competitive Salary
  • Personal Days: Two weeks (plus one week holiday shutdown and minimal standard US holidays due to peak sales periods matching those holidays—so we try to make up for it during the year)
  • Flexible Schedule: Work when you want, just provide us with some Eastern Time Zone overlap for meetings
  • All the hardware and software needed to do your job
  • Opportunity to make a real difference in the lives of families
Apply now

About Once A Month Meals

We are a small (8 full-time and 3 part-time), fully-bootstrapped team, so most of us play multiple roles. The product team includes 3 of our 11 staff members. When fully staffed, we have a full-time front-end developer, a full-time back end developer (that's the position we are hiring now) and a full-time project manager who also serves as a data analyst and QA Tester. Given the small nature of the team you will be both leading and writing code. 

The technology team serves the larger organization in a vital way. The technology powers the membership manager system and the recipe/menu database. The rest of the team is working with the end user directly. We take it very seriously that the technology team is an integrated part of the bigger team. They participate in staff meetings, retreats, conversations about features needed for the end-user and much more. To see more about our culture, values and mission check out - https://onceamonthmeals.com/about/.

Though small now, we want to continue to build a product design and development team as we build the membership base. 

Benefits

  • Flexible Schedule: Work when you want with some EDT overlap.
  • Family-Friendly Work Environment w/true work/life balance
  • Competitive Salary
  • Medical/Dental Compensation
  • Ample time off including a whole company shut down at the holidays.
  • All the hardware and software needed to do your job

items.title: Senior Front-End Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=31}
items.content: You’re the kind of person for whom architecture and design makes you tick. It’s in your blood; you love great design, and you strive to architect it every single day. You know what makes functional design great, and also know when pragmatism is called for. You know all the rules, and yet you’re willing to break them from time to time. As a Senior Front-End Developer with Rebilly, you’ll be responsible for guiding the architecture and design of our front-end applications. You’ll lead a team of developers to produce the highest quality software possible, and you’ll be responsible for mentoring them along the way. Our problems are hard, requiring dedication, expertise and the ability to look at solutions from many different angles. It will be your job to make the hard choices and deliver on time, bug-free code that delights our clients and maximizes their value. You’ll need to have passion, vision, and courage in order to take Rebilly to the next level and to make us the leading subscription billing service by 2025. Here’s what a typical day will look like at Rebilly:- Split your time between coding and leading, including weekly 1-on-1 meetings with other team members- Review developer code, providing suggestions on how, where and when to make improvements.- Ensure adherence to programming and documentation policies, code standards, testing, and release.- Mentor others with an emphasis on our core values, and above all maximizing customer success.- Help identify new initiatives, design new products and services, and improving our processes.- Work closely with developers on your team, and with the leads of other teams.- Assist with the mentorship and leadership of developers.**A Picture of Success****OBJECTIVE #1 Customer billing portal**- Potential Obstacles: Creating a customer billing portal that is secure, customizable and performant is not an easy task.- Actions:  Determine the requirements of the billing portal and breakdown the task for you and other team members to implement. Research best practices in portals security and apply them to the project.- Results:  # of active customer billing portals.**OBJECTIVE #2 Third-party integrations**- Potential Obstacles: Translating an API into a third-party integration.- Actions: Using our existing integrations as a reference implement new connections to third-party applications in the UI. - Results:  # merchants using integrations or similar.**OBJECTIVE #3 Improving App UX**- Potential Obstacles: Managing high levels of complexity in proposed interfaces while taking user experience into account.- Actions: Use your critical mind to interpret mockups and architect interfaces with existing features and reusable components. - Results: % Users who activate their trial account.  **Apply!**Please send your resume through Apply By API: [https://app.applybyapi.com/posting/9/](https://app.applybyapi.com/posting/9/)**HIRING PROCESS**- Apply By API* - [https://app.applybyapi.com/posting/9/](https://app.applybyapi.com/posting/9/)- Small code challenge (unless you have extensive open source contributions)- Interview with the Product Team - Interview with the Product Team Lead- Offer and Hiring The total process should take less than 2 weeks.*We are only accepting applications through ApplyByAPI at this time.**WORKING AT REBILLY**Check us out at [https://www.rebilly.com/careers/](https://www.rebilly.com/careers/)Rebilly offers a competitive salary, training and development, birthday lunches, and provides the computer of your choosing. You are welcome to work out of our Montreal office, remotely out of Austin (occasionally meeting with our team here for lunch or happy hour, otherwise set up as a 100% remote/work from home environment), or anywhere on the globe that you choose as a fully remote employee. Further perks and benefits are dependent on your work location of choice. Rebilly is a Teal Organization, meaning our organizational structure may differ than what you’re used to, but we think you’ll be pleasantly surprised. In a very tiny nutshell, this means that as an organization we value self-management, self-organization, as well as the wholeness of the individuals that make up our team (meaning you should be yourself at work, and do the work that inspires you.) **ABOUT REBILLY**Rebilly is subscription billing software that helps businesses who need to handle recurring invoices and payments. Rebilly’s comprehensive feature set is built to help our merchants get more of their customers from the order form to the thank you page, and more renewals paid. We took lessons learned from years of experience in the subscription business and millions of subscribers and applied them to make our payment system clever, flexible, and easy to use for our clients.

items.content:
Developer Experience Engineer - Remote Friendly

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Industry: DevOps, SaaS, Test Automation
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Cypress.io | No office location

Technologies

reactjs
javascript
web-services
angular
vue.js

Job description

Note: This is a remote-friendly position. West Coast and Central U.S. are preferred. 

Do you get excited about developer tools? Do you have a keen eye for software quality/testing practices and methods? Do you enjoy sharing your knowledge with fellow developers? Are you eager to solve the challenges that developers like yourself face?

If yes, then join the new Developer Experience (DX) team at Cypress to empower developers to build and ship higher quality software faster than ever before.

The DX Engineer is a highly visible role that puts you right in front of the Cypress community via conferences, workshops, meetups, webcasts, and other speaking engagements. This responsibility requires you to be a technical expert and communicator with a strong ability to clearly articulate specific problems and solutions to support the diverse use cases of Cypress.

The DX Engineer is a cross-functional role requiring you to collaborate with product design, engineering, marketing, and customer-success teams to ensure that users have a smooth, high-fidelity, and productive end-to-end experience with Cypress. 

The DX Engineer is a high-impact role, acting as a spokesperson to scale awareness, increase product adoption, and build industry mindshare via development of tutorials, demonstration apps, custom plugins, integrations with other frameworks/services, and related methodologies. Most importantly, you’ll disseminate all this knowledge via formal documentation, blog posts, presentations, and video content that can be consumed by a diverse developer audience.

Responsibilities 

  • Author and engage with the community to create curated presentations, videos, demonstrations, and learning guides to make it incredibly easy for developers to use Cypress.

  • Be a community leader to the Cypress community, creating an eager, inclusive ecosystem of developers who love our products and recommend it to others. 

  • Foster relationships with the open source community and establish partnerships that improve the experience and workflow of Cypress users across common frameworks and libraries.

  • Support product launch activities via validation of final experience, demonstration content, product messaging, engaging with early-access users, collaborating with launch partners, and more.

  • Develop demonstration apps, custom plugins, integrations with other frameworks/services, and testing-related methodologies

Requirements

  • Exceptional written and oral communication skills to engage a variety of audiences, including developers, QA, and senior decision makers.

  • Extensive experience using client and server-side JavaScript and frameworks such as Angular, React, and Vue.

  • Driven, with an entrepreneurial spirit and sense of urgency. Must be resourceful, proactive, and deadline driven.

  • Highly organized, detail-oriented and possess a high level of integrity.

  • Collaborative team player that works well in collaborative situations and start-up environments.

  • Natural leadership skills and the ability to work with all teams in the company

  • Open-minded, accepting of different perspectives and willingness to measure and experiment.

  • Willingness to travel <20% to events and customer engagements.

Benefits & Perks

  • Competitive salary

  • Health, dental and vision coverage

  • Life insurance and disability coverage

  • Remote-friendly

  • Generous paid time off and sick leave

  • Flexible work hours

  • Work with the latest technologies

  • Contribute to open source

  • Semiannual travel to work and play with our Atlanta-based team

  • Healthy office drinks and snacks

  • Modern laptop and equipment provided

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Cypress is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

To apply:
Visit: https://smrtr.io/3qT4c

Apply now

About Cypress.io

Cypress is ambitiously changing the status quo of testing on the web with our next-generation open source Test Runner and a Dashboard Service that enable an unprecedented developer experience. Our mission is focused squarely on making testing faster, easier, and more approachable than ever before.

Cypress is remote-friendly, and we frequently hire directly from our own passionate user base. As a developer, you’ll help build tools or services that immediately impact the workflow of thousands of organizations and tens of thousands of developers using Cypress around the world.

Benefits

  • Competitive Salary
  • Health, Dental and Vision coverage
  • Life Insurance and Disability Coverage
  • Remote-friendly
  • Generous PTO and Sick leave
  • Flexible Work Hours
  • Work with the latest technologies + contribute to Open Source
  • Semiannual travel to work and play with our Atlanta-based team
  • Healthy office drinks and snacks
  • Modern laptop equipment provided
