items.content:
Javascript Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: eCommerce, Manufacturing
Company size: 201–500 people
Company type: Private
Company: Sticker Mule | No office location

Technologies

javascript
go
reactjs

Job description

What you’ll do

1. Design, build, test, deploy and maintain web applications and services.

2. Write clean, performant code in accordance with our team’s code style guidelines.

3. Work to improve and maintain the code health of all our software.

4. Collaborate with team leads and stakeholders to ensure that we’re always building the best possible solution in the optimal way.

5. Participate in peer code reviews.

6. Share expertise with other members of the team, mentor junior developers.

About you

1. You have a minimum of 3 years professional software development experience.

2. You’re highly competent in JavaScript. Experience with Golang would be a benefit.

3. You have experience building single page applications, ideally with with React.

4. You possess strong analytical and critical thinking skills.

5. You have great written and verbal communication skills in English.

What we offer

1. A competitive salary.

2. Remote working with flexible schedule.

3. Opportunity to make a large impact as part of a small, highly motivated team.

4. Varied, interesting technical challenges to work on.

Apply now

About Sticker Mule

Sticker Mule is the Internet's fastest-growing printing company. We are privately-owned, profitable, and powered by an outstanding, globally distributed team who cares deeply about delivering a great customer experience at the highest technical standards.
Our software engineering team operates from 17 different countries, and we're always looking for more exceptional engineers to join us.

See more about our teams here and here

Benefits

  • Flexible hours with asynchronous culture.
  • Sustainable work pace without unreasonable expectations or deadlines.
  • Varied, interesting technical challenges.
  • Opportunities to make a large impact as a small team.
  • We'll pay or provide you with all of the tools you need to do your job
  • If you want to work from a standing desk just ask and we'll get you on
  • We monitor industry salaries and pay above market compensation.

items.title: REMOTE: Software Developer (m/w/d) Ruby on Rails
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=55, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=47}
items.content:
REMOTE: Software Developer (m/w/d) Ruby on Rails

HAUSGOLD digitalisiert den Verkaufsprozess von Immobilien für Verkäufer, Käufer und Makler mit dem Ziel mehr Transparenz und Effizienz zu schaffen. Unsere eigenentwickelte Software und eine professionelle Kundenbetreuung bilden zusammen mit unserem Netzwerk von mehreren tausend Maklern vor Ort eine einzigartige Basis für unser weiteres Wachstum.

Anfang 2014 gegründet, haben wir uns inzwischen zu einem der führenden PropTech Unternehmen im deutschsprachigen Raum entwickelt. Unser Team aus mittlerweile über 50 Mitarbeitern und namhafte Investoren wie der Deutschen Bank oder Rocket Internet bilden die Basis unseres Erfolgs.

Wir vergrößern unser Development-Team und suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Dich als Software Developer (m/w/d) Ruby on Rails in Hamburger Schanzenviertel oder Remote.

WELCHE AUFGABEN AUF DICH WARTEN

Als Ruby on Rails Developer bei HAUSGOLD konzipierst, entwickelst und wartest Du Services in unserer serviceorientierten Architektur und hilfst uns vorhandene monolithische Systeme abzulösen. Du entwickelst Schnittstellen für Web und Mobile und dokumentierst Deine Arbeit für das Team. Neben Codereviews und Workshops unterstützt Du unser Team mit Deinem Know-How.

Einen kleinen Einblick bekommst Du hier:  

DEINE QUALIFIKATIONEN

  • Du verfügst über eine Ausbildung oder ein Studium im Bereich der Informatik oder hast einen vergleichbaren Abschluss
  • Du hast sehr gute Kenntnisse in Ruby on Rails
  • Du hast Erfahrung mit agiler Softwareentwicklung
  • Du hast Erfahrungen mit der Versionsverwaltung unter Git
  • Du nutzt REST-APIs und TDD/BDD
  • Idealerweise hast Du bereits Erfahrungen mit Docker sammeln können
  • Konzentriertes und sorgfältiges Arbeiten sowie eine strukturierte und koordinierte Arbeitsweise runden Dein Profil ab

Darüber hinaus sind folgende Kenntnisse von Vorteil

  • Bootstrap mit Sass
  • Grundkenntnisse in der Frontend-Entwicklung mit Angular oder React
  • Erfahrung mit Responsive Design unter der Verwendung von HTML5 und CSS3

Im Übrigen handeln wir nach der Maxime, dass man nicht alles schon können muss, aber gerne lernen möchte.

WAS WIR DIR BIETEN

DEINE BENEFITS

  • Hier kannst Du proaktiv Fragen stellen, brainstormen und auch in Remote zusammen mit Deinen Kollegen arbeiten
  • Du hast eine zuverlässige Entwicklungsumgebung mit u.a. High-Speed Internet und Phone Access
  • Bei uns hast Du ein Umfeld, in dem Du fokussiert und ohne Ablenkung arbeiten kannst

WAS HAUSGOLD DIR DARÜBER HINAUS BIETET

  • Ein aufstrebendes Technologieprojekt mit professioneller Entwicklungsmethodik
  • Eine anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit mit täglich neuen Herausforderungen
  • Agile Softwareentwicklung
  • Flexible und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitszeitgestaltung
  • Ein freundliches Arbeitsumfeld in einer der schönsten Städte Deutschlands
  • Frisches Obst und kostenlose Getränke
  • Sympathisches und agiles Team, mit dem es Spaß macht zusammen zu arbeiten
  • Regelmäßige Team-Events und die unternehmensübergreifende Gelegenheit zum fachlichen Austausch
  • Du entscheidest selbst, mit welchem System Du am liebsten arbeiten möchtest: Mac, Linux, Windows - Du wählst und wir organisieren Dir Deinen Rechner

BEWERBUNG

Du bist Developer aus Leidenschaft und hast Lust Dich in unserem Internet-Startup einzubringen? Dann bewirb Dich mit Deinem aussagekräftigen Lebenslauf inklusive der Angabe Deines möglichen Eintrittstermins sowie Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung.

Deine Ansprechpartnerin ist Lynda. Melde Dich gerne bei uns, falls Du Fragen zu Deiner Bewerbung hast.

Apply now

items.content:
Chapter Lead Mobile (m/f/d)

Company: Raisin
Location: Berlin, DE
Level: Senior
Language: English
Mobile Apps Developer
Skills:
  • Application Development
  • Mobile Web Design

    • Intro

    We are a dynamic, successful, and fast growing FinTech company based in Berlin, that aims to making savings and investments digitally accessible to improve customer benefit. Our goal is to provide customers all over Europe with simple, secure, and profitable savings and investment products without barriers. We have received more than €195 million in funding from well-known investors including Thrive Capital, Ribbit Capital, Index Ventures, Yuri Milner, Tom Stafford and PayPal.
    Raisin has been very successful over the last few years at delighting it’s customers through enabling deposits and investments without barriers across the EU. 
    Your mission as an experienced Leader & React Native Developer is to enable teams to build great solutions with delighting UI’s and an amazing mobile user experience. Increasing the engagement of existing customers and winning over new customer groups and market segments are amongst the key objectives.

    Your responsibilities:

    • You are Chapter lead, with accountability for the improvement of our overall mobile engineering capability, including talent, workflows and tools
    • You are Key contributor in a cross-functional mobile team
    • You are a hands-on team lead and mentor
    • You ensure a high working morale, teamspirit, and productivity
    • You develop both your chapter’s soft- and technical skill-set according to the company goals and needs
    • You coach your chapter to remove obstacles independently, but you also get your hands dirty, when needed
    • You are a role model and inspire your chapter to live our principles of customer-centric innovation, entrepreneurship and responsibility
    • You are a key contributor to an efficient development environment and optimal workflows for the whole engineering organization
    • You are a great communicator and empathetic motivator when needed 

    Main requirements

     Your profile:

    • You bring at least 3 years of leadership experience
    • You know how to manage software projects to a successful delivery in collaborative way
    • Entrepreneurial mind-set and the ability to guide teams towards a common goal in a fast-paced international environment
    • You have strong experience (3y)  with React Native / Redux and have a portfolio of nice examples that showcases your experience
    • You have a deep understanding of the app integration and delivery lifecycle, including code signing and app store reviews
    • You are an open-minded and creative team player enjoying constructive code and architecture discussions
    • Writing clean, maintainable and well documented code comes naturally - we strongly believe in the power of clean code
    • Android (Java) and/or iOS (Swift) experience is a plus
    • Fluency in English, German language skills are a plus though not mandatory 
     
    Our benefits:

     Be part of a diverse team of more than 34 different nationalities, who strongly believes in agile cross-functional methods, collaboration and appreciation in our daily work. We are professional and work hard to always be the best in our field. You find us in our open office in beautiful Prenzlauer Berg well connected to public transport and surrounded by a great variety of restaurants and supermarkets.

    • Relocation and visa support as well as a relocation reimbursement
    • Personal training budget of 1,500 € and four full training days
    • Free choice of hardware
    • Beginner German classes directly at the office and financial support for acquiring a language certificate 
    • Hungry all the time? Breakfast, snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks are provided
    • Stay up to date at regular townhall sessions with our founders and feel free to ask any kinds of questions
    • Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days 
    • Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than 20 € per month 
    • We offer you a company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20 %
    • Enjoy yearly company retreats to exciting European cities and other team events, such as Lunch Lottery, Tech Lunch, Xletix and Raisin Ladies Events

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=50, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=43}
items.content:
Ruby on Rails / React Developer

At Planning Center, we build powerful, beautiful applications specifically for churches. Each of our apps has a dedicated team of designers and developers who are committed to refining and expanding their specific app in response to real customer needs. Our customers include over 90 of the 100 largest churches in the country, but also tens of thousands of small community and neighborhood churches, and we strive to make day-to-day operations easier for all of them.

We’re a development driven company — over half our staff are either developers or designers who code, and even our founder spends much of his time programming — and we’re seeking another developer with expertise in Ruby, Rails, and React to help make our software even better.




Developers at Planning Center are:
  • Invested. We care about the products we create and the people we create them for, and we all contribute to the vision and direction of our apps. Every one of our developers is critical to their team.
  • Curious. We aren’t afraid to ask questions, experiment, and iterate. We also love playing with fun new technologies, and we have Free Weeks every few months for exploring projects that spark our interest.
  • Humble. We are always looking for opportunities to grow and learn from one another.

We believe the strongest teams are made up of people with diverse backgrounds and experiences, and we are committed to cultivating that diversity here at Planning Center. We are ready for the ongoing work that goes into building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do your best work.

In your daily life at Planning Center, you could expect to:
  • Take ownership of your projects and have a voice in how to best complete them
  • Collaborate with your product manager, front-end designer, and fellow app team developers
  • Engage in an agile development process
  • Make coffee eight different ways in our rad coffee bar
  • ...or, if you’re remote, drink coffee in a hip co-working space that we help pay for
  • Do work you’re proud of alongside a team of smart, thoughtful, like-minded developers

What to Expect If You Apply



There's no reason for this process to be an adventure full of unknown surprises! Here's what you're getting yourself into:
  1. Submit your resume.
  2. We'll have a quick and casual phone call (10-15 minutes) to introduce ourselves and to double check that this position is the type of position that you are interested in and could be a good fit for.
  3. You'll be sent a programming exercise covering the basics of the tech stack that we use at Planning Center (Ruby, Rails, and React). This is an opportunity for you to see a glimpse of the kind of work you'd be doing here, and for us to begin evaluating technical skills.
  4. A live pair programming exercise with our team. There's no whiteboards, and no typing! Someone from our team will type as the two of you work through a pair programming exercise together. You'll get to meet another potential future co-worker, and we'll get a glimpse into how you work as we make some tests pass together.
  5. Pack your bags, you're coming to San Diego! The final step is a day in our San Diego office where you'll get to meet our leadership team and members of your potential new product team. It will be a full day of interviews with different people where we'll both have lots of chances to find out if we're a good fit for each other.
  6. It's offer time! Throughout all the previous steps, your expertise and experience have been assessed against our well defined developer levels and the salary amount of the offer will be decided solely based on that assessment. At Planning Center, every developer of the same skill level makes the same amount (plus a small bonus for seniority). We aim to pay at the 90th percentile for each level based on research from Payscale.
REQUIREMENTS
  1. Eligible to work in the United States.
  2. If remote, must be willing to travel to the office four times each year to connect with the rest of the team in person.
  3. Proven experience as a full stack developer (or similar role) using Ruby, Rails, and React.
BENEFITS



We love our people and want this to be the best place for them to work. In addition to a competitive salary (starting between $100,000 - $150,000 depending on expertise), we offer:



  • Full health, dental, and vision coverage
  • Company contribution to a 401(k)
  • Mobile phone allowance
  • Co-working stipend
  • Health stipend for counseling or a gym membership
  • Charitable giving match
  • Paid parental leave
  • Vacation and paid holidays
  • Paid Fridays off in the summer 
  • Continual education allowance for books, videos, or conferences
  • Free weeks every several months to work on a project of your choosing
Gear



The things you need to get your job done - laptop, monitor, standing desk, chair - all on us!



Work from Anywhere in the USA



We are dedicated to hiring the best talent available; part of working at Planning Center is the option to work remote! We fly our remote team into the office once every quarter, so you can enjoy the nice California weather and connect with the rest of the team (75% of which is remote).



Apply now

items.title: Software Engineer (React/React Native)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=21, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=12, ruby=0, apple=9, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=41}
items.content:
About Feebris


We build intuitive, mobile-based software, powered by AI, that empowers non-medical users to detect some of the most complex diseases, using the latest medical sensors. We have a mobile app that connects to off-the-shelf medical sensors, and intuitively guides non-medical users through a 15-minute examination. We also have a web app so doctors can remotely review patient data to provide diagnoses and treatment. Our mission is to prevent hospitalisations and suffering from conditions that could have been prevented or treated at home.


We believe that no one should die or suffer from treatable conditions. And yet, every year nearly 1 million children around the world die from pneumonia (a treatable disease). But this is just the tip of the iceberg; the world over (even in the UK), our children and elderly often do not get the care they need until it is too late.


We currently provide our SaaS platform to companies that deliver health and social care to elderly in the UK, and to those that help young children in India. We’ve won awards for our disruptive technology (UKBAA, Children’s Prize), our founder is an internationally renowned speaker on AI in healthcare[1], and earlier this year we raised a £1.1m seed round.


The Role


You’ll be at the heart of Feebris’ software engineering team, designing and building a platform across web and mobile that delivers AI backed algorithms to help non-medical users diagnose some of the most complex diseases, in some of the most remote places with limited connectivity. You will build, maintain and evolve the product and data infrastructure to handle sensitive patient data, ML deployment and data capturing from sensors, that will then be used to improve on the existing models. If you’re looking for challenging and impactful work on the cutting edge of health tech, then look no further – we would love to hear from you!


Responsibilities



  • Build and maintain elements of a secure, reliable, and scalable platform that allows Feebris to support projects in different geographies

  • Collaborate with clinical and AI teams to design solutions for user requirements and challenges


Minimum Qualifications



  • Ability to come up with simple and elegant technical solutions

  • Demonstrated passion for great design and user experience

  • Solid understanding of the full software development lifecycle including application architecture design, testing and productionisation

  • Demonstrable experience with at least 2 parts of the stack: front-end on mobile & web / back-end on mobile & web / cloud infrastructure

  • At least 1 year of professional experience with 2 of: Javascript, React Native, React, Android, iOS, Kotlin, Swift, Flutter


Nice to Have



  • At least 1 year of professional experience building apps in React Native

  • At least 1 year of professional experience with backend and API development

  • At least 1 year of professional experience working with a major public cloud provider (Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services)

  • Experience integrating external devices or sensors with mobile app

  • Worked in a regulated industry before (e.g. medical devices, quality management system)

  • Deployed machine learning models (on device and/or as a cloud service)

  • Previous experience in designing architectures that scaled under high volumes of usage as well as ‘offline only’ use cases

  • Some experience or understanding of working with 3rd party SDKs and how Android/iOS integrations work

  • Capable of setting up automated and scalable testing practices in a continuous delivery environment


Benefits



  • Impactful work – help transform healthcare for billions of people worldwide

  • Real responsibility – make a direct, meaningful impact on Feebris' trajectory

  • Rockstar team – join our small team, all passionate about building something game-changing

  • Massive growth opportunity – potential to quickly grow into Senior Engineer through mentorship from our Lead Engineer, external mentors through our advisory board and expert networks

  • Output-driven work culture – get unlimited paid time off and flexible working hours & location

  • Awesome office – we have resident status at the Google for Startups Campus near Old Street

  • Competitive Salary - £35k - £55k

  • A piece of the pie - 0.5%-1.0% share options


Interview Process



  1. Phone conversation (30min)

  2. Technical assessment (technical test completed at home)

  3. Face to face interview (2 hours)


[1] Elina is a panellist on the "New Technologies, Innovations & Research in PHC" plenary of the WHO's International Conference for Primary Healthcare (Elina speaks @ 12:00, Panellist intros @ 05:45 and 25:30).

items.title: FULL STACK DEVELOPER
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=35, c=4, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=3, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=35}
items.content:
COMPANY CONTEXT


We are looking for an entrepreneurial full stack developer to help build an innovative B2B Fintech platform in the field of currency risk management & FX trading.  This is an exciting opportunity to work with a founding team to build a product that will disrupt the murky world of traditional banking and brokerage firms by providing SME clients with transparency and quality advisory solutions.


 


For the right candidate we offer both financial rewards, plus the opportunity to be the principle system architect and drive product development in an exciting, disruptive fintech start up.


 


To date the company has:



  • Developed unique and valuable IP within currency risk and FX trading analytics

  • Built a functional trading cost analysis platform in Java

  • Established a competent sales & marketing team and distribution strategy

  • Generated revenue from advisory services


 


THE ROLE:


 


As the first technology hire across the entire business, you’ll need to hit the ground running.  You are a passionate technologist that owns delivery from concept through to completion.


 


You will:



  • Collaborate on software design, maintenance, troubleshooting, and feature implementation

  • Provide accurate story and project estimations

  • Consistently write clean, modular, readable, testable and maintainable code

  • Create database schemas that represent and support business processes

  • Analyze and implement system architecture and structure requirements

  • Implement Unit test Requirements


 


The first task will be to bring our Java-based Transaction Cost Analysis tool from prototype to production MVP. The long-term responsibility will be to create a user-friendly SaaS platform. At a later stage this may involve utilizing a body of R & Python-based algorithms developed by one of our team. You will be responsible for designing the architecture, database structure and code the front end and back end.


 


SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:


 


The below list of skills is a starting point for technical discussion, obviously it is unlikely a candidate will have deep experience in all the areas stated. However, we expect suitable candidates to bring ideas and experience that will help guide decisions around suitable technologies and appropriate tech stack for maximum firm success. 


 


Skills



  • Full stack/backend development skills including C# and .NET.

  • Front-end: React or similar modern frontend libraries/frameworks

  • Back-end: .NET, C#, SQL Server, Web service (REST, ODATA, WCF), Oracle, AWS

  • Knowledge of Python

  • Strong understanding of Agile/Scrum methodology, Eclipse, Git and Jira

  • Experience with API integration, financial applications experience is especially valuable

  • Experience with version control workflows and tools (preferably Git)

  • Experience architecting large software systems and enterprise integrations, RDBNS databases in general

  • Solid grasp of and fluent in common design patterns tools

  • Relevant experience in the following technologies: Angular2, Bootstrap, CSS, Groovy, HTML, jQuery, REST Web Services and XHTML


 


Experience



  • Professional experience (>5 yrs) years of commercial development experience with a track record of delivering high-quality software products

  • Bonus to have worked in financial services or start-up environments and comfortable in an entrepreneurial environment 

  • Experience creating scalable processes, applications, data infrastructure and tools for integration with 3rd party services / systems

items.content:
Front-end developer with React or Angular2+

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Software Development, Technology Staffing, Web Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Soshace | No office location

Technologies

reactjs
javascript
node.js
frontend
angular

Job description

  • Are you looking for a remote work on international projects?
  • Are you looking for 40 hours a week workload?
  • Is it suitable for you to use time tracker at work?
  • Is your current qualification level Middle or Senior?

Soshace is an online platform that will provide you with remote work with hourly payment on modern projects lasting on average 6-9 months and more.

We are looking for a long-term partnership so when the first project ends we’ll find you a second one and after that the third and so on.

We expect you to work on our projects 8 hours a day Monday-Friday in your time zone. 

  • Do you have more than 3-year commercial experience with JavaScript?
  • Do you have a 1-year experience in commercial projects with one of the frameworks: React or Angular 2+?
  • Do you know HTML, CSS, cross-browser and adaptive layout?
  • Do you have experience in commercial projects with Node.js? (it would be a plus)
  • Can you provide a portfolio of relevant projects?
  • Do you have good writing and speaking skills in English (Upper-Intermediate and above)?

If you answer “yes” to all questions, send us your CV and be ready to provide a portfolio of projects you took part in.

The hourly rate we offer depends on your qualification level and geography:

  • Middle $20-$30 an hour
  • Senior $30-$50 an hour.

We have the next stages of the interview: 

  1. Primary interview (a detailed discussion of your resume and portfolio)
  2. Online test
  3. Interview with a technical specialist.
Apply now

About Soshace

Soshace is a community of professionals. Since 2015 we’ve made different projects with clients all over the world.
Our clients are companies from the USA, The UK, Australia, Canada and Europe.

We are looking for a broad range of freelancers that are professionals in web development!

We have a large pool of job offers (from our clients) including job offers with relocation opportunities.
We also offer remote work with hourly pay on exciting projects lasting 3 months and more.

Benefits

  • 100% Remote work
  • Flexible schedule
  • International projects
  • Team work
  • Modern technology stack
  • Different projects
  • Long-term partnership

Senior Frontend Developer We're motivated to code with a sense of purpose daily

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Healthcare
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: kind | Malmö, Sweden

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Stockholm +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Malmö, Sweden. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

reactjs
react-native
javascript

Job description

Code With A Purpose - Senior Frontend Developer 

How We Started

Nine years ago, a happy husband and father of three was diagnosed with a rare form of brain cancer, and his family... read on here.

Who You Are

* Learning new things is your second nature.
* You've accomplished plenty and made enough mistakes to consider yourself experienced.
* You have an innate drive to ship your code and we trust you'll do it properly.

We want to offer the best possible experience for not only those in need of healthcare, but also those who deliver the care and we need your help to make it happen.

#front #back #end #engineer #senior #lead #full #stack

Apply now

About kind

What We Do

At Engaging Care, we want to make the best use of the knowledge and passion within healthcare to help everyone who needs help, by making it available anywhere, anytime. Our solution is a cloud-based communication and information platform.

Who We Are 

We're a bunch of people driven by the same mission, the same sense of purpose - to make things just a little better for everyone. Our environment is open, diverse and fun. We learn, develop and grow together!

Where We Are

Some of us sit here in Malmö while other team members are distributed in various parts of the world. So, anyone is welcome!

Benefits

  • We offer flexible working hours
  • You of course get paid vacations
  • And also wellness allowance
  • Work remote if you want to
  • And, we treat each other like family

Minimum Required Skills:
Vue, JavaScript, MEAN, MongoDB, eXpress, Vue.js, Node.js, REACT, AWS, Angular

Job Type: Full Time, Permanent
Job Title: Full Stack Developer
Job Location: Boston - Remote
Job Salary: Above Market Base + Benefits + 401K perks
Job Requirements: MEAN Stack, MEVN Stack, JavaScript

We are a growing company in the health care/pharmaceutical industry that has had major success and massive sales revenue with our cutting edge health platform. This is a unique opportunity for candidates to be on the cutting edge of new product development within the patient support space.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- Competitive salary range + significant bonus potential + full benefits + stock options + Flexible PTO policy + Ideal location in downtown Boston + Sponsored wellness program, mobility within the company

What You Will Be Doing

- Build and maintain a state-of-the-art platform in the health/pharma industry
- Build a scalable web applications to build a secure, high-performing web application and back-end to address a complex and evolving set of business requirements
- Mentor other developers and assist in growing their skills and becoming contributing members of a high-velocity agile team

What You Need for this Position

- Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience required.
- Javascript (ES6 and beyond)
- One or more popular presentation libraries (Vue, Angular, React, etc.)
- Document-based data modeling - proficiency both conceptually (normal forms, non-relational, etc.) and in practice (experience w/ MongoDB or other document-based databases).
- RESTful API design
- Must be a full-stack developer, able to implement everything in a MEAN or MEVN stack paradigm
- Experience with microservices architecture - moleculer preferred
- Familiarity with HIPAA and related requirements for handling of sensitive data (e.g., encryption in motion and at rest, etc.)
- Experience with cloud paradigms and deployments (e.g., AWS)
- Experience with server-side caching mechanisms (e.g., Redis, etc.)
- Experience with the Linux operating system (e.g., Debian/Ubuntu)
- Experience with GIT-based source management (Stash, Bitbucket, etc.)

What's In It for You

- Competitive salary range + significant bonus potential + full benefits + stock options + Flexible PTO policy + Ideal location in downtown Boston + Sponsored wellness program, mobility within the companySo, if you are a Full Stack Software Engineer - MEAN Stack with experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

We are looking for a Software Engineer for a 6 month contract role (part time, around 20 hours per week). Our company is 100% virtual and this role is 100% REMOTE. The ideal candidate will have had experience with Agile and Kanban software development methodologies. We need someone with solid experience using JavaScript tech stack (Node.JS, Angular, Bootstrap).

A plus is someone that's familiar with HL7 Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resource. Having HL7 Clinical Document Architecture (CDA) experience is also great!

We need a talented individual who has good communication skills to support working in a remote environment.

What You Will Be Doing

-You will support the development of Trifolia-on-FHIR, Trifolia Workbench and other internal tools developed by the company

-Bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) is required
-5+ years of experience in software development
-Experience with Enterprise JavaScript technology stack, including Node.JS, Angular 2 and Bootstrap
-Ideally have experience with C# technologies (ASP.NET MVC, Visual Studio, SQL Server, Nuget)
-Ideally have experience with Java technologies (Eclipse/IntelliJ, JPA, Maven, HAPI FHIR Server)

items.content: Welligent, a fast-growing Electronic Health Record (EHR) software vendor based in Norfolk, is seeking an experienced mobile application developer to develop and support custom-developed Welligent apps. A leading national software vendor, Welligent provides a comprehensive, enterprise cloud-based software solution which comprises practice management, clinical, billing and reporting functions. Ancillary to its cloud-based solutions, Welligent also offers mobile apps which offer a sub-set of functionality or complementary functionality to our cloud-based solutions. Welligent's customers include community-based behavioral/health and human services providers in more than 30 states. Our company culture and environment has the excitement of a start-up with the intensity of a growing healthcare information technology company solving national issues. There is a pervasive sense that the work we do is making a big impact in the lives of our customers and those they serve.Job Duties Serve as the primary app developer and responsible for app design and UI, all development, testing, debugging and on-going enhancements Lead Welligent's mobile development initiatives as the primary app developer and grow Welligent's mobile practice area Responsible for the ongoing evolution of our existing mobile apps, to enhance functionality and provide a better experience for end users Working within our existing application frameworks, provide creative input, expertise and technical methods Make a significant impact by working directly with the company and product owners, developers and other team members to improve upon an existing strong enterprise application with an extensive national user base Work with the business users to understand and document functionality requirements Collaborate with other technical team members including Welligent's web-services team to understand/ensure data requirements are met As needed, perform business and data requirements gathering and data analysis tasks Identify and document relevant data design, process and specifications Willingness to understand business context and problems and communicate them clearly in written and oral format Requirements Bachelor's degree required Advanced knowledge/experience with Angular with Javascript Advanced knowledge/experience with Cordova and plugins Knowledge of jQuery, Ionic, FullCalendar framework Must be familiar with PouchDB integration for SQLite Experience with SQLite offline storage Basic knowledge of TypeScript Basic knowledge of C++ for comping Windows package Must be familiar with NodeJs package manager PHP (must be familiar with curl basic authentications) Data encryption - AES, Hash NodeJs, must be familiar with package manager using the command line Sass (a plus but not needed since UI already built) User interface design and front end development experience Knowledge of HTML, DHTML, CSS and JavaScript Experience with Android Studio, Xcode/Swift, Visual Studio Experience with Apple, Google, and Microsoft store submission process and knowledge of creating and publishing provisioning profiles and certificates for all platforms. Must be familiar with HTTP services Some knowledge of Red Hat Linux server, basic knowledge of command line connection using SSH Knowledge of relational database design Ability to work independently and solve complex software problems Strong analytical and problem solving skills Knowledge of Healthcare IT, EHR/EMR or clinical systems preferred Experience working in a small team to build and enhance complex enterprise software applications Green card or US Citizenship required BenefitsIn addition to health, dental and 401K benefits, Welligent's competitive perks and benefits include the potential for year-end bonus, flexible work schedule, casual office environment in an up-and-coming area of Norfolk near Old Dominion University, no dress code, Starbucks coffee and an amazing group of co-workers.

items.content:
Software Engineer (New Readers)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Education Technology, eLearning, Non-Profit
Company size: 201–500 people
Company: Wikimedia Foundation, Inc. | No office location

Technologies

php
javascript
css
html5

Job description

Location: Remote

Summary

Wikimedia projects are built to be collaborative, multilingual and usable by people from around the world. The New Readers Engineering team works on products that deliver compelling experiences to Wikipedia readers in emerging markets, driving increased adoption and retention of Wikipedia. 

We are currently working on product intervention explorations that will be gradually rolled out for users later in the year. As a Software Engineer on the team you will be working with Software Engineers, Product Managers, Designers and QA Engineers to develop user interface features, fix bugs, review code and participate in engineering discussions that influence our project decisions. You will be mostly working on PHP, JavaScript, CSS, HTML5.

Our team is fully remote and team members work from various places around the world.

As a Software Engineer, we would like you to do:

  • Follow open source software development discipline when working with the rest of the team such as using bug trackers, version control, review systems, asynchronous communication methods (chat/email) etc.

We value:

  • Clear and concise communication of complex ideas about software and software development
  • A desire to create features for everyone, everywhere and to optimize at the intersection of performance and user perception
  • Comfortable working in a multi-cultural, remote, distributed team across various time zones
  • An interest in working with legacy software and modernizing code
  • Instrumenting new and core features and maintaining a set of key performance indicators

Requirements

  • Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science or STEM field; or equivalent professional experience
  • 3-5+ years related professional experience
  • knowledge in PHP, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, and modern web standards is a must. 
  • Knowledge of developing and debugging in Linux/Unix (LAMP) environments.
  • Interest in focused software engineering: you enjoy writing unit tests, reviewing code and responding to code reviews, and discussing architectural approach
  • Passionate about free knowledge and open source
  • Willing to travel occasionally - sometimes internationally - for team and organizational meetings
  • Must be located in timezone between EST (Eastern Standard Time) and IST (Indian Standard Time)

Plus

  • Familiarity with JS libraries like jQuery
  • Familiarity with open source software development processes
  • Experience of working in open source project communities
  • Knowledge about internationalization
  • Experience of presenting your work at conferences or tech talks.
  • Working knowledge of a language other than English would be valuable

We'd like to see your work!  Here are a few things you'll need:

  • If you have any existing open source software that you've developed (these could be your own software or patches to other packages), please share the URLs for the source. Links to your projects on GitHub, GitLab, BitBucket, etc. are exceptionally useful.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

U.S. Benefits & Perks*

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
  • Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays - including the last week of the year.
  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
  • For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
  • Great colleagues - diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

*Eligible international workers' benefits are specific to their location and dependent on their employer of record

More information

WMF
Blog
Wikimedia 2030
Wikimedia Medium Term Plan
Diversity and inclusion information for Wikimedia workers, by the numbers
Wikimania 2019
Annual Report - 2017

Apply now

About Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.

The Wikimedia Foundation is...

...the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

Benefits

  • Fully paid premiums for medical, dental & vision insurance premiums
  • 401(k) with 4% matching contribution
  • 7-12 weeks parental leave with 100% pay + lactation room
  • Wellness Program ($1800 annual) to promote wellness & personal growth
  • Pre-tax savings plans for Transportation & Parking
  • Flexible work schedules and remote working options
  • Pet Friendly office
  • Commitment to diversity & inclusion throughout the employee lifecycle
  • 12 days vacation, 19 days holiday, 2 days volunteer work and more!
  • Lean more at https://wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/Work_with_us

items.content:
Interpersonal Frequency

Front End Drupal 7 8 Developer

Interpersonal Frequency (I.F.) is seeking a Front-end Drupal 7 / 8 Developer to add to its growing Development team.  Who you are: * You’re a professional Front-end Drupal Developer/Themer who creates straightforward user experiences and designs beautiful, custom websites. * You adhere to Drupal standard practices and can interface seamlessly with both designers and back-end developers.  * You bring both creativity and maturity to your work: you’re a self-starter who can jump in quickly and can manage your own time effectively in a remote work environment.  * You’re a team player who loves technology, communicates clearly (verbally and in writing), learns quickly and always carefully unit tests code before hand off. * You’re skilled at and experienced with collaborating effectively with remote colleagues while working from home.  * You don’t mind travel to various locations (averaging twice per quarter). Requirements:  * You must either be a US Citizen or already have a Green Card to apply * 4+ years of experience in the field and/or formal training required  * Strong knowledge Drupal 7 and/or 8 theme development concepts  * Ability to work in a team environment, from creating sites that meet all design requirements, to integrating code from the back-end development team and interacting with clients, both technical and non-technical  * Ability to anticipate and adapt to changing conditions and opportunities * Expert level Javascript and jQuery  * Ability to read and understand concepts from user stories, comps and wireframes  * Ability to interact with clients, both technical and non-technical * Excellent verbal and written communication skills * Strong HTML5 skills; knowledge of how to use appropriate CSS hooks to limit the number of classes and IDs required on a page  * Deep understanding of CSS3 inheritance and how to use it to your advantage  * Strong commitment to managing maintainable, scalable, cross-browser and mobile code across a large site  * Familiar with source control principles of Git or similar  * Willingness to travel to various locations across the United States * Demonstrated commitment to I.F. Purpose & Principles based on employment history, experience and interview(s). Bonus Skills:  * Understanding of MV* application design methodology  * Knowledge of Responsive Design Patterns  * Work with SASS, Foundation/Twitter Bootstrap  * Understanding of JavaScript callbacks, including AJAX/AHAH * Knowledge of build scripts, e.g. Gulp or Grunt  * Familiarity with HTML template systems, e.g. Twig, Handlebars * Experience in building social sites or apps (Facebook, Twitter, etc.)   Why work with us?  * Fun, cutting edge remote work environment – ever changing, always a chat away from team members  * Your work directly impacts the lives of millions of Americans every day  * Healthcare, and Dental/Vision/Life/Disability plans  * Unlimited vacation, and a flexible schedule  * Work in a mostly virtual environment or a coworking location. If you work virtually, be prepared to travel at least once a quarter for face-to-face with the team.  If you are interested, and are a US citizen, please send your cover letter, resume, and some code samples or examples of past work to [email protected] Interpersonal Frequency LLC is an Equal-Opportunity Employer (EOE).

items.content:
Web Developer 5 – Cyber Security at Wells Fargo

Remote
  • Location: Minneapolis MN United States
  • Job ID: 5507255-1

Job Description:

At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. We re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

Wells Fargo Technology sets IT strategy; enhances the design, development, and operations of our systems; optimizes the Wells Fargo infrastructure footprint; provides information security; and enables continuous banking access through in-store, online, ATM, and other channels to Wells Fargo s more than 70 million global customers.

Note: This position is open to any core Wells Fargo location including telecommute.

We have an excellent opportunity for an experienced Web Developer to develop full life cycle web applications. Primary responsibilities will include:

  • Leads the development and implementation of highly complex applications in support of Enterprise Information Security Continuous Monitoring.
  • Uses advanced knowledge of web technologies, including Java, Java Script, HTML, Kendo UI, Angular JS, XML, ASP, Dependency injection, SQL, multimedia applications, database modeling tools and/or database interactions.
  • Works with multiple data platforms to deliver best cyber security solutions to protect Wells Fargo customers: RDBMS, Hadoop/Hive/Spark, Splunk.
  • Evaluates systems specifications for client area web site requirements and determines and implements the most efficient and cost effective software/package solution
  • Researches and tracks new web technologies, develop service applications, and analyze business requirements as they pertain to web-based systems.
  • Responsible for system quality assurance and consistency with installation and security policy and standards.
  • May provide direction and guidance to less experienced staff.

Required Qualifications

  • 7+ years of web development experience; including programming and developing web applications
  • 7+ years of .net experience
  • 6+ years of C# experience
  • 2+ years of MVC (Model-View-Controller) Framework experience
  • 3+ years of Web Services experience
  • 2 + years of JavaScript Frameworks experience (jQuery, Ext JS, Kendo UI and/or Angular JS)

Desired Qualifications

  • Experience programming or developing applications
  • Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
  • 5+ years of HTML (HyperText Markup Language) experience
  • SDLC (System Development Life Cycle) experience
  • 4+ years relational database management system (RDBMS) experience
  • Knowledge and understanding of Agile
  • Knowledge and understanding of Entity Framework
  • Knowledge and understanding of information security principles, policies, and procedures
  • Knowledge and understanding of banking or financial services industry
  • Experience working in a large enterprise environment
  • Ability to work cohesively and collaborate with analytic functions throughout the organization

Other Desired Qualifications

  • Experience with Big Data technologies (Hadoop/Hive/Spark, Splunk) or willingness to learn

Job Expectations

  • Ability to travel up to 10% of the time
Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=65, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=47}
items.content:
REMOTE: Software Developer (m/w/d) Ruby on Rails

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Company: HAUSGOLD - talocasa GmbH | Hamburg, Deutschland

Remote details

Office Location: Hamburg, Deutschland. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

ruby-on-rails
ruby

Job description

HAUSGOLD digitalisiert den Verkaufsprozess von Immobilien für Verkäufer, Käufer und Makler mit dem Ziel mehr Transparenz und Effizienz zu schaffen. Unsere eigenentwickelte Software und eine professionelle Kundenbetreuung bilden zusammen mit unserem Netzwerk von mehreren tausend Maklern vor Ort eine einzigartige Basis für unser weiteres Wachstum.

Anfang 2014 gegründet, haben wir uns inzwischen zu einem der führenden PropTech Unternehmen im deutschsprachigen Raum entwickelt. Unser Team aus mittlerweile über 50 Mitarbeitern und namhafte Investoren wie der Deutschen Bank oder Rocket Internet bilden die Basis unseres Erfolgs.

Wir vergrößern unser Development-Team und suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Dich als Software Developer (m/w/d) Ruby on Rails in Hamburger Schanzenviertel oder Remote.

WELCHE AUFGABEN AUF DICH WARTEN

Als Ruby on Rails Developer bei HAUSGOLD konzipierst, entwickelst und wartest Du Services in unserer serviceorientierten Architektur und hilfst uns vorhandene monolithische Systeme abzulösen. Du entwickelst Schnittstellen für Web und Mobile und dokumentierst Deine Arbeit für das Team. Neben Codereviews und Workshops unterstützt Du unser Team mit Deinem Know-How.

Einen kleinen Einblick bekommst Du hier: https://hausgold.github.io/ 

DEINE QUALIFIKATIONEN

  • Du verfügst über eine Ausbildung oder ein Studium im Bereich der Informatik oder hast einen vergleichbaren Abschluss
  • Du hast sehr gute Kenntnisse in Ruby on Rails
  • Du hast Erfahrung mit agiler Softwareentwicklung
  • Du hast Erfahrungen mit der Versionsverwaltung unter Git
  • Du nutzt REST-APIs und TDD/BDD
  • Idealerweise hast Du bereits Erfahrungen mit Docker sammeln können
  • Konzentriertes und sorgfältiges Arbeiten sowie eine strukturierte und koordinierte Arbeitsweise runden Dein Profil ab

Darüber hinaus sind folgende Kenntnisse von Vorteil

  • Bootstrap mit Sass
  • Grundkenntnisse in der Frontend-Entwicklung mit Angular oder React
  • Erfahrung mit Responsive Design unter der Verwendung von HTML5 und CSS3

Im Übrigen handeln wir nach der Maxime, dass man nicht alles schon können muss, aber gerne lernen möchte.

WAS WIR DIR BIETEN

DEINE BENEFITS

  • Hier kannst Du proaktiv Fragen stellen, brainstormen und auch in Remote zusammen mit Deinen Kollegen arbeiten
  • Du hast eine zuverlässige Entwicklungsumgebung mit u.a. High-Speed Internet und Phone Access
  • Bei uns hast Du ein Umfeld, in dem Du fokussiert und ohne Ablenkung arbeiten kannst

WAS HAUSGOLD DIR DARÜBER HINAUS BIETET

  • Ein aufstrebendes Technologieprojekt mit professioneller Entwicklungsmethodik
  • Eine anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit mit täglich neuen Herausforderungen
  • Agile Softwareentwicklung
  • Flexible und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitszeitgestaltung
  • Ein freundliches Arbeitsumfeld in einer der schönsten Städte Deutschlands
  • Frisches Obst und kostenlose Getränke
  • Sympathisches und agiles Team, mit dem es Spaß macht zusammen zu arbeiten
  • Regelmäßige Team-Events und die unternehmensübergreifende Gelegenheit zum fachlichen Austausch
  • Du entscheidest selbst, mit welchem System Du am liebsten arbeiten möchtest: Mac, Linux, Windows - Du wählst und wir organisieren Dir Deinen Rechner

BEWERBUNG

Du bist Developer aus Leidenschaft und hast Lust Dich in unserem Internet-Startup einzubringen? Dann bewirb Dich ONLINE mit Deinem aussagekräftigen Lebenslauf inklusive der Angabe Deines möglichen Eintrittstermins sowie Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung.

Deine Ansprechpartnerin ist Lynda. Melde Dich gerne bei uns, falls Du Fragen zu Deiner Bewerbung hast.

Apply now

items.content:
Ruby on Rails / React Developer

At Planning Center, we build powerful, beautiful applications specifically for churches. Each of our apps has a dedicated team of designers and developers who are committed to refining and expanding their specific app in response to real customer needs. Our customers include over 90 of the 100 largest churches in the country, but also tens of thousands of small community and neighborhood churches, and we strive to make day-to-day operations easier for all of them.

We’re a development driven company — over half our staff are either developers or designers who code, and even our founder spends much of his time programming — and we’re seeking another developer with expertise in Ruby, Rails, and React to help make our software even better.




Developers at Planning Center are:
  • Invested. We care about the products we create and the people we create them for, and we all contribute to the vision and direction of our apps. Every one of our developers is critical to their team.
  • Curious. We aren’t afraid to ask questions, experiment, and iterate. We also love playing with fun new technologies, and we have Free Weeks every few months for exploring projects that spark our interest.
  • Humble. We are always looking for opportunities to grow and learn from one another.

We believe the strongest teams are made up of people with diverse backgrounds and experiences, and we are committed to cultivating that diversity here at Planning Center. We are ready for the ongoing work that goes into building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do your best work.

In your daily life at Planning Center, you could expect to:
  • Take ownership of your projects and have a voice in how to best complete them
  • Collaborate with your product manager, front-end designer, and fellow app team developers
  • Engage in an agile development process
  • Make coffee eight different ways in our rad coffee bar
  • ...or, if you’re remote, drink coffee in a hip co-working space that we help pay for
  • Do work you’re proud of alongside a team of smart, thoughtful, like-minded developers

What to Expect If You Apply



There's no reason for this process to be an adventure full of unknown surprises! Here's what you're getting yourself into:
  1. Submit your resume.
  2. We'll have a quick and casual phone call (10-15 minutes) to introduce ourselves and to double check that this position is the type of position that you are interested in and could be a good fit for.
  3. You'll be sent a programming exercise covering the basics of the tech stack that we use at Planning Center (Ruby, Rails, and React). This is an opportunity for you to see a glimpse of the kind of work you'd be doing here, and for us to begin evaluating technical skills.
  4. A live pair programming exercise with our team. There's no whiteboards, and no typing! Someone from our team will type as the two of you work through a pair programming exercise together. You'll get to meet another potential future co-worker, and we'll get a glimpse into how you work as we make some tests pass together.
  5. Pack your bags, you're coming to San Diego! The final step is a day in our San Diego office where you'll get to meet our leadership team and members of your potential new product team. It will be a full day of interviews with different people where we'll both have lots of chances to find out if we're a good fit for each other.
  6. It's offer time! Throughout all the previous steps, your expertise and experience have been assessed against our well defined developer levels and the salary amount of the offer will be decided solely based on that assessment. At Planning Center, every developer of the same skill level makes the same amount (plus a small bonus for seniority). We aim to pay at the 90th percentile for each level based on research from Payscale.
REQUIREMENTS
  1. Eligible to work in the United States.
  2. If remote, must be willing to travel to the office four times each year to connect with the rest of the team in person.
  3. Proven experience as a full stack developer (or similar role) using Ruby, Rails, and React.
BENEFITS



We love our people and want this to be the best place for them to work. In addition to a competitive salary (starting between $100,000 - $150,000 depending on expertise), we offer:



  • Full health, dental, and vision coverage
  • Company contribution to a 401(k)
  • Mobile phone allowance
  • Co-working stipend
  • Health stipend for counseling or a gym membership
  • Charitable giving match
  • Paid parental leave
  • Vacation and paid holidays
  • Paid Fridays off in the summer 
  • Continual education allowance for books, videos, or conferences
  • Free weeks every several months to work on a project of your choosing
Gear



The things you need to get your job done - laptop, monitor, standing desk, chair - all on us!



Work from Anywhere in the USA



We are dedicated to hiring the best talent available; part of working at Planning Center is the option to work remote! We fly our remote team into the office once every quarter, so you can enjoy the nice California weather and connect with the rest of the team (75% of which is remote).

items.title: Qualio: Senior Software Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=22, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=26}
items.content:
Senior Software Developer

DESCRIPTION


Qualio's SAAS platform takes the pain out of compliance and helps mid sized life sciences organizations accelerate time to market.


What is the opportunity?


We are hiring a Senior Software Developer in the EMEA region to join our distributed product development team. We're looking for someone who is continuously learning and improving their software skills and who will grow with the company. We primarily use Python and Javascript so we are keen to hear from you if you have experience working with these.


What will I be doing?


Working remotely, you will join our development team to deliver new features and improve existing ones. You will be an active influencer in technical discussions and contribute to the evolution of our internal systems and processes. Ideally, you will be comfortable working on client facing interfaces as well as deep down in the engine room.


In your first 3 months you will be:


  • Up to speed on core technologies and the Qualio software development life-cycle.
  • Working independently, developing new product features as a key part of our product team.
  • Contributing as an active voice to discussions around new technologies and tools for application development.
  • Supporting other team members with their assigned work, and assisting with code reviews.

Who are you?


  • You have strong written and verbal communication skills (in English).
  • You have over 5 years of professional software development experience.
  • You are passionate about problem solving and excited to solve problems.
  • You are an architect, a designer, a project leader, not just a programmer.
  • You are passionate about customers and deliver software which delights them.
  • You believe in code reviews and automated testing as a core part of writing great software.
  • You deploy and own your code in production. You monitor it and make it incrementally better for the benefit of your customers.

Required Skills


  • At least 3 years expertise in creating web applications using object-oriented Python.
  • Proficiency in at least one Python framework.
  • Proficiency in relational databases (PostgreSQL is preferred).
  • Proficiency in modern JavaScript (ES 2016).
  • Experience with Celery, REST APIs, e2e and unit testing and Hands-on Git experience.

Preferred Skills


  • Experience with AWS, CI/CD, web security and DevOps - Unix based OS (Debian/Ubuntu): cron, automation via bash scripting, monit, etc.
  • Experience with using Docker in a production environment.
  • Professional experience with Pyramid and Flask web frameworks
  • Proficiency in: AngularJS, React/Redux
  • Experience with SqlAlchemy, Elasticsearch, RabbitMQ, Redis
  • Knowledge of or willingness to learn concepts of GraphQL APIs.

BENEFITS


In addition to playing an important role in building Qualio, you'll receive:


  • Competitive salary;
  • Meaningful equity;
  • Flexible holidays;
  • Opportunity to make a difference through helping life-saving products to get to market.

items.content:
UpMail is changing the way salespeople use emails and we’re having great success digitalising what tend to be a very traditional industry. We’re doing this with in an innovative recommendation engine suggesting users what to say and which content to share, making it easy and accessible for everyone to increase sales performance.

We're looking for a Developer to lead our B2B SaaS product, bring UpMail to the next level and shape the sales acceleration technology industry.

Launched 4 years ago, we’ve remained a small remote international team including web-developers, sales and customer success experts.

This opportunity comes at an exciting point in our journey: we’ve grown our client base in over 15 countries, which now includes well-known hotel groups like Radisson Hotel Group, NH Hotels, Wyndham, Jurys Inn, Virgin, and Best Western.

We’ve most recently launched commercial partnerships with a few global players in the industry and we're getting ready for additional global expansion.

This position is ideal for someone ready for a lead developer role who wants to continue developing his/her management skills and business sense. He or she will have the opportunity to work with the founder on UpMail's high level B2B SaaS technology road map and architecture and run the day-to-day operations and delivery of a rapidly evolving product.

If you always dreamed to launch your own business, but never had the opportunity to do so, this is the role for you as you have the chance to make an important impact on a funded startup with a proven business model.

Technology stack: Ruby on Rails, PostgreSql, JQuery, VueJS, Typescript.

REQUIREMENTS

* A commercially experienced Ruby on Rails full-stack developer with good working knowledge of backend/frontend/DevOps principles. Experience with VueJS would be a nice-to-have but not a necessity.
* Comfortable supporting the development of a technology strategy to deliver a market leading product
* Able to understand business requirements and priority of a fast growing startup
* Experienced building and maintaining reliable, performant, secure web apps
* Good communicator
* Work with a small high-performance team who will fight beside you to accomplish the amazing

BENEFITS

* Great and open-minded company culture built by an international team
* High versatility in the type of projects
* Flexibility with schedule, working hours and location
* Incredible opportunity to create meaningful, scalable and successful tech company
* Competitive salary and equity
* Based in a great co-working space in West London

items.title: Open Source Web Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=12, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=43, embedded=0, frontend=45}
items.content:
Open Source Web Developer

At Crowd Favorite, we’re protective of our culture, our process, and our clients. When you do join our team, you’ll quickly realize this isn’t like other jobs. It’s a transformative experience.

We’re currently seeking an experienced Open Source web developer to work on a mixture of PHP software projects.

Here’s what you can expect:


The Autonomy. We’re not looking for order-followers. You’ll be given responsibility and flexibility to make your own decisions.

The Balance. Crowd Favorite isn’t a boiler room. We’d generally rather you work smart and take time to recharge. 

The Favoriteers. You’ll be part of a real team. We’re a tight-knit group that respects and supports each other. You’ll know your team has your back - one for all and all for one!

Here’s who we’re looking for: 


Our ideal candidate is someone who finds satisfaction in solving complex problems, is willing to take initiative, is capable of managing competing tasks on their own while also embracing collaboration. We’re looking for someone whose experience with Open Source spans the development spectrum, but who has a particular area they’ve learned deeply. For example, you might understand several technologies, such as PHP, MySQL, SASS, plus knowing how to work with something like New Relic. This is great! You know enough about the various technologies required to build and launch a site. One of those technologies, though, that’s where you find enjoyment. That’s your specialty, your technological Happy Place. Maybe you’re a CSS wizard, or you can write PHP unit tests with your eyes closed. These are the types of developers we’re looking for.

The following are different examples of the Open Source experience we’re looking for. You might not hit all of these, but these are examples of scenarios and experience needed:

  • Can communicate and collaborate with other engineers, designers, and business stakeholders in a remote team environment
  • Can write clean, elegant front-end code
  • Believes Web standards and usability are essential to the success of any site
  • Knows CSS well, including how to work with various devices and use the latest methods while providing degradation for less-recent browser versions
  • Understands front-end templating, especially PHP and React
  • Can write modern, standards-compliant PHP (is familiar and comfortable using PHPCS, and writing against published standards such as WordPress or PEAR)
  • PHP7 is your default
  • Can write performant, functional Javascript
  • Has worked with Laravel 5, including optimizations for scale
  • Has a fundamental understanding of REST APIs, including the WordPress REST API
  • Can parse and understand MySQL queries and rewrite them as necessary for performance
  • Is familiar with writing unit tests and acceptance tests
  • Has an understanding of issues related to scaling high-performance and high-traffic websites, including the importance of quick-loading pages and how to create performant code
  • Has working knowledge of various javascript frameworks and libraries, including React, Vue, Node, and the ever-present jQuery 
  • Knows their way around a server—basic web server configuration, cron management, package management (apt or similar), basic shell familiarity, and other housekeeping skills - the Command Line, in other words
  • Has an understanding of virtualization and experience with some flavor of virtual environments such as Docker or Vagrant
  • Knows Git and adheres to a workflow, including deployment and continuous integration tools
  • Has familiarity with task runners and can contribute to front-end workflows (Gulp, NPM, Grunt, Bower, etc.)
  • Has excellent problem-solving skills, including analysis, identification of a problem, and clearly outlining a path to a solution 


 While not required, we’d love it if you had experience/familiarity with:
  • Amazon Web Services
  • Using and extending WP-CLI
  • Configuration and deployment of Redis, Memcached, and Varnish
  • Disconnected front-end websites from CMS back-ends.
  • Building and managing software testing, including:
  • Performance testing
  • Unit testing
  • Integration testing
  • Acceptance testing
  • Writing scripted migrations
  • Can design, build, and maintain performant and well-organized databases
  • Can review and interpret business and technical requirements and create working tasks
  • Sharing your knowledge through training, blog posts, or documentation

Is Crowd Favorite the right place for you? If you’re interested in joining our team, get in touch! We look forward to getting to know you. 
Apply now

items.content:
Senior Frontend Engineer

Company: 64 Robots
Location: Remote
Job type: Freelance
Skills:
  • #tailwind
  • #vue
  • #vuejs
  • #vuex
  • Jest
  • TailWindCSS
  • vue

    • Company description

    We are 64 Robots! Founded in 2016, 64 Robots is a full service agency focused on on beautiful, clean Vue.js single page applications with a Laravel backend.



    We're based in Baltimore, but have developers all over the world including Spain, Brazil and Ghana. We value the quality of your code and your passion for development rather than where you're from.

    Job description

    Who we're looking for

    • 3+ years frontend experience, ideally with extensive experience using some combination of Vue.js, Vuex, TailwindCSS, etc
    • Passionate about the quality of your code and the decisions you make to get there
    • Desire to constantly learn, improve and grow with our team
    • Ability to work independently and make wise choices confidently during development
    • Many of our web apps are visually stunning so ability to implement a pixel perfect responsive design using TailwindCSS is necessary
    • Fluent English

    What you will be doing as a Senior Frontend Engineer

    • Building brand new projects from start to finish, you'll have the opportunity to see product's through every stage of life
    • Bug fixes and feature additions on existing products
    • Writing frontend tests to ensure the stability of our products
    • Maintaining and creating open source packages for the greater Vue community to take advantage of
    • Communicate using our remote toolchain including Slack, Trello, Notion, Zoom, etc

    What technologies you'll be using:

    • Vue.js
    • Nuxt.js
    • Vuex / vue-router / vuelidate
    • TailwindCSS
    • Jest / Vue test utils
    • ES6
    • Webpack

    What we offer:

    • The freedom to work however you work best. We don't care what hours you work, we want you to be the most productive you. Some overlap with EST timezone necessary for communication at times.
    • Get the chance to make a difference from day 1. We want you to be a part of our biggest projects and guiding the decisions that will make them great
    • Attend conferences around the world. Goal is 1 a year per team member. We've recently attended a number of conferences including Laracon US, Laracon EU, Vue Amsterdam, SXSW and Collision
    Apply now!

Remote React/React Native Developer

London

The sharing model has changed many sectors as we know it.

UBER and AirBNB have triumphed this model and a number of organisations are following suit to significantly disrupt major sectors as we know them.

TEC Partners are working with an already profitable start-up who have the ambition to be the next major player in this space.

Working with a modern JavaScript Stack - React, Redux, React Native and Node you will be responsible for building a world class, scalable experience.

The initial requirement will have you working Frontend but as time moves on you will be working across the stack.

This is a fully remote roll and you will be liaising with a distributed team based across London.

Requirements of the React | React Native Developer:

Experience with React and Ideally React Native
HTML, CSS and preprocessors
Webpack
Git
2-3 years Development experience

Nice to Have for the React | React Native Developer:

React Native Experience
Experience working with Node
AWS

Benefits of the React | React Native Developer:

All of the bells and whistles that come with working in a modern London based start-up including Equity.

Full Remote Working.

An opportunity to make a real impact in a fast-growing start-up that will provide clarity in a market where clarity is most definitely needed.

For more information please contact Mark Beer on

Based in Rockville, MD, we are an extremely fast-growing award-winning web & mobile application development company that is building cutting edge technology solutions. Our highly innovative solutions have already taken the industry by storm and we aim to continue our campaign to produce something that our clients/consumers truly benefit from. This is not your typical development role.

You will be directly involved in the design and development of cutting edge business applications, that are vital to our companies success. We are profitable, rapidly expanding, and ready to make a huge investment into our IT department to make sure we can keep up with demand, and offer our customers a unique/awesome experience.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- Competitive salary - up to $140,000
- Telecommute part of the week (You must reside in the DC area)
- Vacation/PTO
- Medical, Dental, Vision
- 401k match

What You Will Be Doing

- Writing native mobile and web applications
- Design and release products and features
- Scaling products
- Develop & test code
- Conduct quality assurance on all new code

What You Need for this Position

- Experience deploying iOS/Android apps
- Cordova/Ionic/PhoneGap

- Node.js, Angular, Backbone
- RESTful API/Web Services/API Integration
